story:
Hey Everyone!

My name is Mark Baker, I am a professional cook who grew up in Toronto but has adopted Hamilton as my home town.  I love this city and the diverse and eclectic food offerings we have to offer.  I'd like to have the opportunity to join them and help my city grow even MORE!


In a nutshell, I'd like to open a takeout restaurant where I can serve customers, awesome and delicious, healthy comfort foods and favorites and at the same time have fun showing off my creative side and making you smile.  Ever heard of a Grilled PB and J? How bout a Cheeseburgerdilla? Yup(I know right?)...I have and they're AWESOME! You can get them from me at MERK if you help me get there.


I love making good food for people.  The best part of my day is when I'm chatting with customers and they say "Remember that time you made me a *insert food item here*?..." and that look of lingering "YUM!" comes over their face.  Even when I watch kids eat something as simple as my fresh cut fries and their faces light up!  That is what I want to do everyday, for every customer that comes into my place.


Career Highlights:

-Worked under Hamilton's Chef of the Year 2008 Michael Campanaro at The Old Powerhouse

-Worked at Rattlesnake Point Golf course under Chefs Kevin Watson and Winston Lewis, Winners of the Roxul Culinary Challenge

-Played a key role in opening Memphis Fire Barbeque Company Winona, Ontario

-Created the signature desert at Sharkey's World Grill in Oakville, Ontario

-Introduced new menu items at The Phoenix at MacMaster University

-Planned and implemented 3 menus for Topshelf Sports bar and Crossbar and Grill


I have been cooking since I was 14 years old, and have always been attached to this industry to some degree.  I have worked with and for many notable and awarded Chefs in Hamilton and Halton Region.  I currently run 2 successful sports bars in Burlington, and I am ready to have my OWN place!


What I Need & What You Get

The reason I am doing this crowd fund campaign is two fold. 1. To acquire a location as well as purchase the equipment necessary to launch my business.   I will need to get new signs installed and renovation work to the interior.
2. Acquiring loans for a restaurant is VERY difficult and there are very few opportunities if any for small business grants for restaurant start-up. 
***UPDATE**Your contributions will help me in the following ways:
[ ] $2000/initial payment for the location King street and Hilda avenue 
[ ] $12000 installation of venting equipment
[ ] $10000 purchase of major kitchen equipment
[ ] $1200 Purchase of kitchen smallwares and Initial raw product
[ ] $5000 renovations
[ ] $2700 licensing and inspection

What I need from you folks would be some help building capital.    In order to accomplish this I would need a boost!

In exchange for your contributions I would offer the following:

$20 Thank you for your help!

$50 All contributions over $50 get you 10% back in MERK gift cards
$100 I will shout you out in a Video made specially for you!+ 10% off to MERK

$200 I will give you a T shirt or Baseball hat with MERK logos! Everyone likes SWAG right?!
$500 I will name an item on my menu in your honor! I'll even let you choose which one!

$1000 I will host a cooking class for you and 3 friends in your house!
+$1000 I will have you to MERK before I open the door for a special Menu Sampling! As well I will give you your first 3 Meals FREE when you come in

The Impact

I intend to buy local first! That means all of my produce, meat, dry goods and paper products will first be sourced right here in Hamilton before I look elsewhere.  Supporting local businesses in the city will help us all.  

The intended location for MERK is in an area called the Sherman Hub.  The central part of Hamilton's up and coming Ward 3 community which also houses Tim Horton's Field, home of the Hamilton Tiger Cats!  This area is very under served in the regard that there are  few restaurants in the area, and even fewer that offer fresh, healthy and affordable food choices for take out.  MERK will meet that need!

The 2015 Pan Am Games will also be in Hamilton THIS SUMMER! With all Soccer Matches played at Tim Horton's Field.  MERK is within reach  of Tim Horton's field and will be able to capitalize on the increased foot traffic brought by this event.

Scott Park, Jimmy Thompson Pool and the proposed Mega High School for Hamilton are all within reach of MERK.  In the summer, Scott Park has baseball leagues.  I intend to sponsor a team and get my name out there even more.  Lets not forget the TI-CATS tailgating during Football season!

I love this city! Living here I also know all too well the social challenges faced everyday by the residents.  Hamilton has MANY outreach programs and I plan to give back to the community as much as possible.  I plan to donate a percentage of my profit directly to charities such as Living Rock Youth Ministries and the James Street Mission.

Risks & Challenges

A restaurant is a challenge that is for sure! I have had several years managing kitchens as well as my own personal catering business.  I have excellent knowledge of food costing, cost management, sales trend analysis, money management and customer service.  I will do whatever it takes to make customers happy, while keeping my business operating happily. 

I have been on the front lines for a long time and see how difficult it can be to run a restaurant..I do not believe in a HANDS OFF type of business management. How can you know how your customers feel about what you are offering if you are not engaged with them constantly?  I am ready and able, I just need your help to get there!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Rachel Teichman. I am 17 years old, and this April, I am traveling with a few other Jewish teens to New Orleans, Tennessee, and Mississippi to complete service missions as well as learn about Jewish culture in the South. We will be working with, Common Ground Relief, Habitat for Humanity, and other service groups. This trip is important to me because it is a once in a lifetime opportunity to help others, learn about my culture in a new way, and travel to new places.

What We Need & What You Get

I need $650 to fund the trip. It will pay for airfare, meals, lodging, etc. During the preparation and course of the trip, we will be blogging about our experiences which you as a donor will have access to read. You will also get the satisfaction of knowing that a young adult is out there volunteering.  


The Impact

Some of the activities we will be doing are, helping with the damage that still exists from Hurricane Katrina, building houses with Habitat for Humanity, helping out in community gardens, and visiting Jewish congregations throughout the South. I have worked with other groups and gone on other service trips before.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate at this time, you can still help out by sharing this link and spreading the word to others about what I am doing. Also you can keep up with what we are doing through our blog. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Kurzbeschreibung:

Ich bin die Michaela vom ehemaligen Nexus Vienna und möchte das Geschäft mit eurer Hilfe wieder neu eröffnen.

Ich möchte ein Ladenlokal und einen Onlineshop mit all den schönen Sachen füllen, die mir und euch so gut gefallen haben und gefallen und euch einen Ort zum Wohlfühlen,Stöbern und Einkaufen schaffen.

Im Großen und Ganzen möchte ich aus dem Bereich  Gothic, Steampunk, Metal

Kleidung, Korsetts,Schuhe,Schmuck, Kosmetik,Magazine, Merchandise und eine kleine Auswahl an Horrorfiguren anbieten.


Mir liegt es echt am Herzen das Nexus wieder zu eröffnen, da es ,neben der Einkaufsmöglichkeit, immer ein Ort der Zusammengehörigkeit, eine Art eigene Welt in der jeder willkommen ist, war.

Und das möchte ich wieder ins Leben rufen.

Es gäbe auch schon ein passendes in Frage kommendes Mietobjekt.

Durch meine 10jährige Erfahrung bin ich überzeugt, das Nexus wieder zu dem tollen Ort machen zu können!


Um dir ein Bild über das vorherige Sortiment machen zu können , schau dir einfach die Nexus Facebookseite an


Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst


Wenn du das Projekt unterstützt, fließt das Geld in folgende Ausgaben:

  Mietkaution

  Ware Startkosten (Kleidung,Schuhe, Kosmetik, Korsetts)

Mir ist es auch wichtig von Anfang an Artikel in allen Größen, in vielen verschiedenen Ausführungen u für jede Preisklasse anbieten zu können!




Als Dank für jede Unterstützung kannst du dir verschiedenste 'Perks' sichern:

.) Limitierte T-Shirts

.) Die bekannte lebensgroße Todfigur als Beschützer für dein Heim

.) VipCards mit bis zu 15% Rabatt auf jeden Artikel ein Jahr lang

.) Sei das erste Flyermodel am ersten Nexusflyer nach der Neueröffnung

und noch viele mehr.....


Zusätzliche Perks werde ich in den nächsten Tagen auch noch hinzufügen!


Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

Auch wenn du keinen Beitrag leisten kannst, kannst du trotzdem helfen:

  Spreche über diese Kampagne, mache sie bekannt.

  Teile die Kampagne in Foren und sozialen Medien wie Facebook, Twitter, TumblR. Nutze dafür das Tool von Indiegogo.

  Teile die Nexus Facebookseite

 Du möchtest mein Vorhaben sponsern, jedoch nicht über das Crowdfunding? Dann melde Dich einfach über office@nexus.co.at oder über die Nexus Facebookseite.


Für die Unterstützung von 25.- bekommst du dieses Tshirt!


Unser Tod ist auch zu haben!

story:
Help children of Donbass

The main goal of my campaign to help orphans of Donbass. Because of military operations orphanages in the territory of east Ukraine appeared in catastrophic situation, there is no food, medicines, means of hygiene. The war which came to Donbass brought with itself not only the destroyed houses, the killed soldiers and civilians. It also the crippled destinies of children who will be able to forget not soon those horrors which they had to experience, living in cellars, spending the night on streets and seeing death of the parents. Let's together try prolong their childhood, to help to forget horrors of war.

How it will be done

On money received from you will purchase food, medicines,warm clothes, toys that will be transferred in several orphanages:
-Donetsk city Baby Orphanage.
Address: DNR,  Donetsk, Krasnoflotskaya Str., 68-a.
-Donetsk city Orphanage.
Address: DNR,  Donetsk, Inzhenernaya Str., 4.
- Amvrosijivka Orphanage.
Address: DNR,  Amvrosievka, Molodyozhnaya Str., 63.
 Then we will publish the report on the done work.

100% OF THE FUNDS RAISED WILL GO TO HELP PEOPLE IN DONBASS

A list of required products and medicines:

FOOD PRODUCTS

- Canned food (meat, fish, vegetables, oatmeal, condensed milk, canned fruit),
- Cereals, pasta
- Flour products (cookies, crackers, pretzels, waffles, etc.)
- Sugar, sand
- Baby food, formula
- Vegetable oil
- Bottled water, juices


MEDICINES

- Antiviral
- Painkillers 
- Antipyretic
- Hemostatic
- Anti-shock
- Individual first aid kits
- Cold and flu
- Antimicrobial

Against gastro-intestinal tract
- Antibiotics
- Dressings 
- Preparations for the cardiovascular system
- Insulins
- Infusion solutions

HYGIENE and DISINFECTION

- Soap, toilet, liquid
- Disposable razors
- Pampers 
- Disposable sheets 
- Toilet paper, paper towels, wet wipes, etc.
- Disinfection of premises

story:
The Ntegrity™ Project - A Cause for Safe Cosmetics

In 2001 Lucie Carle, Founder of NtegrityTM,  was faced with severe skin allergies and she suffered from eczema on her eyelids. It had reached a point where she could not put any make-up products on her face. After years of research and her discovery of the chemicals used in conventional cosmetic products, she made it her mission to create a healthy and effective line of skin care solutions. Her dream is that one day, her line will be available to all. She left her full-time employment as a mediator to dedicate her time to the cause for safe cosmetics and after 11 years of research and testing, she needs your support to make her line of products more accessible.

She created a line of plant-based cosmetics, called Phytocosmetics™, that is patent pending and that was nominated for two awards [Manning Award associated with the National Research Council of Canada and the Centre québécois de valorisation des biotechnologies (CQVB)].

Lucie and her team will be moving to a new laboratory that will include, proper air ventilation, machinery and space that her current manufacturing location could not offer. Your contributions will help her finance part of the equipment cost needed to produce her skin care line. This will also allow the products to be distributed as a next phase in the two largest provinces in Canada: Quebec and Ontario.

Your Contributions and Our Gift to You

We are currently trying to raise 4000$ to purchase a label machine, a specialized mixer for oils and a pressing machine for powders all needed for manufacturing.

In exchange for your generosity and to express our appreciation, we have included 4 unique perks you can choose from: a lip melt gloss made of moringa oil, three types of eyeshadow kits depending on your eye color.

If we do not reach our goal, the amount raised will still be put towards furnishing the new lab.

The Impact

In 2010, a study showed that 1 out of 2 individuals suffered from contact allergies or skin sensitivity due to the exposure of questionable chemical substances on the market. Furthermore, according to a study done by Stacky Malkin in 2008, author of the book “Not just a pretty face: the side effects of cosmetic chemicals”, women on average, use 12 products per day, which exposes them to 168 chemical ingredients.

Unfortunately, these are not just statistics: it is a sad reality for far too many people and the effect that chemicals can have on the skin are sometimes  irreversible.

Ntegrity™ has built a loyal base of customers that have not just purchased products but have learnt to read labels, identify their individual skin type needs and the appropriate use of products. We believe that through education and a better understanding of your skin, you will feel empowered to make better choices for yourself and the environment.

Risks & Challenges

One challenge that our project faces is the amount of competition that currently exists in the cosmetic industry. Consumers are often being misled on the properties and the results associated with conventional products. We believe that through educational workshops, through innovation, transparency, consumers will feel empowered to make better choices for their skin and health.

Another challenge we are facing is finalizing the business plan for our next stage of production and for the markets we have targeted. We are currently working with a team of coaches to help us identify next steps as we plan our transition to our new lab. We are exploring potential partnerships to widen our network in Quebec and Ontario.

Other Ways You Can Help

THANK YOU for reading our story and for your support. Please note that if you cannot contribute financially, you can still support our project and the cause for safe cosmetics by:

  1. Sharing our campaign

  2. Visiting our facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Ntegrity/123876411003615?ref=bookmarks

  3. Visiting our website at: www.ntegrity.ca

story:
Q: What is the #TallChefTallOrder Crowdfunding campaign?

A: Our goal is to raise the funds needed to stay and continue to contribute to the community of Erin. 

We want to continue serving freshly prepared foods using only high quality ingredients.  We want to serve delicious brunch and lunch, or cater it to go.  We want to serve you coffee, and help the community & our kids eat well at Barbour Fields and our Community Centre 2000.  We want to have you in for cooking classes and we want to be the center to build a food community on Main Street. 

Q: Why are you crowdfunding?

A: If we go to the bank we aren’t taken seriously as a small start up business and if we choose to look to investors, we would lose our autonomy.  We want to ensure we remain 100% committed to our goal of providing fresh, local, high quality food to our community customers.

Q: Why now?

A: There is exciting change coming to Erin and we want to be part of that.  In order to remain here, buying the building and buying it now is key.

Q: How can I donate?

A: Donations can be made online at thefriendlychef.ca or in-store.  We are offering up so many amazing rewards for donations, everything from free coffee to an exclusive event in PEI with Chef Michael Smith.  Come in and ask us more or visit thefriendlychef.ca

Q: What else is happening?

A: We’ve got a great silent auction with a host wonderful items donated by valued customers, community residents, Chef Michael Smith, ourselves at The Friendly Chef Adventures, local artists and more! Come into the store to see more or visit thefriendlychef.ca.  We’re also hosting a community barbecue on Sunday, September 13th and hope to see you there!

Q: What if I have more questions?

A: Come on in or simply give us a call! Our door is always open to our community members and we look forward to speaking with you.

Q:  What has been happening so far in week 1 of your campaign?

A:   We've had an incredible response from all across Canada.  Already celebrity Chefs like Chef Michael Smith and others have donated either items in the silent auction fundraiser or made financial contributions.  “I’m in awe of Chef Pam, she is a true hero and I’m proud to call her my friend,” said Chef Michael Smith.  “She understands the role that an inspiring, locally grounded restaurant can play in revitalizing and anchoring a community and I wish her all the best. I can’t wait to help cut the ribbon!" 

Town of Erin Mayor Al Alls has also proudly jumped behind my campaign.  “I have known Pam and her team since coming to Erin and she provides an excellent value to our Main Street with her food and friendly atmosphere,” said Mayor Alls. “Pam and team are the entrepreneurship Erin needs going forward in growing our Town.”  With the latest Economic Development Plan ready for Erin Council’s review, Chef Pam wants to be a driving force on Main Street in collaboration with other enthusiastic business owners to revive the downtown core.  

Between online and in store donations, including those from our silent auction bids and those who have committed to prepay for catering services we have raised $9,971.00

Q:  What is next? 

A:  We really need your support and online or in store contributions in the week ahead.   We need others across Canada and internationally to notice what we are trying to give back to our community by staying here and securing our future by buying this heritage building and your help to spread the word far and wide is critical. 

Essentially we are asking folks to simply prepay for services, gift cards, food, catering and classes that they already know they will be wanting to purchase from us so that we can raise the down payment for our building this month and make this reality happen.  For those  who don't know us or live afar you can contribute to our community's health and well being by simply making a donation.

story:
Havenwood. The journey begins...


Have you ever wanted to live the life of a medieval adventurer? Lean to fire a bow, wield a sword and ride through the forest with your companions to the feast that awaits you at the castle! Heed the call... Accept the Quest. Swords and sorcery await you at Havenwood. 

 
Havenwood is a completely immersive medieval experience with short and long term accommodation and medieval classes, activities and quests! We are building a medieval city, which will come alive with your help. As a citizen of Havenwood we will train you to fight, ride and shoot to prepare you for the battles ahead. LARP, quest and train in a bustling fantasy world where you decide who you are, and what you'll be. Heed the call, ride for glory. 

Activities
Ride! Saddle up your horse and take to the forest paths as you learn about horsemanship and how to sit your jousting saddle!
Fight! Draw your sword as you learn medieval swordsmanship techniques and learn to use a variety of medieval weapons!
Shoot! Make your longbow sing as we teach you traditional instinctive archery!
Battle! Take up arms as you battle for supremacy on one of the LARP battlefields or enter the Arena and take on your friends for all to see!
Explore! Take in the sights as take on the tree top high ropes course!
Feast! Come back to the Great Hall after a day's adventure to enjoy a traditional medieval feast from meat and produce grown in our fields!
Brew! Learn the Brewers craft at the Alehouse and sample some tradiontional ales and mead!
Craft! Learn to sew cloaks and make candles and keep the fruits of your labor!


The Story

The minstrels played like fiends and the ale was doing its job. Every guest and member of the court ate and laughed and danced in the Great Keep at Havenwood. Tonight must be for merriment for tomorrow we ride for glory... But before I presided over the Court at Havenwood, I was a simple Smithy's son. This is the story of Havenwood:


Will you ride with valour for the glory of Havenwood?

(The Havenwood crest shield reflects the history of Havenwood's inception; The trees that provided safe haven for my people and the arrows that took down the dragons.)


What we need:
  • $1000 is the immediate target to cover the costs of launching the campaign (graphic designer, composer, and the pins and rings).
  • The funds we receive will go to selecting and buying an appropriate property which must include a water source (rivers, lakes and dams), a forested area for trail rides, LARP adventures and quests, open areas with rich soil for livestock, and enough space to build the village and castle. We will be using the natural resources on the property like timber and stone to keep the costs down and also will be using the team at Havenwood to build as much as possible ourselves to reduce cost but we will still need to buy quarried stone and employ labourers to ensure Havenwood is built within a reasonable time frame and to the highest possible standard. 
  • If we don't get all the funds required then Havenwood will still be made but on a  smaller scale with fewer features. It will still be an agrarian medieval farm stay accommodation with activities and opportunities to LARP .

Stretch Targets
600,000 USD - Rustic Medieval Village
At this point we'd have enough to build a solid but rustic village which would include: a Great Hall (for meals and ceremonies as well as feasts and balls) a Stable, an Arena (for LARP tournaments) the farm (livestock, orchard, herb garden and greenhouse) and a dedicated LARP battlefield and LARP campsite as well as the swords, bows, arrows, horses, saddles, tack and other necessities. 
800,000 USD - Established Medieval Village
We can add the Alehouse and the Inn so we can serve mead and ale and a second LARP battlefield as well as a dedicated archery range and drill ground. 
1,000,000 USD - Medieval Town
We'll add a bake house and smoke house to serve higher quality meals, prepared fresh on sight as well as a fortified wall to surround the town. 
1,250,000 USD - Established Medieval Town
We'll add the Blacksmiths (a working forge and workshop) a Chandlery with bee hives and a market place with a fountain depicting the Havenwood gods. 
1,500,000 USD - Medieval City 
We can build a village outside the City for cottage accommodation for both our guests and staff and we'll add the mercenary camp. 
1,750,000 USD - City additions
We can build The Armoury and The Mages and Warriors Guild.
2,000,000 USD - Training additions
We can build the Tree top course; a high ropes obstacle course in the forest for Ranger training and we can start building some of the quest sites, like troll caves etc...
2,500,000 USD - City urpgrades
We can add a games hall to play D & D, as well as a Gallows, pecking cages, a Cooper, lumber mill and wood workshop, chapels, shrines, cobbled roads, carriages, a wedding site, bandit camp,  a well, Amphitheatre, Healer's hut, bell tower, signal fire, the steam rooms and hot baths and the dragon bone chandelier. 
3,000,000 USD - Great Hall upgrade
We can upgrade the Great Hall to a stone keep with secret passageways and castle-stay accommodation. 
6,000,000 USD+ - Havenwood Keep upgrade
We can upgrade the Stone keep to a large stone castle! And add a gate house, portcullis and drawbridge. 

The Impact

We want Havenwood to also be be a dedicated LARP hub for festivals and games. Even week long campaigns. We aim to hold a variety of festivals and forgotten trade fairs, Renaissance fairs, a Yule ball, jousting tournaments and celebrate the equinoxes. 

It is our aim at Havenwood to to bring people an "immersive tourism" experience and push what we're calling the Medieval Movement. 

Immersive Tourism - Immersive Tourism is almost like interactive theatre. It's a holiday experience that completely immerses the client into a world or experience much like a living RPG. In terms of the Havenwood experience it's like extreme D & D or LARP on the next level. I have worked for In Real Life Shooter which was an attempt at making a real life first person shooter with zombies. It was quite successful but very expensive for a two hour experience. We want to take an immersive experience to the next level and create a world that you can live in.

The Medieval Movement - The Medieval Movement is an attempt to bring people back to basics. Getting people to work together and relearn how to communicate without the modern technology we currently rely on. It's about eating fresh produce, sleeping better, getting out in the fresh and really relying on working together and cooperating. We currently must work almost twice as many days in the year to earn enough to house and feed ourselves than the average medieval peasant. We aim to teach people how easy it is to grow fresh produce and herbs at home, saving you money and keeping you healthy as well as home remedies for simple ailments, like headaches etc. 


The Team
Nick (CEO)- 

Nicholas has spent a good deal of time at university studying a range of subjects including; tourism, commerce, law, music and agriculture/agronomy. In his spare time he rides his thoroughbreds Ella and Bella and helps out at Wongarra Farm, studies natural horsemanship, practices traditional archery, studies Fiore dei Libera swordsmanship and spends an inordinate amount of time consulting, planning and drafting his dream, Havenwood. He has toured nationally and internationally as an Operatic Tenor. He cannot wait to spend most of his time as Lord Vane of Havenwood.
Adam (CFO)-


Adam managed the unenviable task of completing his Bachelor’s degree in Commerce while successfully managing a business in hospitality to obtain his double major in Commercial Law and Financial planning. He holds a Graduate Diploma in Financial Planning and has been granted membership to the Institute of Chartered Accountants. Adam is also a qualified personal trainer. He currently works at one the ‘Big 4’ accounting  firms. His field of specialization includes the Government sector, Sovereign wealth fund, not-for-profits, listed and non-listed managed funds and managed investment schemes. He is also an avid jazz saxophonist.
Jess (COO) –


Jess grew up on a bustling working cattle station and was riding horses from the moment she could mount. She obtained her BMus in classical voice and has toured extensively as an Operatic Soprano. She currently enjoys riding her three horses, practicing her archery and going on hunting trips as well as studying Fiore dei Libera renaissance long sword duelling (though she is deadliest with a sabre). She is most excited about running the stables at Havenwood and breeding the Havenwood warm blood as well as taking trail rides through the forest and teaching horsemanship to Havenwood’s citizens.   

Between the team we have successfully:

Run farms, run animal artificial insemination projects, managed a variety of companies, taught a variety of things from archery to horsemanship and riding lessons, taken trail rides, worked with horses, cattle, sheep, pigs and poultry, audited a veriaty of large multinational companies, worked at resorts and for IRL shooter and much more. 

Risks and challenges
Our challenges at the moment are only financial. We have the designs, the talent and the experience but having pooled our personal funds, we lack the start up capitol to create something truly special. 
We can easily overcome these obstacles with your help. Pledge now to receive contributor savings and benefits. 
Other ways you can help
If you can't afford the the first perk, you can still help our campaign. You can spread the word, share the link, like the Facebook page or come to one of the Havenwood working bees. We are also taking expressions of interest for staff, especially if you know a forgotten trade (black smithing, chandlery, stable work etc) Please email us at havenwoodvillage@gmail.com with your current CV detailing your experience. 
Help us create an amazing experience by pledging and don't forget to share the campaign with your allies!
Sincerely,
The Havenwood Team!

The Small Council

Lord Torin Vane, first of his name, Lord of Havenwood, Keeper of the Forest and Protector of the Realms of men – 
Torin was a simple smithy's son who lived in a quiet hamlet on the edge of the Kingswood. Forsaking his father's trade, he learned the ways of the wilderness from his childhood friends, the Elves. Having had adventure thrust upon him, his many travels to root out the court magisters led him on a journey to the dragon ranges. Aided by loyal friends along the way who would end up serving as his Small Council, he is both terrified and excited at the prospect of living up to his new title and constructing the new Fief of Havenwood. He hopes all in the Kingdom will act upon their guest right and seek out Havenwood Village.
Adrick ‘Fargrim’ Ironfist (Master of Coin) –
Adrick Fargrim or ‘Grim’ to Lord Vane, was branded ‘Ironfist’ by the Guild of Merchants, so reluctant to part with coin was he. Knowing how that name could cripple his business interests he quickly cultivated a reputation as a bad tempered bar room brawler. A sour deal with a Dwarven smith led to the fingerless gauntlet that he is seldom seen without. He currently resides as Master of Coin, protecting the financial interests of Havenwood’s coffers in the traditional blacks and midnight blues that befit his station.
Ylva Jorrun (Havenwood Huntswoman and Stable Master)-
Ylva was born into the austere life of the Raider Clan. Showing sufficient discipline and skill, Ylva was accepted to the trials as a child but lacking the blood lust expected of the clan’s warriors, she was assigned the less honourable position of beast keeper. Among the horses, however, she finally felt at home.
Ylva was sent by her master to see to the animals when the High Clansman, out of pride and greed, lead his warriors to raid the fabled Elven wood, where the elves were said to hold treasures greater than man could imagine.  He led his warriors to their demise.
When all her clansmen had perished or fled Ylva was found by the elves injured and unconscious but encircled by the horses she cared for. They had not fled the battle but remained protectively with her. This intrigued the elves and they took her in and cared for her as she recovered. 
Ylva remained with the elves as she grew until it was seen that she must journey on. As emissary of the elves she was sent to seek out Torin Vane and aid him in his new role as Lord of Havenwood as the Lord’s protector and Huntswoman.

Heed the call...

My brothers-in-arms, join me in a quest to build us a home and fulfil the prophecy. Help give us all a place to be free. Help build our home.

Yours in service,
Lord Torin Vane 
First of his name, Lord of Havenwood, Keeper of the forest and Protector of the realms of men. 

https://www.facebook.com/havenwoodcastle?fref=ts

First of his name, Lord of Havenwood, Keeper of the forest and Protector of the realms of men. 


https://www.facebook.com/havenwoodcastle?fref=ts

story:
Our Mission: Frequency Coffee

Bringing a unique coffee shop concept and hospitality to MacArthur Park and the greater Los Angeles area.

My name is Kian, and I own the Los Angeles coffee roaster Compelling & Rich. I'm also the principal of Frequency Coffee, currently popped-up in a shared shop space in Downtown Los Angeles. In the short time Frequency has been popped-up, we've already won national acclaim, being highlighted for our unique approach to a simple coffee shop (Imbibe Magazine) and service towards our local community (LA Downtown News). I'm putting this crowdfunding effort together with the hopes you'll help us get a space of our own open in MacArthur Park, Los Angeles.
In 2012 I launched Compelling & Rich as a roaster, serving only coffees that would run on average $40/lb unroasted - sometimes up to $80/lb. As business grew, I began to appreciate how complex and delicious the less-rare $2 - $4/lb coffees could be - often tasting better than the prohibitively expensive lots I was sourcing. I began to see how important good roasting was. More-importantly, I was able to introduce more people to great coffee when I had a lower cost and price point. This has informed my mission as the owner of a coffee company: making exceptional coffees accessible. This will be Frequency's mission as well.

By supporting Frequency, you're opening a shop in an under-served section of Los Angeles that only buys, serves, and celebrates local products. MacArthur Park is an underserved community with a diverse makeup of residents and commercial businesses. We'd like to celebrate that community, and Los Angeles at large, by bringing them a shop. We're hoping to open a beautiful space to serve the local community near the intersection of 6th and Park View, not far from the historic Park Plaza Hotel.

Compelling & Rich is a small business, but we have a great reputation based on winning multiple Coffee Review ratings for our coffees - more than any other Los Angeles-based roaster - as well as our innovative approach to roasting, profiled in publications such as Fast Company, Playboy, and LA Weekly.

The coffee community of LA at that time was going through an incredible transformation: people were finally interested in distinguishing decent coffee from great coffee, and learning how to make that change. Baristas became roasters, roasters became shop owners, and most-importantly, people who were just getting into specialty coffee became baristas.

I originally opened Frequency as a response to the shops around Los Angeles who refuse to carry local roasters. It's telling that the most-popular shops in Los Angeles only stock coffees roasted in Portland, Vancouver, San Francisco, etc. The community we've developed is great, but we're not encouraging our own growth by supporting the smaller guys doing great work. While at the pop-up we've also carried a couple coffees by lesser-known friends and roasters I admire around the world, I'm now firmly committed to only serving coffees from Los Angeles and the greater area.


The Impact

This project is valuable to me both as a lifelong Angeleno, and as the owner of a business started in and supporting Los Angeles. I'd love to open a shop that leads to a revitalization of one of the most-beautiful neighborhoods in Los Angeles, while respecting the community that has grown around it and providing jobs to locals.

Frequency will be a place where the community can gather to experience our passion for both coffee as well as hospitality. We're planning to offer a complimentary weekly tasting of all of our coffees on brew bar, and a brunch using local bakers like Sugarbird Sweets.

Frequency will also be a shop where the work of the barista will be celebrated: too many specialty shops brag about their focus on increasing a tenth of a second of average service rather than training each of their workers about what makes the coffee and the experience special. In short, they're training too many people to follow recipes rather then chefs. We aim to correct that in one important way:
We've done a lot of soul-searching (and a lot of labor law research), and decided the best way to make baristas feel ownership over their shop is to give them some: eliminate gratuities on tickets and institute profit-sharing on net hourly sales for all baristas that pass our comprehensive training course. As California pushes for a higher minimum wage, we're planning to go even higher. All baristas will be encouraged to reach out into our kitchen program as well as the roasting and green coffee purchasing portions of our business. Baristas working with us for one-year will be gifted an expenses-paid trip to origin.

We are committing to hiring a significant portion of our staff from backgrounds that have nothing to do with specialty coffee. Not only does this benefit our business by decreasing turnover, but it has been our experience that people who come into this position without good or bad habits make better baristas.


Funding

Build-outs, permitting, marketing, and those slow first months of business-building can cost hundreds of thousands of dollars for the average restaurant in Los Angeles - we're only asking for your help with $10,000 of that. The funding goes entirely towards the purchase and installation of our espresso machine, industry's most-precise grinders and brewing equipment, and most importantly, a calibrated filter water system.

At the core of this shop is the mission to do something that serves the community, which is why our Perks are weighted towards both potential job training in the coffee community as well as the products we'll offer. 
In the case we do not reach our entire goal in this campaign, the funds will be allocated towards purchasing our equipment, then towards deposits, permit fees, and build-outs.


Risks & Challenges

In March 2015, we opened a Frequency Pop-up in Downtown LA as a way to get our feet wet with operating a shop concept, and ran into a few of the problems new businesses can expect. The first couple months are crucial - getting the word out that you exist, building up a regular clientele, and smoothing-out any unforeseen kinks in operations.

Compelling & Rich has a track record of both operating a shop and providing a strong customer service experience. Personally, I have consulted on the concept development and opening of 4 shops - two here in LA, two in Honolulu. One of those was a coffee shop that just celebrated its 5th year of operation. We know how to run this kind of business, and make it profitable.

We'll be able to solve these challenges, or at least make them a little easier to deal with, based on our experience. It's a fact that 23% of new restaurateurs launching a new concept fail in their first year, but due to our experience in running a shop we're much more likely to succeed.

Timeline:
We plan to finalize a lease by the end of July and start construction immediately.
We hope to have a bare-bones space open by the middle of September, where we can hold "Get to know us" events for the community.
We anticipate being open for business by the beginning of October. It's an ambitious plan, but we have the support of friends, family, and some incredible partners in making this happen.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not in a position to donate over the course of the campaign, we totally understand - we just ask that you'd support our mission by sharing this campaign's link online to raise awareness.

story:
Who Are We?

"Compared to other developing countries in the region, the percentage of population below the national poverty line in Cambodia is higher than that of other developing countries, such as Philippines, Indonesia, Vietnam, etc. 22.8% of Cambodians live on less than $1.25 per day"


Hello world! We are a group of student volunteers out to make a difference for the less fortunate residing on Koh Rumdual, Cambodia in early December 2015. Very often, we take money for granted; not needing to work to earn our pocket money or daily expenses. We get to attend school not needing to care about school fees and other expenses that comes along with it. We have nice school bags, shoes and stationery that we can boast about to fellow classmates. Most importantly, we have a solid roof over our heads.

Now, these are luxuries that the people on Koh Rumdual* can only dream of. 

*Koh Rumdual, once part of the infamous 'Killing Fields', is a small island in the middle of the Tonle Bassac River about 25 km from Phnom Penh in the Kandal Province. Inhabitants range from blind, handicapped, land mine victims, some suffering from multiple sclerosis and confined to wheelchairs, and some widows with 7 or 8 children. Their houses are in a serious state of disrepair due to lack of funds, allowing the rain and insects free reign, and the numerous children in the households often suffering from the elements.


What We Hope To Do With The Money Raised From This Fundraising Campaign

There are a couple of things we hope to be able to achieve and assist Side By Side Cambodia with:

[1] House Building Project

Among the 300 residents on the island, there are approximately 114 families. 

Side By Side Cambodia has been trying to re-house these families into proper houses as most of them are living in unsafe housing. As funds are limited, they are only able to start purchasing and building a house as and when they have the funds to do so. Mostly these houses are built in the local manner: wood, bamboo leafs, concrete or wooden pillars and metal roofing. Such houses have to be renovated every 4-5 years. 

Proposed budget: USD $2,500 (including workers and materials)


[2] Food Packs

The islanders living on Koh Rumdual are very poor and uneducated. Most of them are illiterate (children and adult alike). Their daily livelihood income mainly comes from whatever little farming and fishing they were able to do and sold at very low prices in the local market. 

We hope to be able to distribute food packs to 114 families.

Items in the food pack includes: Rice, Noodles, Oil, Salt, Soy Sauce, Canned Food, Milk Powder (for families with babies) etc.

Proposed budget: USD $1,000 


The Impact



The island school was built brick by brick from the kind donations from fellow Singaporeans and other international volunteers who had contributed generously to the building in the early years. (Do check out the following site to find out what was done in the early stages: https://projectgmbs.wordpress.com/). Though the children on the island now enjoys basic education, more can be done for them and their families.

With the Vocational Training Centre (which has since been built), it is hopeful that the adults learn/will pick up useful skills that will ultimately enable them to make a living with.

With the current implementation of the irrigation system on the fields, it is hopeful that the adults will learn to manage the farms and make a living out of farming. 

AND You CAN HELP! Your kind donation is vital to enabling Side By Side Cambodia do and achieve more to help these islanders make a living. No contribution is too small!

The team will not rely entirely on this crowdfunding platform to raise funds. We will still be organising street sales and other fundraisers for this project.

So do keep a lookout for updates!

Thank you! =)

story:
About us. 

Ital Bites is an upcoming vegan treats company catering to vegans in the San Francisco Bay Area on their birthdays. This is our mission:

  • To provide you with the highest quality natural and organic treats available
  • To create for our family a sustainable business lasting for generations
  • To show that eating vegan (and healthy) can be fun and delicious

Why are we here?

A lot of people need money. So do we. This is why:

  • We are starting a new business from the ground up with $0 in funding.
  • $5500 is our goal. $500 of the money raised goes directly to Indiegogo fees and allocation of perks. 
  • The money you provide will allow us to: get a zoning permit, become certified by the health dept, apply for a business license, market our product, purchase ingredients, expand into a commercial kitchen, expand into an international market, among other business needs.

How you can help us and the world...

It is clear to see that many of the world's populations are dying early and unnecessarily due to the carelessness of their diets. With proper eating education and access, it is our belief that people's lives will flourish in many ways, including improved health and mental clarity. Ital Bites is proof positive that healthy eating can also be fun and delicious - not painful and impossible as is the common misconception. 

By funding us you are helping us to realize our dream of self-sustainability, while also contributing to the forward-thinking culture of healthy-eating lifestyles. 

Please share your support...

Whether or not you can provide monetary funding, there are plenty of other ways you can show your support for our cause. Here are a few ideas:
  • Share this campaign on all of your favorite social media sites daily
  • Tell your friends and family to donate if they can
  • Follow us on twitter and tell your followers to do the same
  • Buy our treats when they become available near you
  • Throw an Ital Bites Vegan Birthday for you and your friends in the SF Bay Area
  • Become a vegan or strive to make healthier choices for you and the planet daily
  • Care about yourself, people, animals, plants and the world at large

Also check us out @

www.italbites.com 
www.twitter.com/italbitesvegan

story:
After obtaining the 2nd degree in automotive engineering I thought that the best thing to do with all my knowledge is to build a small race car. This should be a fun and exciting project!
      A race car is basically something very expensive (and banckrupcy does not sound that amazing), sooooooo, I plan on keeping the costs as low as possible by hiring local manufacturers to produce the parts I designed and by manufacturing some of the parts by myself ( I am awesome that way).


Here is a simple scheme of costs distribution: 


- engine and transmission:                          4000$
- powertrain components:                           8000$
- super lightweight chassis:                        2000$
- specific component manufacturing:     2000$
- taxes and fees:                                             3000$
- unpredicted costs:                                      4000$
- racing events:                                               5000$
- awesome paintjob:                                      1000$
- not dying equipement:                               3000$
- anti-hunger supplies for the team:        3000$
----------------------------------------------------------------

                    TOTAL:                                                           35000$

Deadline: 31 Dec. 2016


Some may say that it cannot be done. That it is too big for one person to do it.

But I really like big things ( I mean cars and challeneges!) and I have some well justified reasons:

- throughout university i have done all my research over this small racing car, so I have designed most of it. Now I can transform all my projects it into a real car! Pam-pam -paaaaaaaaaaaaaam!

- I was a valedictorian student and I have the knowledge and skills to start such a project ( much smart).

- I have done something similar with the Formula SAE team at the university ( yes, like I said, I am amazing).

- If this turned out to be a successful campaign I will work with some of my university colleagues ( God knows they need an occupation, too :D ).


I hope that you are as excited as I am about this project! If not, you will be!

story:
*Update: After some brainstorming and serious internal debates, we have decided to lower our fundraising goal for this campaign. Our new goal will go toward purchasing our mobile unit (gutted Airstream trailer, currently picked out), renovations of the unit, an expanded inventory, and promotions for upcoming events. With these objects in mind, we've revised our budget to be as follows:

Occupancy

The trailer, building shelves, making it look nice: $10,000

Promotion + Expanded Inventory

Signs, posters, branded items, cute things we make for events, inventory for events through the end of 2015: $5,000


Short Summary

Hi! We are Christen and Julia, and we want to bring your community bookstore to you!

A few years back, we met at the Denver Publishing Institute and had a blast learning how to become publishing rockstars. Then, we both ended up in Charleston, South Carolina, and we couldn’t get bookstores off our brains.

Charleston is made up of many vibrant neighborhoods, but we have always thought that most of them have lacked  something very special, something that is really quite key for  community spaces: bookstores! Finally, we decided if no one else would bring the bookstores, we’d bring one ourselves.

Like other business ventures, bookstores are expensive. The books, the build out, the rent, the bills: they all add up. And as we both hail from the publishing industry,  we aren't exactly raking it in. So, we decided that instead of giving up on our dream, we would flip the script: who says we need to be in one location? Who says we have to have rent in a tourist town? It worked for so many food trucks; we think it can work for bookstores, too. 

This is where you, dear reader, come in. 

We know Charleston neighborhoods want to see a great new bookstore here because we’ve heard from them. We asked around, the votes are in: you love books, and  you want more of them.  We also know (hope) that our neighbors are supportive and generous.


What We Need & What You Get

As we mentioned, bookstores are expensive. The vast majority of our funds will be dedicated toward the curation of our inventory, which will be tailored to our customers (you!)

Occupancy 

The trailer, building shelves, repairs, making it look nice, etc: 10,000

Operations 

Point of sale system, computer, taxes, shipping, the books (yay!), industry organization subscriptions, and so much more: 50,000


Promotion 

Signs, posters, business cards, branded items, cute things we make for events: 5,000


Never fear, friends. Not only will you be rewarded with an excellent bookmobile once our campaign is (successfully!) completed, but you’ll also get one (or more) of the rewards we’re offering for your very appreciated contribution.


We’ve got swag: tote bags, journals, and coffee mugs


We’ve got books (obviously!)

And for all those true book nerds out there, we’ve got party plans: customized trivia, children's party, book releases--you want it, we'll do it. 


The Impact


A book can be a spark. A book can open your world and give you a chance to stimulate your creativity and intellect at your own pace and spurred by the things that interest you. 


Our schools and our teachers work to instill this, but they are not the only ones responsible and they are not the only places to go. One great place is a book store. 

To date, we have met with several local literacy and education-focused nonprofits to develop partnerships. While we are an LLC and not a nonprofit, a key point of our business plan is to be the best asset and advocate for our community as we can. We have met with the local affiliate of the WINGS program and helped organize a benefit for Begin With Books, an affiliate of the Dolly Parton Imagination Library, which gives every child enrolled one free book a month from ages 0-5. In June, we were awarded a $1,000 grant by Enough Pie to develop a play street program called PlayUp Charleston in the Upper Peninsula, with the goal of encouraging creative learning and interaction in the community.

We're always looking for more ways to get involved with our community, so if you have a cause dear to your heart, let us know! The successful funding of this campaign will enable us to do so much more than we have: with this money and these resources, we will be able to get books into the hands of our neighbors, and facilitate larger events, fundraisers and more. 

We don't pretend to be literacy experts or say that we will fix the literacy issue in Charleston, but this is something we can do to help. Creating another place for someone to get exposure to books is only going to help the issue. We want to be a place where everyone can come and feel included and like they can take time for themselves. Where they can discover new worlds and possibilities, both young and old. 


Risks & Challenges

Here's the situation: there are these things called "ebooks" and "ereaders" that naysayers keep insisting are pulling down the sales of physical books. And you know, their claims aren't without merit. But of late, the physical book has been making a comeback, and it's all because book lovers, like you and us, just can't let them go.

The other thing is that the price of books are set by publishers. Should our overhead costs go up, we can't raise the price of our goods to cover them, like many other traditional retailers can. On the other side, since the price we pay for books is based on their set "list" price (aka, the price customers buy them at), we're also locked in from a buyer's standpoint. Should we want to drop prices, we can only do so very slightly, or we risk losing money.

Where do we come in...

For both of us, reading was our first friends and best teacher, and our hometown bookstores were the playdate spots and schoolhouse. We're both the kind of people who will go to a bookstore and gather the books that we want to buy around us and sit on the floor, trying desperately to decide what to get and always walking out having spent more than we wanted to. 

  • We know books; we like getting to know people. When we pair those skills, book magic happens.
  • We are going to give you the best browsing experience of your life! Browsing is the key to discovering your next favorite book, and only bookstores can offer that.
  • Since our space is small, our stock can be tailored specifically to your neighborhood.

Other Ways You Can Help

We totally understand not having spare cash lying around, but there are other ways you can contribute to our campaign!

  • Get out there and spread the word to all your friends: Indiegogo's share tools make this easy
  • We are actively selling books, right now! Head over to our website and see if there's something that interests you. Or let us know what you're looking for, and we'll find it!
story_txt:
*Update: After some brainstorming and serious internal debates, we have decided to lower our fundraising goal for this campaign. Our new goal will go toward purchasing our mobile unit (gutted Airstream trailer, currently picked out), renovations of the unit, an expanded inventory, and promotions for upcoming events. With these objects in mind, we've revised our budget to be as follows:

OccupancyThe trailer, building shelves, making it look nice: $10,000Promotion + Expanded InventorySigns, posters, branded items, cute things we make for events, inventory for events through the end of 2015: $5,000 
Short Summary 
Hi! We are Christen and Julia, and we want to bring your community bookstore to you!
A few years back, we met at the Denver Publishing Institute and had a blast learning how to become publishing rockstars. Then, we both ended up in Charleston, South Carolina, and we couldn’t get bookstores off our brains.Charleston is made up of many vibrant neighborhoods, but we have always thought that most of them have lacked  something very special, something that is really quite key for  community spaces: bookstores! Finally, we decided if no one else would bring the bookstores, we’d bring one ourselves. 
Like other business ventures, bookstores are expensive. The books, the build out, the rent, the bills: they all add up. And as we both hail from the publishing industry,  we aren't exactly raking it in. So, we decided that instead of giving up on our dream, we would flip the script: who says we need to be in one location? Who says we have to have rent in a tourist town? It worked for so many food trucks; we think it can work for bookstores, too. 
This is where you, dear reader, come in. 
We know Charleston neighborhoods want to see a great new bookstore here because we’ve heard from them. We asked around, the votes are in: you love books, and  you want more of them.  We also know (hope) that our neighbors are supportive and generous.

What We Need & What You Get

As we mentioned, bookstores are expensive. The vast majority of our funds will be dedicated toward the curation of our inventory, which will be tailored to our customers (you!)
Occupancy The trailer, building shelves, repairs, making it look nice, etc: 10,000
Operations 
Point of sale system, computer, taxes, shipping, the books (yay!), industry organization subscriptions, and so much more: 50,000
Promotion 
Signs, posters, business cards, branded items, cute things we make for events: 5,000

story:
Kurzbeschreibung

Seit Jahren nehme ich von jeder Reise in die USA diese Water Enhancer mit. Es gibt sie in unendlich vielen Geschmacksrichtungen und von vielen Herstellern.
Die Preise dort schwanken zwischen 0,99$ im 99CentOnly Store und bis zu 3,99$ für bestimmte Premiummarken wie Minute Maid.
Sie eignen sich perfekt für unterwegs und sparen letztlich eine Menge Geld, da man auch mal ohne gekaufte Cola usw auskommt und nur eine leere Flasche und Wasser benötigt.
Auch mit den bekannten Sprudlern daheim kann man sie einsetzen.

Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

Bislang sind diese Water Enhancer bei uns nur schwer zu bekommen und wenn zu deutlich überhöhten Preisen. Ich möchte mit dieser Kampagne die Akzeptanz im hiesigen Markt testen und die Water Enhancer zu einem nahezu 1:1 (Dollarpreis=Europreis) anbieten.(bezogen auf die UVP in den USA!)
Aufgrund des Gewichts einer einzelnen Flasche (Inhalt meist 48ml + Verpackung) kann ich für rund 5500€ (je nach Einkauf) Water Enhancer mitbringen.  Dazu fällt dann der Deutsche Zoll an. So komme ich auf den Gesamtbetrag der Förderung zzgl. ein klein wenig Reserve für eventuelles Zusatzgepäck o.ä.


Den Transport dieser ersten Lieferung würde ich selbst übernehmen und im Rahmen meines Vielfliegerprogramms den Flug beisteuern. Auch alle anderen Reisekosten (Leihwagen,Hotel etc trage ich natürlich selbst)
Ich darf 3 Koffer zu je 32KG und 2 Hangepäckstücke zu je 8KG kostenfrei mitnehmen. Ein weiterer Koffer auf der Rückseite kostet mich zusätzliche 100$.

Jeder Unterstützer erhält eine gewisse Anzahl Water Enhancer als Dank für die Unterstützung. Leider kann ich dabei nicht auf bestimmte Geschmacksrichtungen eingehen, da ich nicht weiß was ich vor Ort günstig einkaufen kann.


Die Folgen

Wenn die Kampagne funktioniert, dann werde ich die Water Enhancer in einem Online Shop in Deutschland künftig zum gleichen Preis in Euro angeboten wie bislang die UVP in den USA in Dollar war.  Damit sind wir in unserem Land um eine Errungenschaft aus den Staaten reicher.

Risiken & Herausforderungen

Ich habe für den privaten Bedarf schon häufig diese Water Enhancer mitgebracht (Je ca. 100 alle drei-vier Monate) . Es gab nie größere Probleme. Der Zoll hatte auf Nachfrage auch mit größeren Mengen keine Bedenken und erinnert hier lediglich an den Wert und die nötige Versteuerung.

Natürlich kann theoretisch ein Koffer verlorengehen, aber dann wäre er versichert.
Im Grunde rechne ich mit wenig Schwierigkeiten.

Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann


Gerne freue ich mich über Kontakte vor Ort (Nevada, Kalifornien) und jede andere Idee. Bei Erfolg dieser Kampagne werde ich den nächsten Schritt wagen und es mit eine kompletten Kontainer versuchen. Aktuell halte ich die Nutzung des Freigepäcks für eine gute Option.

story:
Thanks a lot for taking some time to get to know more about *Mio me*!


Our video is an additional feature to get a first *Mio me* impression. All important information will be listed in the following text!



Help us stretch our wings!


Creating fair employment and working conditions for local people, keeping traditional crafts alive, raising donations and awareness for animal welfare, and making a living by taking a prosperous small business in Namibia to the next level.


Our motivation for this campaign

We want to make *Mio me* a leading and significant manufacturer and trend setter for outstanding and functional hand-made pet accessories here in Namibia.

Within the last 2 ½ years, we created a loyal customer base in Namibia. We tested the waters with different materials, designs and products. With this experience, we are more than ready to expand!

We would be over the moon if we raised 5800 $ to establish a solid and improved business structure. This would enable the growth and sustainability of *Mio me* after the time of the intended transition (approx. 3-4 months) and the substantial increase of our monthly turnover.


Why we believe in *Mio me*

There is an increasing demand for pet gear. *Mio me* is the only manufacturer of hand made pet accessories in all of Namibia. We are working with limited resources; there are many requests both from customers and bulk outlets which we unfortunately have to turn down. Therefore, we need a few essential changes.

That’s where we would like you to come in! We need your assistance to raise the necessary funds to spread our wings and distribute more *Mio me* products within Namibia, and, in the longer run, around the world! With your support, we can make it happen!



Background

The first *Mio*’s were sewn in order to cover the costs of increasing food and vet bills of numerous street cats and kittens that we fostered in our village. The customized beds were selling well, since it was a niche in the Namibian market. After our move to the capital Windhoek, we were offered a great opportunity to rent a stall at the beautiful Namibia Crafts Centre, a unique spot downtown that attracts tourists as well as locals, where hand-crafted Namibian products are sold. Our funds were limited, and we started off with a tiny stall and a small choice of *Mio*’s:  8 collars, a handful of bandanas, and a few cat toys. The business grew steadily. We recently moved to a bigger space within the center and we could create full-time employment for our sales lady Kristofina in March. We also were able to increase our stock to about two hundred individually designed and crafted items (collars, leashes, bandanas, harnesses, treat bags and toys).

Currently, we are taking the first steps to restructure our business. *Mio* was re-branded to *Mio me*, but our vision and mission remain the same.


What is important to us

  • *Mio me* is a Namibian company. Namibia used to import most of its goods.Thanks to the thriving local business empowerment initiative: *Local is Lekker* (lekker is the Afrikaans word for “good”), more and more Namibians support us local businesses and help create new jobs in a country with an estimated unemployment rate of about 45%.
  • We want to create fair jobs for motivated, skilled Namibians. With a small team of experts in different crafts, we can add hand-made items to our range which are not yet available, or differ in look and quality from what the market offers so far.
  • In addition, we want to create awareness for the needs of pets, and keep on supporting the work of local welfare organizations like the educational PAKO kid’s magazine, as well as the wonderful Have-a-Heart Spay and Neuter project. When fostering street cats, we also work closely with the Cat Protection Society. We will continue contributing to fund-raising competitions by giving *Mio me* products as prizes, donating parts of our profit to organizations like the SPCA, and offering discounts on their orders.\



Meet team *Mio me*

Lena – the Allrounder:

In 2011, shortly after my 30th birthday, I (Lena) left Germany, my country, to work as a teacher in a village in northern Namibia. This is where I met my husband Brazil, and we decided to move to the capital in 2013. While struggling to find a job as a teacher (everything happens for a reason!), I was encouraged by several customers to convert *Mio me* to a full-time business. I haven’t regretted this step ever since. I LOVE what I am doing, though it was extremely tough at times since I had about 100$ to get started. My various responsibilities are marketing, customer service, and other operational duties. I design and manufacture every *Mio* myself.


Brazil  - our Finance and Admin nerd, doubles up as husband:

Brazil does our weekly book-keeping after he knocks off from his first job. We want to pay him a fair salary for all his efforts and include him into the business a few more hours a week to take over more *Mio me* responsibilities as we grow.


Kristofina - our sales fundi:

Kristofina is a 34 year-old Namibian, and mother of a 5-year-old son. She is working full-time at our *Mio me* stall. She receives an average salary which we would love to increase, since she does a great job and deserves better! We would also like to provide her with proper health care.


The test-drivers, our supermodels and our daily inspiration:

Jabu, Krishna, Salsa and Saleh, our 4 former street cats, and Naimah and Ivy, our 2 dogs, are our daily inspiration. They are always around, and continuously motivate us as we try to make their lives more exciting and comfortable. Their views matter. Every *Mio me* product is tested and trialed by them. Seeing them enjoying their *Mio*’s is our best reward!


Our vision for team *Mio me*

It is envisioned that in the end, we will be offering full-time employment. For now, part-time jobs and the commissioning of work is a first step on our way to guarantee long-term employment. We will definitely deliver many more *Mio*’s much faster with more hired support.

  • Firstly, we want to hire a crafter to weave beautiful traditional baskets, to counter the general and ongoing extinction of this beautiful Namibian indigenous craft. We could then also offer these as dog baskets in different sizes to which we will add cat caves and scratching poles.
  • Recycled pallets, driftwood and other reusable materials (tires, bottles, cans, old suitcases e.g.) can be up-cycled with an underemployed crafter for different uses: dog houses, bed frames, drinking bowls or dog tags.
  • Thirdly, we want to work with a tailoress, who will innovatively and creatively work on new ideas, and help to put them to action so that I can focus more on growth and new business.

Wages in Namibia are way below those in many Western countries, and living in Windhoek is very expensive. The aim is to offer our employees a competitive and reasonable salary package. We hope to provide every team member with proper health care latest by June 2016. In the long run, we would love to provide the team – Brazil, Kristofina, the three new team members, and myself – with the financial means for a decent living through *Mio me*.


What we will use the funds for

  • Employing of crafters: (see above) Our team-members will be motivated to continue using their traditional crafts. This guarantees the ongoing appreciation of the crafts of our customers. Also, this warrants an ongoing extension of our product range, and I will find more time to work on aspects of product innovation and business expansion. The amount would pay the salaries until the turnover is expected to increase.      1800 $
  • Material: A sufficient availability of material (buckles, webbing, ribbon, fabric e.g.) to avoid current production delays. Additionally, we need different woods for the new products, as well as some basic tools to get started.      1700 $
  • Proper equipment and furnishing: For recycling and upcycling from discarded material, space-efficient furniture and market equipment, and shop fittings (offering employment to wood-crafters).      800 $

  • An industrial sewing machine: My hobby machine, that poor thing is struggling, especially with several layers of webbing when making the collars.       600 $
  • Promotion costs: For this campaign, adverts, brochures and business cards, and the donation of prizes for local ruffles that support animal welfare and to get our name out there. An upgrade of our website will allow us to add an online shop to it.     700 $

  • Unforeseen expenses:     200 $


Find out more about *Mio me*

Facebook:

We have been posting on Facebook since day one! Our profile has a bit more of a personal touch. The site keeps you up to date with the services and products we offer. Get to know more about *Mio me*, like us, accompany us through the following months of change, and keep in touch!   www.facebook.com/MioMioPetBeds   and    www.facebook.com/MioPetBeds


Our website:

Find out more about our products and have a look at all the *Mio*s that have found their ways into people’s homes by now!  www.miopetbeds.wix.com/mymio


You can support us in many different ways – by donating an amount of your choice, by getting one of our perks, by following and supporting us on Facebook, by sharing our *Mio me* campaign with friends and family, or dog- or cat-crazy neighbors!


From the bottom of our hearts: THANK YOU for your time and support! We are so excited and can’t wait to see where this campaign will take us!

Brazil does our
weekly book-keeping after he knocks off from his first job. We want to pay him
a fair salary for all his efforts and include him into the business a few more
hours a week to take over more *Mio me* responsibilities as we grow.
Kristofina - our sales fundi:
Kristofina is a
34 year-old Namibian, and mother of a 5-year-old son. She is working full-time
at our *Mio me* stall. She receives an average salary which we would love to
increase, since she does a great job and deserves better! We would also like to
provide her with proper health care.
The test-drivers, our supermodels
and our daily inspiration:
Jabu, Krishna, Salsa and Saleh, our 4 former street cats, and Naimah and Ivy, our 2 dogs, are our
daily inspiration. They are always around, and continuously motivate us as we
try to make their lives more exciting and comfortable. Their views matter.
Every *Mio me* product is tested and trialed by them. Seeing them enjoying
their *Mio*’s is our best reward!


Our vision for team *Mio
me*
It
is envisioned that in the end, we will be offering full-time employment. For
now, part-time jobs and the commissioning of work is a first step on our
way to guarantee long-term employment. We will definitely deliver many more *Mio*’s much faster with
more hired support.

Firstly, we want to hire a crafter to weave beautiful traditional baskets,
to counter the general and ongoing extinction of this beautiful Namibian
indigenous craft. We could then also offer these as dog baskets in different
sizes to which we will add cat caves and scratching poles.


Recycled pallets, driftwood and other reusable materials
(tires, bottles, cans, old suitcases e.g.) can be up-cycled with an
underemployed crafter for different
uses: dog houses, bed frames, drinking bowls or dog tags.


Thirdly, we want to work with a tailoress, who will innovatively and creatively work on new ideas,
and help to put them to action so that I can focus more on growth and new
business. 

Wages in Namibia are way below those in
many Western countries, and living in Windhoek is very expensive. The aim is to
offer our employees a competitive and
reasonable salary package. We
hope to provide every team member with proper health care latest by June 2016. In the long run, we would love to provide the team – Brazil, Kristofina,
the three new team members, and myself – with the financial means for a decent
living through *Mio me*.

What we will use the
funds for

Employing of crafters: (see above) Our team-members will be
motivated to continue using their traditional crafts. This guarantees the
ongoing appreciation of the crafts of our customers. Also, this warrants an
ongoing extension of our product range, and I will find more time to work on aspects
of product innovation and business expansion. The amount would pay the salaries until the
turnover is expected to increase.      1800 $ 

Material: A sufficient availability of material (buckles, webbing,
ribbon, fabric e.g.) to avoid current production delays. Additionally, we need
different woods for the new products, as well as some basic tools to get
started.      1700 $

Proper equipment and furnishing: For recycling and upcycling from
discarded material, space-efficient furniture and market equipment, and shop
fittings (offering employment to wood-crafters).      800 $ 

An
industrial sewing machine: My hobby machine, that poor thing is struggling, especially with several layers of webbing when making the collars.       600 $


Promotion costs: For this campaign, adverts, brochures and business cards,
and the donation of prizes for local ruffles that support animal welfare and to
get our name out there. An upgrade of our website will allow us to add an
online shop to it.     700 $


Unforeseen expenses:     200 $ 




Find out more about *Mio
me*
Facebook:
We have been
posting on Facebook since day one! Our profile
has a bit more of a personal touch. The site
keeps you up to date with the services and products we offer. Get to know more
about *Mio me*, like us, accompany us through the following months of change, and
keep in touch!   www.facebook.com/MioMioPetBeds   and    www.facebook.com/MioPetBeds
Our website:
Find out more
about our products and have a look at all the *Mio*s that have found their ways
into people’s homes by now!  www.miopetbeds.wix.com/mymio

You can support us in many different ways – by donating an amount of your choice,
by getting one of our perks, by following and supporting us on Facebook, by sharing
our *Mio me* campaign with friends and family, or dog- or cat-crazy neighbors!
From the bottom of our
hearts: THANK YOU for your time and support! We are so excited and can’t wait
to see where this campaign will take us!

story:
Round two of this campaign has launched here.


Help us build Herndon's first community garden! 

The garden will be located at Bruin Park (off Van Buren Drive) and will have 30 or so plots. Participants in the community garden plot program will enjoy nature, grow fruits and vegetables for food, and get exercise from the practice of gardening. We encourage plot usage to allow for use for charitable and non-profit organizations.

This initial funding goal represents a portion of the funds needed (somewhere in the vicinity of $40,000).

Contact us at presidents@herndonenvironment.org if you want to donate $250 or more, we are working on a donor benefit package so you can get public recognition for your efforts.

story:
My name doesn't matter. 

I want to help Greece in these tragic circumstances. 

It has become quite obvious that the EU emperors want to stop the democratic will of a small country and they will not stop until either Greece submits her will to them or crashes like an insect under their mighty boot. 

Greece is unable to pay  320,000,000,000. Greece used to have a debt of 60% of GDP not many years ago. Now it is at 180%

Greece is now unable to access loans to rebuild and will possibly be forced to leave the EU. Greece in the last 5 years has experienced 50% unemployment among young people and the largest part of manufacturing and businesses have disappeared. A bankrupt country will be an easy pray in the hands of investors and speculators.

I am not in the least suggesting that Greece is not responsible for some of what is happening, however, it saddens me that is becoming the scapegoat of Europe.

I trust that this new, honest, democratic, government will use this money to help its people and most importantly to rebuild the economy.

I want the people of this country who still value democracy and free expression to appreciate that the rest of the world cares and wants to help them stand on their own feet. I want them to have jobs.

Please donate! Spread the word! Let us be the first to rebuild Greece!

story:
THE CAMPAIGN:

Hi friends and fellow supporters of the arts, 

I need your help in raising the $3100 it costs to join SAG-AFTRA. I've been a working non-union actor for years in film, tv, theatre, commercials, music videos, voice-over, etc. Some of my proudest credits include Wet Hot American Summer: First Day of Camp, Westworld, United States of Tara, Los Angeles Magazine, Etsy, Mercedes A Class, Verizon, various commercials, music videos, and film. After having been SAG-Eligible for 2.5 years, I am now ready to join the ranks of the fellow professional actors of SAG-AFTRA. 

Take a look at my reel, website, and IMDb to get a feel for my body of work. 

http://www.imdb.me/rachelmcvay

www.rachellaurenmcvay.com

I come from a theatre background, with a BFA in Theatre & Dance from Texas State University, having studied with the Royal Shakespeare Company and RADA, having lived and worked in NYC, and now residing in LA. A professional choreographer and acting teacher for 16 years all over the country, I have found a home and life as a working actor in the arts in LA, serving as Resident Artist of TE San Pedro Rep, and former Company Member of Long Beach Shakespeare Company. 

I have made my empire as a Stunt Woman/Shakespearean Leading Lady/Choreographer/Burlesque Dancer/Tarantino-esque bad-ass. I'm empowered and at a point in my career to join an organization in which I feel huge successes will abound. 


THE IMPACT:

With your support, I will be able to join SAG-AFTRA, a rite of passage in the professional world of acting. I will be able to ascertain higher quality representation, therefore access to network tv show & mainstream film auditions, a higher caliber of collaborators, appropriate wages and respectable working conditions, health insurance and benefits, and the idealistic life of being nothing but a working actor...which I am now, but on a low-budget scale! 


WHAT YOU GET OUT OF THIS PARTNERSHIP:

I appreciate any contribution, regardless of the amount. I'll get there one way or another, but what an empowering gift you will be giving a passionate artist by showing tangible support and belief in that person's career and contribution to to the arts. 

Thank you for believing in an artist like myself who has a passion and voice to contribute to this world, a soul with a vision, a mission. 


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

If you're not in a position to offer financial support, please aid the progress of this campaign by sharing the link with friends and family. A little sharing goes a long way!
