story:
Hello! I am 'Princess Nightmare.' A small accessories company making our way back to NYCC (New York Comicon) this year! But we need a little bit of help! Throughout the year we have worked on some new and wonderful things. We currently sell handmade one of a kind and commissionable Swarovski crystal shoes and purses along with custom and one of a kind Monster High dolls! We also sell small accessories like movie related jewelry. We LOVE fandoms! Most of what we do and sell are based on our favorite and other popular nerdy fandoms.

The fundraiser is designed through a rewards system mostly consisting of cosplay photos as originally the company was started by and run by one person (Katia) and the initial page was for cosplay photos. Since then a business has grown. Chris joined as a partner this year and all bags, shoes, and dolls are customized by hand.

There are other rewards as well, just check out the list of perks! (And see them in the gallery!)

Hi!! I am Katia. Or Kate. Or Katie. Or as most of you know me Princess Nightmare. I am not spectacular with words so forgive me for this. If you have known me a really long time you know me as a friend, if you have known me for a few years you know me as a cosplayer, if you have known me only a couple years you may know me as a cosplayer half a costume company, if you have only known me for a couple months you know the huge new part of my life which is my custom accessories design (including Doctor Who, Harry Potter, Game of Thrones, other Literary references, and other nerdy custom accessories as well as custom bridal shoes and accessories). I am not going to sit here and give you the sob story of stuff that has happened to me in the past. I hate when people do that. There is no reason for it. This is about the future. My entire life I have dreamed big but big dreams have to start small. I am an artist, I am creative and ambitious-and the next step in my life is to make things happen.

This is it, it has been my dream since I was 5 years old to run my own company. I have been in partnerships, I have held key roles in other independent companies but it is time for it to be my own. Products I make, things I do. Time to make my own dreams come true.

So! Why donate and What do you get?

Our goal is what we need to get to NYCC

A lot of you have met us at NYCC in the past or seen us at Steampunk World's Faire. We no longer have backers or partner companies we are all on our own now! We are very excited but NYCC is our big event and it costs a fair bit. So, we need your help to raise the funds to get back to NYCC!!

*Please note this is not for cosplay. The rewards are cosplay related because of the community we generate the most attention from, however this is not a fundraiser to cosplay at a convention it is for a small business of fandom and custom nerdy accessories.

We were hoping to only have to do this last year but starting anew takes time so one more go at fundraising for NYCC. I hate asking people for money. This is my exception, I am determined to get back to continue on the fantastic path we have started!

Now for the Reward System!! This is the important part right! What do you get for helping us out! So, here we go! A lot of people on the Facebook page have been asking me to sell photos/signed/personalized cosplay photos…so here it is! This is your chance to get those photos you have been asking about!! Some you have seen before if you have been on the page, and this time MANY are exclusive to this fundraiser!

Other rewards include products we make and other things. You can read more about it if/when you are ready to make a contribution!

If we don't reach our entire goal-the funds still go towards the convention. It will make it either slightly or significantly more difficult depending on how short we fall of the goal, but no matter what all funds go towards the convention. In all honesty we are terrified of not reaching my goal. However, If for some reason we do manage to exceed the goal we will add some more things to our standard inventory as there have been a lot of requests lately! :-) As well as sending out extra perks to anyone that donated!!

ALL US SHIPPING IS FREE!

Unfortunately shipping will be added on for perks being mailed internationally :-( We are terribly sorry about this but it's the cost of postage. SHIPPING TO THE US IS FREE!

Photos are glossy 8.5x11 (or close to 8.5x11 some are slightly off in dimension because they are more square etc but most are 8.5x11 and all will be printed on 8.5x11 paper). All prints will be signed!

LASTLY to SEE the rewards GO TO the gallary!!

Please send a note to theprincessnightmare@outlook.com if you choose an advertising perk or a perk that contains multiple options and tell us what you would like us to advertise or which option you are choosing from the list on perks that have multiple options!! (AND you can buy digital perks multiple times to purchase all options!!)

Every little bit helps! Just $5 and sharing/spreading the word! We thank you so much for your time! Please visit us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter!

And thank you all in advance for your time and help!





****ALL PHYSICAL MAILED PERKS WILL BE SENT AFTER NYCC (October 2015 and no later than December 2015). Advertising perks...If you need it to be immediately please just let us know! Digital Perks will be sent once the fundraiser ends and all funds have cleared.

 If we hit our goal there will be extra perks sent out to everyone.  On the off chance we EXCEED the goal everyone will get a few extra perks! If you donated for a digital perk you will get an extra bonus digital perk, if you donated for a print you will get an extra exclusive print, etc! :-)

Please visit us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter!And thank you all in advance for your time and help!****ALL PHYSICAL MAILED PERKS WILL BE SENT AFTER NYCC (October 2015 and no later than December 2015). story:
Two millennial women in the hot new startup scene of Austin, TX have launched A MILLENNIUM AGENCY.
Combining Alexa Hinds's traditional agent experience and roots in backstage & casting with Tay Allyn, viral video phenom with over 4,000,000 Youtube channel views these girls are breaking down walls and building the future entertainment business model.

Our dream with Millennium is to raise the level of professionalism here in Austin by working with select talent to fully develop their resumes, headshots, and social media profiles and then work side-by-side with businesses and startups in the city to sculpt and architect their content creation. In-depth one on one branding sessions will occur with both artists and companies on topics such as trendability, artistic message, target audiences,  becoming a tastemaker in your field, and so on.
Alexa Hinds- Talent Agent, alexa@amillenniumagency.com
Tay Allyn- Digital Branding + Production, tay@amillenniumagency.com

 amillenniumagency.com                        Song- 'Rollercoasters' by Bleachers.

story:
THE IDEA

WELCOME & thank you for allowing me to share "My Story."   When I  developed ScrewGrab I IMMEDIATELY Fell in Love .... I mean, who has never stripped out a screw head or rounded a nut doing a home project or a work thing :-) If it hasn't happen yet, it will ... just a matter of time :-)  Whether installing a deck, hanging a curtain rod, working on your I-Phone, restoring a vintage car or repairing some Machine at work -  ScrewGrab will bail you out.  Independent Testing has shown that ScrewGrab INCREASES Friction or Torque between Fastener & Tool by OVER 400%, Grabbing right a hold of that Damaged Fastener! (Actual increase is over 800% - made some Recent  Enhancements,  need to upgrade my packaging) 

  • SCREWGRAB IN ACTION!

MAY not be the sexiest  product on the planet - It just WORKS, Each and Every Time.  Just a couple of Drops is all it takes, WORKS INSTANTLY with ALL types of Fasteners & Tools, Hand or Power - then Simply Wipes Clean after each use.

THE JOURNEY

NEXT STEP was to design retail packaging and set out to knock 'em dead!  Had some success with smaller Industrial type accounts here and there that have been very loyal repeat customers, just no real sales volume.   I never lost faith, knew I had a Good Product. My main target has always been major retailers  which has  been tough real estate to acquire. I simply have lacked the proper MARKET EXPOSURE & FUNDS to pull it off to date. 

MY WEBSITE has produced some success as well.  Although, these sales have relied on my customers  searching "how to remove a stripped screw" and then "finding me":-)   When they do, they buy!  Again, not the exposure & sales volume that I would expect from being displayed on a clip strip hanging off the shelf of multiple major retailers.  

COOLEST part of the Web sales was putting me in direct contact with END USERS, producing a "ton"  Testimonials, Rave Review's with many re-ordering multiple times.  Here are just an ACTUAL few; 

  • "Larry - I have been using ScrewGrab mostly with damaged screws.  It is the most amazing product that I have ever used!-Michael." "Larry - It came today and .... actually worked!  I am amazed! Thanks - Charlie." "Larry - Use the product at the shop, we call it "fitter in a can," mostly on allen hex keys. Thank you for a great product - John." "Larry - Used it on a stuck bolt for a shower faucet, worked great, you should be in hardware stores - Bob." "Larry - A great product that I use frequently around the home,  just wish that I could get it at my local Ace Hardware?! - Bill."  "Larry - Read about it in Consumer Motorcycle News, worked on the first Screw I tried, very impressed. Thanks - Gary." "Larry - Unbelievable, one of the tiny screws on my I-Phone was not coming out  ... ScrewGrab grabbed right a hold of it, I will definitely spread the word!" - Darrick

THE LAUNCH

SO you're probably thinking - Get To The Point Lar, why are we reading your Story? BECAUSE, IT FINALLY HAPPEN!  I just got strong commitments from a couple Major Retailers that are very impressed with ScrewGrab  and have AGREED to utilize my Clip Strip Merchandising Program.  THIS IS THE BREAK THAT I HAVE BEEN LOOKING FOR!  It is time to RAMP UP &  LAUNCH into RETAIL!!! 

THE FUNDING

The $68,500 that I am trying to raise with YOU will go "Straight to Inventory & Re-Tooling for Increased Production Capacity," locking-in On Time Delivery of their estimated initial order with Back-Up-Stock for the Follow-Up Order.  Re-Invested Profits will be used to GAIN MORE RETAIL PARTNERS & look into making a Quality INFOMERCIAL to further the ULTIMATE GOAL of seeing SCREWGRAB  become a "Household Name!" 

JUST NEED a little HELP to turn my humbling JOURNEY with ScrewGrab into an "Overnight Success":-)  Intrigued, maybe just a little?  Check out the PERKS and let US make this OUR Journey Going Forward!

(Actual increase is over 800% - made some Recent  Enhancements,  need to upgrade my packaging) SCREWGRAB IN ACTION!
MAY not be the sexiest  product on the planet - It just WORKS, Each and Every Time.  Just a couple of Drops is all it takes, WORKS INSTANTLY with ALL types of Fasteners & Tools, Hand or Power - then Simply Wipes Clean after each use.THE JOURNEYNEXT STEP was to design retail packaging and set out to knock 'em dead!  Had some success with smaller Industrial type accounts here and there that have been very loyal repeat customers, just no real sales volume.   I never lost faith, knew I had a Good Product. My main target has always been major retailers  which has  been tough real estate to acquire. I simply have lacked the proper MARKET EXPOSURE & FUNDS to pull it off to date. MY WEBSITE has produced some success as well.  Although, these sales have relied on my customers  searching "how to remove a stripped screw" and then "finding me":-)   When they do, they buy!  Again, not the exposure & sales volume that I would expect from being displayed on a clip strip hanging off the shelf of multiple major retailers.  COOLEST part of the Web sales was putting me in direct contact with END USERS, producing a "ton"  Testimonials, Rave Review's with many re-ordering multiple times.  Here are just an ACTUAL few; 
"Larry - I have been using ScrewGrab mostly with damaged screws.  It is the most amazing product that I have ever used!-Michael." "Larry - It came today and .... actually worked!  I am amazed! Thanks - Charlie." "Larry - Use the product at the shop, we call it "fitter in a can," mostly on allen hex keys. Thank you for a great product - John." "Larry - Used it on a stuck bolt for a shower faucet, worked great, you should be in hardware stores - Bob." "Larry - A great product that I use frequently around the home,  just wish that I could get it at my local Ace Hardware?! - Bill."  "Larry - Read about it in Consumer Motorcycle News, worked on the first Screw I tried, very impressed. Thanks - Gary." "Larry - Unbelievable, one of the tiny screws on my I-Phone was not coming out  ... ScrewGrab grabbed right a hold of it, I will definitely spread the word!" - Darrick
THE LAUNCHSO you're probably thinking - Get To The Point Lar, why are we reading your Story? BECAUSE, IT FINALLY HAPPEN!  I just got strong commitments from a couple Major Retailers that are very impressed with ScrewGrab  and have AGREED to utilize my Clip Strip Merchandising Program.  THIS IS THE BREAK THAT I HAVE BEEN LOOKING FOR!  It is time to RAMP UP &  LAUNCH into RETAIL!!! THE FUNDINGThe $68,500 that I am trying to raise with YOU will go "Straight to Inventory & Re-Tooling for Increased Production Capacity," locking-in On Time Delivery of their estimated initial order with Back-Up-Stock for the Follow-Up Order.  Re-Invested Profits will be used to GAIN MORE RETAIL PARTNERS & look into making a Quality INFOMERCIAL to further the ULTIMATE GOAL of seeing SCREWGRAB  become a "Household Name!" JUST NEED a little HELP to turn my humbling JOURNEY with ScrewGrab into an "Overnight Success":-)  Intrigued, maybe just a little?  Check out the PERKS and let US make this OUR Journey Going Forward!

story:
QuickSnip Summary

  • Waaaaazuppp peopleee! Very nice to kinda meet you, or what i guess would be reaching to you. My name is Ildefonso Prieto, but i go by Addopax and I love the artistic use of rhythms and poetry (R.a.p) to create songs or freestyles, in other words, I rap. But rappers normally advertize a brand to earn $bank$, which for example we have 50cent selling his own "EFFEN VODKA" so i thought to create my own brand called GudVybes. These two mix together to create what i call: "My internship"
  •  "Whaatt your internship?, WTF?"(Whaaat Too Funny) Yes I am in college and the thing is that, I want to be an entrepreneur, entrepreneurs create companies, so i thought, why not create an internship instead? So here we are. 
  • Now my internship revolves around 2 businesses that interact with each other, one is a Rap Youtube channel, focused on bringing rap entertainment, and the other is the GudVybes brand, focused on spreading good vibes all around by using actions to make the world a little better to live in.
  • This is pretty much my own business learning ground, mixed with my artistic passion to create a fun experience that will help me grow, learn and earn. This is My Internship. (~FREE SHIPPING~ on all products)

What We Need & What You Get


  • I am looking to raise $10000. Straight off the bat around 70% of those 10k will be going towards launching this campaign(from set up fees, recording costs, and majorly the cost of the goods sold in the perks section) Also i plan to donate 15% of my revenues, meaning ill donate $1500 if i reach my goal to several "GudVybes". I mean to spread GudVybes into different causes like helping professors from low resources school develop cool projects for kids, helping internationally by giving 30 families clean water for a year, changing the life of a homeless guy, giving to cancer research, and last but not least help my family in Venezuela. Finally the rest of the money will go to my pockets(15% or 1500 for a whole summer worth of work), which will most likely be used to expand my business, ranging from maintaining the GudVybes brand alive, to improving the size and quality of my Youtube Rap Channel. Plus, no one likes doing an unpaid internship.
  • What i love about this crowdfunding campaign is that if you donate you get something in return(what indiegogo calls "perks")! We got bracelets, hats, mugs, the album itself, you could even get a song or poem tailored for you( meaning you decide what the piece is about, could be literally anything). Or you can simply donate how ever much you want!
  • The whole purpose of this is for me to be able to learn what it is to be an entrepreneur from this exceptional experience.  If i don't reach my goal of $10000 then it will be a shame, and a failure to learn from, so for every dollar that i don't earn I'm sure there is a lesson to learn. But more importantly the money will go for the same cause of expanding both the GudVybes brand and the Youtube channel regarless of me reaching my goal or not. Which i will, its only 10k after all.

The Impact

  • I believe that spreading GudVybes is a simple numbers game, the more people spread good vibes around, the better our societies would get. Better societies, better places, better world.Sounds simple, and it is.
  • The idea with the GudVybes brand its to spread a symbol of good vibes everywhereeee, but you cant just tell people "Hey! you! do good!" and expect them to do good(Even i ignore those who just demand me to do something), so i thought, how do the natural GudVybes travel the world? i mean we have seen it before, someone does something good and the people watching get the feeling they should do something good too. And i suddenly realized it, its by example, an example of a GudVybe motivates others. So i decided i needed to use some of the money raised in this campaign to create a GudVybe to set the example! to Lead a movement of GudVybes!
  • Lets all spread GUD VYBESSSSS

Risks & Challenges

  • One of my biggest challenge is all of it, this is my first time doing this. I don't know what can come up, that's a risk on itself. Also the fact that for part of the project I'm going to be hitting the books for classes, during that time its going to be hard to juggle school and this. 
  • To be honest to solve any of the issues I face I am just going to grind as much as i can, and if i fall on a challenge then ill get up an try again until i succeed even if it takes me more than just a few tries.

Other Ways You Can Help

As i said before, this project its all about spreading good vibes! so even if you cant donate to get any of the GudVybes merchandise its ok, i would simply ask you to spread GudVybes with the people you encounter in your life. Also you can still play a huge role on this campaign by sharing this project on social media, the indiegogo share tool, and simply telling or showing your friends. Please help this journey be a gud one!

story:
Short Summary

Arrow And Heart Lifestyle Merchants is a small family owned online surf lifestyle clothing retailer from Queensland Australia. We stock the highest quality brands from around the world including The Ancients MFG from Hawaii USA and Passenger Clothing from the south coast of England UK.

We are now looking to add two more brands to our store "The Flvx Co." from Bali Indonesia (sample images in gallery)  and "Strata" from the USA.(summer look book below)




We are raise funds to get our first orders available online in Australia and do some much needed advertising.


What We Need & What You Get


*With a $1000 we can place our order with FLVX CO and have it available online.

*With $5000 we can place our order with FLVX CO and STRATA and have it available online.

(Why we need $5000 to add both brands is because STRATA'S Minimum orders are a lot higher then FLVX)

*With $7000 we can place our order with FLVX CO, STRATA and launch our advertising campaign.

(Advertising will include facebook and an online surf magazine Liquify)


What you get for funding our campaign is listed on the right of the screen. We are giving you bonus store credits up to $100 to be used on any products on our site with one year from the end of this campaign to redeem it.

All funders go into the draw to win a Strata and Flvx Co clothing pack worth over $180.

The Impact

With your support we can grow our small business and get more and more new exciting brands into Australia!

Without your support we wouldn't be able to get brands like STRATA and THE FLVX CO into Australia.


Other Ways You Can Help

help us get the word out by sharing our campaign on facebook, instagram and twitter. This is easy with the indiegogo share tool.

You can check out our website at www.arrowandheart.com and on facebook / instagram search for arrowandheartlm

story:
Short Summary

First off, thank you for taking time out of your day to learn more about us!

Earth Evolved was created by two people -- a young couple with the same ideas and questions about life. We just started a couple months ago, and have already released our website, which includes a shop and blog. Our blog helps us to connect with people and potential customers about issues that matter. We also provide simple DIY tips & tricks for sustainability.

We just got our first sales this past week and could not be more excited about it. The reason we're excited, doesn't have to do with money. We're excited because a movement of sustainability and eco-friendly practices is taking over the world right now. This is a trend that actually matters.

We are striving to make Earth Evolved a one-stop-shop for people looking to make positive changes in their life...Whether it's switching out chemical filled home products for natural ones or it's using solar energy to power simple devices. We want to be the place that makes this easy for people. No one should have to search Google for hours finding the perfect water purifier, natural beauty products, energy drinks, organic gardening products, etc.

The only way we can achieve this dream is with your help. Whether you're an eco-conscious person, thinking about it, or just interested in the idea, we need you!


How We're Different:

We tried to think about what frustrated us most about changing our lifestyle to one that was greener and more sustainable. We came up with a few problems, and then found solutions.

  1. We Only Offer Products We've Used In Our Home.  When you're searching for natural products online, you'll find hundreds upon thousands of solutions. We cut out the dirty work and make it simple for you. We will only post products on our website that we or a family member has used in our homes.
  2. Monthly Top 10 Products + Video.  Every month we add 10 products to our Top 10 department. We believe that these products deserve some extra spotlight, and know that you'll love them too. To really show you how great each products is, we will create and upload a 30-second video for each of our Top 10 products. This allows you and other customers to really see for yourselves why we think these products are so great.
  3. Only Supporting Brands We're Proud Of.  We care about the whole package. What’s inside of the product, how it was manufactured, the company’s values, and so much more. We only support brands that are trying to make a difference in the world. Animal testing, fair trade, organic ingredients -- all of that is taken into consideration

Why We Need Your Help:

Inventory

  • With the money raised on IndieGoGo, our doors are going to open up to so many more products, which we can add to our site. Drop shipping isn't that common, especially for smaller companies that provide sustainable products. So the only way we can become distributors for more natural inventory, is with money to purchase it.
  • With inventory, we can provide samples of some of our products to people, so they can test it against those that they are currently using. Some people still have doubts about natural & sustainable products, believing that they aren't as effective as those from a lab. But that's not true and we want to help people to realize that!
Business Costs
  • We quit our full-time jobs in the renewable energy industry to pursue our dream at Earth Evolved. We work from home to not have any added costs, but there are still the basics like electricity, water, etc. A small portion of this money would go towards helping us keep the business running.


The Perks




               


             


The Impact

We can help the environment and water quality greatly, just by providing people with alternatives for cleaning and gardening products. When people start to change all aspects of their life to eco-friendly, green energy, and sustainable products, the magnitude of the positive effects this will have is endless.

As a couple, we have worked together at our last 3 jobs and have the perfect business partnership of balancing one-another out. Combined, we have a background of web/graphic design, small business consulting, and sales. We know how a business works and have learned what it takes to be successful, but it's always a process.

One of the main ingredients for a successful business is having people that fund and believe in you, so that's why we're here!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have any money to help out, no worries! We understand and are right there with you. If you like what we're doing and want to support, feel free to check us out and follow us from the below links or on our blog.

Thanks for supporting!
Earth Evolved

Facebook

Instagram

Pinterest

Twitter

story:
Help us create a stunningly beautiful not-for-profit Yoga Community Center in the heart of Princeton!

We are creating something completely new and different in the Princeton area... not only a studio, but a Yoga Community Center where, at no fee, people can take yoga classes, come for Guided Meditations, participate in The Enlightened Readings Bookclub or The Bhagavad Gita Study Group, come for Kirtan or the monthly Nataraj Dance Party, use the beautiful meditation room, The Oasis, or hang out in The Nook to read from our library and enjoy some tea! 

But we can't do this alone. 

Will you please help us?


From Our Director, Jayadeva:

It has been my dream and life's purpose to share the yoga teachings with people. Since I was a child I have held a vision of doing this! Then, after meeting my Guru, Sri Swami Satchidananda, it became even clearer to me.

I began teaching yoga in 1969, managed one of the oldest and largest yoga centers in the country, the New York Integral Yoga Institute, for 5 years, have been training great yoga instructors for 20 years, and moved to Princeton, New Jersey 16 years ago.

When coming to Princeton, I dreamed of establishing special yoga works that would help many, especially helping share the fullness of all yoga has to offer. 

Since then a wonderful spiritual community has blossomed. We set up a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit yoga work which the IRS called "a spiritual mission." We then created the Princeton Integral Yoga Institute 7 years ago. 

Small beginnings...

Our original space only had a single studio space, but we became one of the most active yoga works around with a staff of 50 people offering a large range of yoga classes, workshops, events with visiting renowned kirtan artists, presenters, sages and saints, yoga teacher trainings, dance programs, and much more.

But we found that our location and space truly limited us. 

There was SO much more we have wanted to give to the community! 

We have finally found the ideal space for the IYI and it has opened us to creating a truly unique service for the community.

We will call our new space The Princeton Integral Yoga Community Center.

The NEW Princeton Integral Yoga 
Community Center 

The Princeton Integral Yoga Community Center will be located at the Princeton Shopping Center at the heart of Princeton. 

What the new IY Community Center will offer:

  • 44 Yoga classes for all levels, accommodating those new, those experienced and those with special challenges, all at very affordable rates.
  • Extended hours (6:30am to 9:30pm on weekdays, and 7am to 2:30pm on weekends)
  • Open doors during those extended hours! Everyone will be welcome to come in at no fee, take advantage of the lovely dedicated meditation room, "The Oasis," or hang out in "The Nook," a comfortable room with a spiritual library and places to sit to have tea alone or with friends. 
  • Free guided meditations in "The Oasis" weekdays both morning and evening.
  • Free weekly study of the Bhagavad Gita.
  • Free-yoga-for-all on Community Yoga Day,  the 2nd Saturday of each month.
  • Free monthly Enlightened Readings Bookclub gathering.
  • Free monthly kirtan chanting evening.
  • Free monthly Nataraj Dance Party and so much more!

Special offerings will include:

  • Before-work & lunchtime yoga classes
  • Our renowned Yoga Teacher Training courses
  • Lots of special yoga-related workshops and courses
  • Programs with renowned presenters, performers and yogis
  • Beautiful yoga retreats, and more! 

The gorgeous new space!

Below are the architect's rendering of what we are building together.
A soundproof movable wall will allow us to have multiple classes occurring at once, or open the space for large events, kirtans, workshops and special performances!


Imagine yourself hanging out in "The Nook," a sitting room with a spiritual library and places to reflect, have tea alone or with friends.

How you can help (please do)

& get some great perks!!

To create this awesome place we must raise $200,000. 

Anyone who contributes can grab some of our amazing perks (many are available either in-person or via SKYPE so they are available for you even if you are giving from outside our local area!). Check the Perks column on the right. Included are:

  • Unlimited Yoga Classes for a Year with extra benefits included!
  •  Private Pranayama personal guidance from renowned teachers (in person or online)
  • Private Meditation workshops/personal consultations  from renowned teachers (in person or online)
  • Private or group Yoga Classes (in person or online) 
  • One-hour Stress-Management  workshop for individual or group (in person or online) 
  • Intuitive Readings and more!
Just look to the column on the right, choose your level of donation and browse our perks created just for you! 

We are asking everyone to please contribute what they can, and are hoping we can get support from well-wishers through Indiegogo to raise $50,000 of the $200,000 needed!

Why $200,000?

  • Demolition costs- $43,000. Because the space was previously a dermatologist's center, all 8 treatment rooms must be completely removed, including the sinks and electric socket units sticking up out of the floor. Several other rooms must be completely taken down to open the space for us to re-shape it into the beautiful place we want to make for everyone. Only the bathrooms and one office can be left as they are. The estimate for this work is $43,000.
  • Wall/Floor construction- $80,000. We need to construct the walls, put in the special flooring to do yoga and dance safely and comfortably, put a special sound-proof removable wall between the two studios so that they will be private classrooms and then open into a wonderful large presentation hall with a stage that folds up into the wall, the lighting, the sound system, building the pantry and The Nook and The Oasis, and then getting the supplies for all of the operations is estimated at another $80,000.

We need $123,000 to create the space itself.

Other Estimated Costs:

Our business plan projections show that we need an additional $100,000 as a capital fund to sustain the operational overhead expenses while people are discovering what we have for them in this lovely new space.

All of our instructors teach an average of one class per week as an offering without pay, and most of our staff also work without pay, too. This allows us to keep our rates low, and even more importantly creates such a beautiful atmosphere of loving service!

Super simple ways you can help:

Of course, a contribution means the world to us! 

And, just because you can't contribute, doesn't mean you can't be an amazing help!

Before you leave this page please use the social media icons and SHARE this campaign! Please spread the word any way you can! This would be very helpful.

Your generous contribution can make this dream come true!   Thank you!!
story_txt:
Help us create a stunningly beautiful not-for-profit Yoga Community Center in the heart of Princeton!


We are creating something completely new and different in the Princeton area... not only a studio, but a Yoga Community Center where, at no fee, people can take yoga classes, come for Guided Meditations, participate in The Enlightened Readings Bookclub or The Bhagavad Gita Study Group, come for Kirtan or the monthly Nataraj Dance Party, use the beautiful meditation room, The Oasis, or hang out in The Nook to read from our library and enjoy some tea! 



But we can't do this alone. 
Will you please help us?



From Our Director, Jayadeva:
It has been my dream and life's purpose to share the yoga teachings with people. Since I was a child I have held a vision of doing this! Then, after meeting my Guru, Sri Swami Satchidananda, it became even clearer to me.
I began teaching yoga in 1969, managed one of the oldest and largest yoga centers in the country, the New York Integral Yoga Institute, for 5 years, have been training great yoga instructors for 20 years, and moved to Princeton, New Jersey 16 years ago.
When coming to Princeton, I dreamed of establishing special yoga works that would help many, especially helping share the fullness of all yoga has to offer. 
Since then a wonderful spiritual community has blossomed. We set up a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit yoga work which the IRS called "a spiritual mission." We then created the Princeton Integral Yoga Institute 7 years ago. 
Small beginnings...



Our original space only had a single studio space, but we became one of the most active yoga works around with a staff of 50 people offering a large range of yoga classes, workshops, events with visiting renowned kirtan artists, presenters, sages and saints, yoga teacher trainings, dance programs, and much more.

But we found that our location and space truly limited us. 
There was SO much more we have wanted to give to the community! 
We have finally found the ideal space for the IYI and it has opened us to creating a truly unique service for the community.
We will call our new space The Princeton Integral Yoga Community Center.
   The NEW Princeton Integral Yoga Community Center 


The Princeton Integral Yoga Community Center will be located at the Princeton Shopping Center at the heart of Princeton. 
What the new IY Community Center will offer:


44 Yoga classes for all levels, accommodating those new, those experienced and those with special challenges, all at very affordable rates.

Extended hours (6:30am to 9:30pm on weekdays, and 7am to 2:30pm on weekends)

Open doors during those extended hours! Everyone will be welcome to come in at no fee, take advantage of the lovely dedicated meditation room, "The Oasis," or hang out in "The Nook," a comfortable room with a spiritual library and places to sit to have tea alone or with friends. 
Free guided meditations in "The Oasis" weekdays both morning and evening.
Free weekly study of the Bhagavad Gita.

Free-yoga-for-all on Community Yoga Day,  the 2nd Saturday of each month.

Free monthly Enlightened Readings Bookclub gathering.
Free monthly kirtan chanting evening.
Free monthly Nataraj Dance Party and so much more!
Special offerings will include:


Before-work & lunchtime yoga classes
Our renowned Yoga Teacher Training courses
Lots of special yoga-related workshops and courses

Programs with renowned presenters, performers and yogis

Beautiful yoga retreats, and more! 
The gorgeous new space!
Below are the architect's rendering of what we are building together.
A soundproof movable wall will allow us to have multiple classes occurring at once, or open the space for large events, kirtans, workshops and special performances!


Imagine yourself hanging out in "The Nook," a sitting room with a spiritual library and places to reflect, have tea alone or with friends.




    How you can help (please do)
& get some great perks!! 
To create this awesome place we must raise $200,000. 

Anyone who contributes can grab some of our amazing perks (many are available either in-person or via SKYPE so they are available for you even if you are giving from outside our local area!). Check the Perks column on the right. Included are:



Unlimited Yoga Classes for a Year with extra benefits included!
 Private Pranayama personal guidance from renowned teachers (in person or online)
Private Meditation workshops/personal consultations  from renowned teachers (in person or online)
Private or group Yoga Classes (in person or online) 
One-hour Stress-Management  workshop for individual or group (in person or online) 
Intuitive Readings and more!

Just look to the column on the right, choose your level of donation and browse our perks created just for you! 


We are asking everyone to please contribute what they can, and are hoping we can get support from well-wishers through Indiegogo to raise $50,000 of the $200,000 needed!



Why $200,000?



Demolition costs- $43,000. Because the space was previously a dermatologist's center, all 8 treatment rooms must be completely removed, including the sinks and electric socket units sticking up out of the floor. Several other rooms must be completely taken down to open the space for us to re-shape it into the beautiful place we want to make for everyone. Only the bathrooms and one office can be left as they are. The estimate for this work is $43,000.

Wall/Floor construction- $80,000. We need to construct the walls, put in the special flooring to do yoga and dance safely and comfortably, put a special sound-proof removable wall between the two studios so that they will be private classrooms and then open into a wonderful large presentation hall with a stage that folds up into the wall, the lighting, the sound system, building the pantry and The Nook and The Oasis, and then getting the supplies for all of the operations is estimated at another $80,000.
We need $123,000 to create the space itself.
Other Estimated Costs:
Our business plan projections show that we need an additional $100,000 as a capital fund to sustain the operational overhead expenses while people are discovering what we have for them in this lovely new space.
All of our instructors teach an average of one class per week as an offering without pay, and most of our staff also work without pay, too. This allows us to keep our rates low, and even more importantly creates such a beautiful atmosphere of loving service!
  Super simple ways you can help: Of course, a contribution means the world to us! 
And, just because you can't contribute, doesn't mean you can't be an amazing help!
Before you leave this page please use the social media icons and SHARE this campaign! Please spread the word any way you can! This would be very helpful.
Your generous contribution can make this dream come true!   Thank you!!

story:
The Short Story 

We've invented a new type of utensil that will not only make life easier but will greatly reduce the environmental impact of paper napkins. For example, if trongs were used on just 10% of chicken wings consumed, we'd save at least 3,000,000 napkins per year! In the US alone! Unlike any other eating utensil, it is an interface between your fingers and food because it allows you to pinch your food just like you do without a utensil while keeping your fingers clean. We need you, your friends, and other smart, good-looking people to help fund a new manufacturing tool for the new design, with new material. 

The Longer Story

The Pothole On the Road to Techville

A few years back, Dan and I were eating wings and ribs while working on another invention. The phone in Dan's pocket rang but his fingers were held captive by sauce. He scrambled to wipe his hands to extract his phone but still managed to drag a stain onto his pants just after the last ring. 

Well, it must have been the Future calling and we need your help returning the call. 

Since that day, we have worked tirefully (yeah, we're exhausted) to create the utensil that was missing from civilization: the trong. 

The trongs concept feels not like an invention, but a discovery of what other people would have invented years ago if they had the materials/tech. 

Here are the limitations in other eating utensils: chopsticks pinch food but only at two points and are tricky to use. The fork, relatively recent technology, is pretty limited. If you're not using it for balancing meager square-inch bits of food, then you are skewering a solid chuck of only boneless food in order to transport it to your mouth. 

The ideal utensil for solid foods larger than a few millimeters is the one that works most similarly to the hand(bio-mimicry), while still providing the benefit of shielding our fingers from the food and vice versa. Right? 

We agree and that's one of the reasons we were awarded US Patent # 8,419,092 (plus international) and why some folks at the History Channel's Invention USA gave us the thumbs up and connected us to our prototype injection mold for model 38. We manufactured trongs off that and were grateful winners in the QVC Sprouts Program, which got us on QVC thrice, the Today Show twice, BBC/PRI, with many more to come. 

Here are some of the practical applications of trongs:

  • Eating buffalo wings, shrimp cocktail, barbecue ribs, crudite platters, cheese puffs, and sushi
  • Food prep, such as dredging chicken cutlets
  • Politely pinching neighboring pizza slices to separate yours from the pie
  • Eating hors d'oeuvres at social or professional events and keeping your hands available for shaking
  • And most importantly, keeping your fingers free for tickling your tech

The Ask At Hand

All that pumping out of product has finished off our soft aluminum prototype mold and now we need a bigger and harder one (insert tasteless joke here). This campaign will hopefully fund a new mold or molds that will give birth to many millions or billions of the new trongs. 

What a profound thought: unlike the eating fork, which was invented in about 700 A.D. and did not gain common currency until the 1700's, here we are, from all across the land, converging around a better way to handle food.

The best measure of an invention is the product of these criteria:

1. How many people benefit

2. How much they benefit

3. How often they benefit

4. How long will the invention be around

Even though the trong is definitely low tech and simple, using the above standard, the trong scores fairly high. Here’s why: regarding how many people can benefit from this invention, there are more than 7 billion chronic masticators on this marble-we eat all the dang time. More of these people have a cell phone than access to a flushable toilet! (http://www.forbes.com/sites/timworstall/2013/03...).  This fact actually speaks to two dimensions of benefit: the prevalence of high tech, and the need for hygiene. The latter point assumes that a goodly amount of the 2,500,000 people who do not have a toilet probably lack running water for ‘post production’ hand washing. You may notice that I demonstrate how this invention obviates that in the opening scene of the pitch video. No bull. 

With variations on culture/cuisine, I reckon that with regard to how often people currently touch food with their fingers is pretty high, more than several times daily. How much trongs will help, is a function of how often we will use our fingers for other things whilst eating-and we all know that our use of, or dare I say, the appendage-ization of cell phones and other technology to our bodies is growing at an exponential rate. 

The Fingerlarity Is Here

The full integration of biology and technology is what von Neumann, Vinge, and Kurzweil, et al refer to as the Singularity which, at this rate, is not too far off. Even today can you effectively function in this world without the device on which you are reading these words right now? If you're like most, probably not. That's not sad. It's true because this technology provides you great benefit! Like essentially transcending time and space so you can talk to people out of earshot. Or learn about a totally new type of eating utensil! An invention that you and lots of other people from all over the world can help fund so you can get your hands on it, feed your biology and feel your technology all in one sitting. So back to our criteria of how many, how much, how often, and how long, and these little finger things are looking pretty good. 

The Environmental Case-Gotta be crazy not to.

Let's look at the environmental impact because that's the part of the benefit calculation that is easily superficialized if considered at all by most. We are looking to raise money for tooling to mass produce stainless steel trongs. An injection mold for plastic! What a horrible word right? Not. Although we will continue to research material for a biodegradable trong, the reality is that most trash winds up in landfills, not composts. In a landfill, there is very little biodegradation. (see http://humanitieslab.stanford.edu/23/174). We are committed to minimizing any negative environmental effects and even the beta trongs that we ran off the aluminum prototype mold, and offered in our ship now perks, are made from a reusable polypropylene plastic. Still, we saw some on-line reviews from people who thought that those trongs "looked flimsy", the reality is that they are light and gracile as is required for comfort, but yet are quite durable so that they can be washed and reused by consumers. And yes, plastic is made from petroleum, which we pull from the ground, but we don't burn this fossil fuel, and even if folks eventually throw them away, and the trongs don’t follow the normal garbage vector to a landfill, then they go back into the earth as a largely inert food-safe unit. The worst and truly bad case is if they wind up in our waterways or oceans. In their current form this is unlikely due to the size. Hopefully, people will cherish their trongs so much, they get appendagized like cell phones did.

What Do We  Do With Our Freedom? 

If just 1% of the world's population reclaims just 30 seconds every day, that's 5.8 million hours of human productivity! Per Day! The benefit is not just time and convenience depending on whatever we do with our tech, but paper napkins and energy used to treat, heat, and pump the water that washes trongless fingers when we are prepping food in the kitchen or prior to eating. Granted, we still wash the trong once, at the end of the use event, but that’s twice as good as washing twice, before and after, or the half a dozen times a home cook might during a proper dinner prep.

Risks & Challenges

Let's be realistic though; we are asking people to change the way they do something very visceral-eating. We don't have to look that far to see that we humans don't always quickly adopt a new and better way of doing things. But I sincerely think this friction is being lubricated by technology, more specifically the information that we share using technology. We are learning to learn, to adopt new apps, and ways of doing things. Besides, the singularity is on our side. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot provide funding now, please share with all your friends and everyone else. Keep Calm and Carry Trongs.

Thank You, 

Eric Zimmermann, Co-Inventor and believer in a better future.

story:
Our Mission

  • FolioAudio: Bringing Shakespeare to the Digital Age, by providing modern, easily accessible Audiobooks of the highest quality.  
  • We provide the new generation of students with an easily accessible medium in which to enjoy and learn great classic works, even while "on-the-go."  
  • We provide professional actors an opportunity to work in the voice over industry, as well as earn residual income to aid them in long-term wealth-building.  

Who we are:

  • My name is Peter Sipla, and I am the Founder/Manager of FolioAudio.  
  • I have been working in the Voice Over industry for the past six years, and on stage for the past seventeen years. 
  • I am passionate about empowering students.  I have worked for the past decade with Speech and Forensics Teams, helping students learn how to communicate uniquely, and effectively, in the public arena.
  • I am excited to bring talented artists together in a fun atmosphere, and bring Shakespeare to the new generation.
  • I am dedicated to helping performing artists achieve successful and even lucrative careers.            
Our Goal:
  • By contributing, you help us towards our ultimate goal of gifting Shakespeare audiobooks to 10,000 students!
  • We are looking to hit the goal of at least 300 copies for students with this Campaign.

The Impact

FolioAudio's Focus on Bringing Shakespeare to Students

  • FolioAudio supplies high quality audiobooks to students and fans of Shakespeare, by making them easily accessible and affordable.
  • Our Audiobooks are focused on Storytelling, Clarity, Theatricality, and Entertainment, while staying in the Intimate Realm of an Audiobook.  (They will not sound like a live recording in a cavernous theater or an old-time radio-play, ala John Gielgud or Orson Welles' productions of old.  Though both hold a dear place in our heart)
FolioAudio's Focus on Charitable Donations
  • 5% of all FolioAudio's sales are donated to Charities and not-for-profits focused on educating and empowering people to lead successful lives.
  • 5% of all FolioAudio's sales are donated to Theatre Companies' school outreach programs, who bring the performing arts to students.
FolioAudio's Focus on Helping Artists Build Wealth
  • Our hired professional talent receive Residual Income from all presales and future sales of their work on our audiobooks, giving them an opportunity to build long-term wealth. 

Our Track Record

  • Earlier this year, I helped lead a group to successfully raise $2,000, through crowd-funding, for Bridge Communities, a charity devoted to housing and helping homeless families reach financial independence. 
  • Over the past 13 years, I have been dedicated to finding work and recommending qualified artists for positions that supplement or become their main source of income.  These positions include: corporate consulting, teaching positions at performing arts schools and churches, and high school speech team coaching/tournament judging.  

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise$2,999.  This money goes toward:
  • Startup costs: filing articles of incorporation, logo creation/branding, website creation, advisor fees, and attorney fees.  
  • Production costs:  the voice actors' share of all presales, and the cost of producing and mastering the final product.
  • Advertising through Facebook Dark Posts, Google AdWords, and other marketing avenues.
Perks:
  • Our Perks are an avenue to reserve your copy of our first audiobook, as well as buy one or more for individual students!  The students receive a copy free to them, as you have bought it for them at a discount! 
  •  A $15 donation gets you a digital copy of our first audiobook 
  • At $25, You reserve a copy for a student, and a copy for you
  • At $35, You reserve two copies students, and a copy for you
  • At $50, You reserve 5 copies! (one for you, and four for students to download)
  • For every $10 above $50, you reserve a copy for another student!
  • At $200, You receive a v.o. narration for your child's favorite bedtime story, OR a voicemail greeting for you/your company, and reserve 20 copies of the audiobook for you and students!
  • At $500, You reserve 50 copies, and receive a v.o. studio session for a commercial for your company, with a 1-year built-in buyout! ($800+ value)
  • At $1,000, You receive an acknowledgement IN the actual audiobook, and reserve 100 copies for you and students!
  • At $3,000, You receive a "Presented by" credit at the Beginning of the audiobook, and reserve 300 copies for you and students! 
IF we do not reach the entire goal amount:
  • We are still going forward with the plan, and will look forward to more sales from our website, iTunes, GooglePlay, and other sales platforms.   
IF we exceed the goal amount:
  • Hooray!  We consider this a blessing and  will ecstatically gift all those copies to students!  We will also start with pre-production of our Second Audiobook!  

Risks & Challenges

  • We have advisors in the voice over and sound recording industry, who can help troubleshoot any production issues that may arise. 
  • We have access to experienced teachers of Shakespeare to help deliver quality performances of his works.
  • We are continuously learning and implementing new skills to improve our ability  to deliver high quality Shakespeare audiobooks to as many students as possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please help us to get the word out about our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and the like!
  • You can like our fb fan page!
  • You can also use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks for taking the time to read about our campaign!

Over the past 13 years, I have been dedicated to finding work and recommending qualified artists for positions that supplement or become their main source of income.  These positions include: corporate consulting, teaching positions at performing arts schools and churches, and high school speech team coaching/tournament judging.  
   What We Need & What You Get
Our goal is to raise$2,999.  This money goes toward:

Startup costs: filing articles of incorporation, logo creation/branding, website creation, advisor fees, and attorney fees.  
Production costs:  the voice actors' share of all presales, and the cost of producing and mastering the final product.
Advertising through Facebook Dark Posts, Google AdWords, and other marketing avenues.


Perks:

Our Perks are an avenue to reserve your copy of our first audiobook, as well as buy one or more for individual students!  The students receive a copy free to them, as you have bought it for them at a discount! 
 A $15 donation gets you a digital copy of our first audiobook 
At $25, You reserve a copy for a student, and a copy for you
At $35, You reserve two copies students, and a copy for you
At $50, You reserve 5 copies! (one for you, and four for students to download)
For every $10 above $50, you reserve a copy for another student!
At $200, You receive a v.o. narration for your child's favorite bedtime story, OR a voicemail greeting for you/your company, and reserve 20 copies of the audiobook for you and students!
At $500, You reserve 50 copies, and receive a v.o. studio session for a commercial for your company, with a 1-year built-in buyout! ($800+ value)
At $1,000, You receive an acknowledgement IN the actual audiobook, and reserve 100 copies for you and students!
At $3,000, You receive a "Presented by" credit at the Beginning of the audiobook, and reserve 300 copies for you and students! 

IF we do not reach the entire goal amount:

We are still going forward with the plan, and will look forward to more sales from our website, iTunes, GooglePlay, and other sales platforms.    
IF we exceed the goal amount:
Hooray!  We consider this a blessing and  will ecstatically gift all those copies to students!  We will also start with pre-production of our Second Audiobook!  

    Risks & Challenges

We have advisors in the voice over and sound recording industry, who can help troubleshoot any production issues that may arise. 
We have access to experienced teachers of Shakespeare to help deliver quality performances of his works.
We are continuously learning and implementing new skills to improve our ability  to deliver high quality Shakespeare audiobooks to as many students as possible.    Other Ways You Can Help  Please help us to get the word out about our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and the like!
You can like our fb fan page! You can also use the Indiegogo share tools!   Thanks for taking the time to read about our campaign!

story:
If every Wadsworth resident were able to donate just $5 per year (tax deductible), our station would be sustainable for decades to come!

Our mission is to enhance the sense of community among residents in Grizzly Town by providing news and information about the community, for the community and by the community.

We are the place to find all Wadsworth High School sports scores and stories, professional photos from the games and interviews with the players and their coaches.

We are the place where local musicians showcase their talent and entertain listeners.

We are Wadsworth Community Radio!

About Wadsworth Community Radio 

For years, it was the vision of Joe and Susan Arpad to have a radio station further connect the wonderful community of Wadsworth, Ohio. Thanks to a generous donation by the Arpads in 2014, Wadsworth Community Radio was born! The gracious funding allowed us to purchase the needed equipment to begin broadcasting along with our license by the Federal Communications Commission (FCC). Our low-power community radio station in Grizzly Town also reaches surrounding neighborhoods within a 10-mile radius of our antenna site. 

On Feb. 9, 2015, Wadsworth Community Radio began broadcasting online and on smart devices with a live morning show and classic tunes from the 70s, 80s and 90s, with a few currents mixed in. Three months later, our FM signal was up and our programming heard loud and clear on 97.1, WWWR-LP and worldwide via our website and apps for smart devices.  

A project of the non-profit Wadsworth Communications Inc., we are a team of four part-time radio enthusiasts, some who have decades of experience and others who are just digging into the excitement of community radio.

We program music, tell unique stories, do exciting interviews, run shows about area history, detail local events, have local bands perform acoustically, along with showcasing other expressions of local life.

Our volunteer team is well-known throughout Wadsworth for our commitment to professionalism, unique content and creativity. We are known for having a strong presence at local festivals, sporting events, causes and for bringing people together by the content we create and share.

You are an integral part to keeping us able to tell the stories you love to hear, to share in the laughter, grief and love of our beautiful community, to cheer our sports teams on and highlight our academic scholars, to encourage residents to follow their dreams and give you – the community – a voice.

Our generous start-up donation is running out and that's why we need your tax-deductible contribution to keep Wadsworth Community Radio on the air and online!

 
What We Need & What You Get

Our operating budget is $10,000/month, which includes paying 4 part-time employees, music licensing, equipment upgrades/needs, the space we occupy in the FirstMerit Bank building downtown, our electrical and a few administrative costs, Internet, phone and remote (on location) equipment costs.

Most major businesses in the area already had their budgets spent before we were up and running, meaning we need $85,000 to get us through to 2016. Why are we asking for only a portion of the $120,000 yearly budget? Because a generous benefactor has signed on to match all donations up to $35,000.

Our goals

Your tax-deductible donation will continue the success of our station and help us expand to include:

- We are currently working on a heroin awareness initiative. Our goal is to talk about this epidemic and about what we can do to help addicts and their families. Ultimately, we would like to be able to donate some funds to families who are grieving a loss from addiction or families who need help paying for addiction treatment.

- Training for local high school students, college students and community members who want to pursue a career or just learn about the field of radio.

- Start a college scholarship fund whereby we plan to award 1 scholarship a year to a Wadsworth High School student pursuing a career in broadcasting.

- Hire interns and part-time help for sports broadcasting, web work and various on-air roles.

Risks & Challenges

If every Wadsworth resident were able to donate just $5 per year, our station would be sustainable for decades to come.

If we are unable to secure the $85,000, our radio station will have to sign off the air. It's truthfully that plain and simple. We love what we do and we love serving you. We know you love us so now is when we could really use your financial support.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can help us financially. But you can help us spread the word by sharing this with Wadsworthians you know who live locally and across the globe. Please share this page with all of your friends on social media as often as you can!

story:
After nine months of providing services to the homeless in our community, I've come to the conclusion that we are only touching the periphery of a much bigger problem. What we do, through Clint's Cupboard, is wonderful, providing a meal, toiletries, clothing and a smile, handshake or hug each week. But, we are only able to do this one day per week and reach a limited number of needy folks.

I have talked to many volunteers and donors over the past nine months, regarding what our plans were, to expand our services and outreach in the future. My response has always been that we fit a niche, by providing basic essentials to the homeless, without judgment or prerequisites on their part. After seeing the support we've received from so many wonderful people, I'm convinced that we can continue what we do, and by applying for grants and seeking donations, expand our services. We also look to form alliances with other NGOs and groups that are dedicated to helping solve the homeless problem.

Shelters are everywhere, offering temporary, short-term protection, usually requiring that the premises be vacated during daylight hours.  These shelters are much-needed for immediate protection, however, they also serve to perpetuate the cycle of homelessness.  They do not address the problem, seeking to eradicate it, or drastically reduce it.   

I dream of taking the homeless off the street, giving them temporary shelter, safe from the ravages of weather, police harassment, public disgust or denial, and being used as political footballs. Once protected, I envision moving those who are capable, into permanent housing, where they can receive mental health and addiction counseling.  At that point, we can then provide employment training and job placement, ending the homeless cycle. Even after that, we will continue to counsel, mentor provide support. There are other communities in the country where these services are provided successfully, so we have a roadmap and schematic for creating such a program here. We CAN eliminate hunger in the areas we serve; we CAN eliminate homelessness and we CAN create a vision of hope and opportunity in these same areas. We are creating partnerships with local government leaders, who have given us a commitment of support!

With the funds we raise now, we will be forming a non-profit corporation and apply for 501(c)(3) (tax-exempt) status with the IRS. By taking these steps, we can qualify for tax-deductible donations, as well as grants from foundations and organizations. The IRS filing fee is $400 for non-profits with revenues under $50,000 annually. The balance is for filing our corporation documents with the State of Maryland, along with IndieGoGo & PayPal fees.  We are grateful to our attorney who has offered his expertise in working with non-profits, without his regular fees!

Some say that I am a dreamer...that's probably true; but, without dreams, we can't create better realities! All great change begins with a dream. I hope you will continue to help us turn dreams into reality. Let's harness the love, caring and dedication of those who have helped us create this wonderful community over the past nine months, and continue our commitment to really making a difference.

As people have heard me say over and over again: "We can't change the entire world, but we CAN change our own world, where we live, work and play!" Our children deserve nothing less!

It has been a blessing to do this work and to meet all the volunteers who have donated time and resources to our efforts! Any monies raised in excess of our goal will be used to purchase items from our Amazon Wish List for Clint's Cupboard.

Gratefully, 
Ron Pagano, JD

story:
Un projet de culture et d'amour floral!. Je suis herboriste, au service de la transmission des vertus infinies que nous proposent les plantes médicinales, pour rendre accessible à tous une alternative à la médecine conventionnelle. Pour ceux et celles qui on envie de se tourner vers une alternative plus saine et naturelle. Je démarre mon projet d'entreprise aujourd'hui qui vise à offrir des produits de santé et de bien-être naturel concoctés avec soin, de la graine au petit pot de crème. Un projet qui se veut investi dans la belle région gaspésienne que nous nous devons d'entretenir et de faire vivre! Le but est aussi de développer le marché web pour permettre à tous à travers le Québec (et qui sait, peut-être encore plus loin éventuellement) de pouvoir bénéficier de mes produits par envoie postal. Un projet qui va dans le sens d'une économie locale, d'un respect de notre terre et de la santé de nos corps. Le but de Clou de Girafe est de proposer des  tisanes qui guérissent, mais qui sont à la fois un délice pour nos sens! Ainsi que des onguents, des huiles, des baumes qui soulagent, mais qui sont également un moment de réconfort, une petite douceur que l'on s'accorde dans notre vie moderne exigeante et bien essoufflante!  Joindre l'utile à l'agréable est mon petit défi. 

Je sollicite votre aide aujourd'hui pour me donner le petit coup de pouce nécessaire à mon lancement. J'ai besoin d'un certain montant de base pour pouvoir m'équiper de tout le matériel nécessaire aux transformations de produits, cartes d'affaires, étiquetage, emballage, outils, développement du site internet, etc, et ainsi commencer l'activité avec Clou de Girafe aussi rapidement que permis. 

*Formation d'Herboriste Thérapeute Naturopathe (2239 heures) avec l'Herbothèque (www.herbotheque.com)

story:
Formerly a Manager with the Brooklyn Chamber of Commerce, football player/sports fan Carlos Tchaka Russell, owner of Wild Whiskey Warthog views it as a haven for CBJC, Big Breather Blues artists and iconic performers like “nappy headed” Patsy Grant, beautiful blues, R&b singer and with a charming back yard, as an affordable special events venue.  

Against the odds, in the heart of edgy, Crown Heights this  1,000 square feet, 2,000 with back yard space over the last year, has been totally renovated by Carlos,  his parents Carlos Russell, educator, founder, Black Solidarity Day, Jacqui D. Woods, Creative Arts Consultant, family and friends.  Like many aficionados of fine liquor, Carlos favors excellent whiskey and will feature “DEFIANT”, manufactured in North Carolina by former sandhogs who worked after “Sandy” to clean up the subway system and “ Nikka Whiskey”,  Japan to name a few. In a nod to local Caribbean and Hispanic communities New York small batch makers, like Port Morris Distillery, Manhattan manufacturer of “pitorro” anejo, Puerto Rican and Caribbean moonshine will also occupy prime shelf space. 

If you share our vision of a safe haven for the socially and culturally conscious music from established and newer artists, sports fans,  affordable special events, and good liquor!! Help by joining our Indiegogo Campaign to raise $8,000 that will enable us to open and operate in the summer of 2015.   With our offerings and later with our presence, we promise to make it worth your precious dollars!!

story:
58-years long story 

The Jean de la Lune (JDL) was built in 1957 in Brittany as a Staysail Schooner. She was initially designed as one of the last French wooden Sailing Fishing Vessels in Lorient and worked out of Douarnenez. She is constructed out of oak planks on an oak frame, and her graceful fine lines reflect those of a traditional French sailing vessel. JDL was originally designed for sail but was subsequently fitted with an engine as motors generally displaced sails in response to the economic demands of the commercial fishing environment.

When her career as a fishing vessel ended in the mid 1970s, she was sold and converted by her new owners once again into a sailing vessel. The JDL was then taken to Colchester where her owners spent eight years stripping her down to the bare hull and rebuilding her as a Brigantine with accommodation for 4 crew and 12 guests in 7 well appointed cabins. 

Today JDL is once again registered as a Sail Training Ship members of Sail Training International and all cruises advertised in the schedule section adhere to the strict rules defined by the MCA.
Sail training vessel means a sailing vessel which, at the time, is being used either: 
  1. to provide instruction in the principles of responsibility, resourcefulness, loyalty and team endeavour and to advance education in the art of seamanship; or 
  2. to provide instruction in navigation and seamanship for yachtsmen;

JDL is built to reflect the original lines of a traditional sailing vessel and fitted as a Brigantine she is sleek, quick and manoeuvrable. Brigantines were the preferred type of a ship for all Pirates for their speed and quick escape.


What We Do

Jean de la Lune works closely with the Sail Training Charity to help take families and young people to sea. We have designed a school programme taking young people of all ages to sea. Check our dedicated web page www.schoolatsea.co.uk

Sail Training is a great fun outdoor adventure activity for people of all ages and abilities. Not only teaching about traditional seamanship, keeping the skills of our maritime heritage alive, but through the learning of these skills and the experience of being at sea, Sail Training helps people learn about themselves, discover hidden strengths and talents and understand the value of working as a team. By confronting the demanding challenges, both physical and emotional, Sail Training inspires self-confidence and personal responsibility whilst promoting an acceptance of others, whatever their social or cultural backgrounds. 

The Sail Training Charity aims to reach out to communities to increase the awareness of Sail Training and the multitude of benefits it brings and to provide access for families and young people to participate in Sail Training through the provision of free or subsidised berths on board Sail Training Vessels such as Jean de la Lune. 

In order to achieve these aims, the Sail Training Charity relies solely on the generosity of their supporters. If you would like to help us in our aim of taking young people to sea you can make a donation of any amount easily and securely. The Sail Training Charity is register with the Small Charities Coalition.


What We Need & What You Get

The current owners EIP Sailing are committed to ensuring that the vessel continues to be maintained to the highest standard. She was moved from her berth in Leith, Edinburgh, and sailed to Poland where she underwent a comprehensive refurbishment and restoration whilst ensuring that all of the improvements remained true to the spirit of traditional wooden sailing vessel. 

Whilst the majority of work has been already done there is still plenty left for this year. We are collecting our funds for a major replacement of our two masts. This has to take place soon although a date still has not been set. It will involve taking off all sails, yards, ropes and days and days of hard work. We are constantly on the lookout for people who can help with the ongoing wood, metal and brass renovation. Estimated budget for this work you can find below:

  • Masts and rigging replacement   ~ £65,000
  • Further cabins renovation  ~£20,000
  • Bathrooms renovation  ~£10,000
  • Galley renovation  ~£20,000
  • Additional navigation equipment for training purpose ~£10,000
  • Additional safety systems (e.g. automated bilge pumps)  ~£25,000
If you think you can help in return for sailing - get in touch or buy our Perks and gadgets. There is place for everyone. 


What we have already done

JDL has had a complete overhaul in 2014, from treating the wooden hull through to the new light-weight sails. Internally, JDL has been designed to feel cosy and comfortable whilst maintaining the wood panelling but with new upholstery in warm colours reflecting the feel of a traditional wooden ship.

Today there is spacious and comfortable accommodation for 25 persons on board in 11 cabins: 1 single, 7 double, 2 triple and one for four persons. 


Risks & Challenges

The only risk and the greatest challenge at the same time is you might fall in love with her - and you will want to come back. And often!

JDL is built to reflect the original lines of a traditional sailing vessel and fitted as a Brigantine she is sleek, quick and manoeuvrable. Brigantines were the preferred type of a ship for all Pirates for their speed and quick escape.
  


What We Do

Jean de la Lune works closely with the Sail Training Charity to help take families and young people to sea. We have designed a school programme taking young people of all ages to sea. Check our dedicated web page www.schoolatsea.co.uk
Sail Training is a great fun outdoor adventure activity for people of all ages and abilities. Not only teaching about traditional seamanship, keeping the skills of our maritime heritage alive, but through the learning of these skills and the experience of being at sea, Sail Training helps people learn about themselves, discover hidden strengths and talents and understand the value of working as a team. By confronting the demanding challenges, both physical and emotional, Sail Training inspires self-confidence and personal responsibility whilst promoting an acceptance of others, whatever their social or cultural backgrounds. The Sail Training Charity aims to reach out to communities to increase the awareness of Sail Training and the multitude of benefits it brings and to provide access for families and young people to participate in Sail Training through the provision of free or subsidised berths on board Sail Training Vessels such as Jean de la Lune. 

In order to achieve these aims, the Sail Training Charity relies solely on the generosity of their supporters. If you would like to help us in our aim of taking young people to sea you can make a donation of any amount easily and securely. The Sail Training Charity is register with the Small Charities Coalition.


What We Need & What You Get The current owners EIP Sailing are committed to ensuring that the vessel continues to be maintained to the highest standard. She was moved from her berth in Leith, Edinburgh, and sailed to Poland where she underwent a comprehensive refurbishment and restoration whilst ensuring that all of the improvements remained true to the spirit of traditional wooden sailing vessel. 

Whilst the majority of work has been already done there is still plenty left for this year. We are collecting our funds for a major replacement of our two masts. This has to take place soon although a date still has not been set. It will involve taking off all sails, yards, ropes and days and days of hard work. We are constantly on the lookout for people who can help with the ongoing wood, metal and brass renovation. Estimated budget for this work you can find below:


Masts and rigging replacement   ~ £65,000

Further cabins renovation  ~£20,000

Bathrooms renovation  ~£10,000
Galley renovation  ~£20,000
Additional navigation equipment for training purpose ~£10,000
Additional safety systems (e.g. automated bilge pumps)  ~£25,000
If you think you can help in return for sailing - get in touch or buy our Perks and gadgets. There is place for everyone. 
    
What we have already done 
JDL has had a complete overhaul in 2014, from treating the wooden hull through to the new light-weight sails. Internally, JDL has been designed to feel cosy and comfortable whilst maintaining the wood panelling but with new upholstery in warm colours reflecting the feel of a traditional wooden ship.

Today there is spacious and comfortable accommodation for 25 persons on board in 11 cabins: 1 single, 7 double, 2 triple and one for four persons. 
  
Risks & Challenges The only risk and the greatest challenge at the same time is you might fall in love with her - and you will want to come back. And often!

story:
Kia Ora my name is Anna Evans. I'm from Gisborne New Zealand. Also known as the first city to see the sun.

I am an Intuitive Energy Healer and from a very young age I could remove pain and help people heal. This is my gift and in many ways it is also very challenging. 

Energy Healing is my Passion and Life. Its what I live for and what I am here to do while here on earth. I now live in Queensland, Australia. 

The opportunities in life are amazing. One of which most recently I was offered to go to Amsterdam to further my learning. How could I not go! This is an opportunity that will enhance my abilities and, I'll be able to be of help to more people. I wish to up level myself to be of service to others. By being the best possible ME, I can possibly be. This in turn helps you to be the best possible person you can be. 

Wow what an opportunity. I am ready for this, And to find the funds of $25k USD in a very short time well, let's just say I'm open to what the Universe decides. 

I've taken a big leap of faith and I'll be leaving Australia on the 15th September 2015. With Love and Gratitude - I thank you, Anna Evans
