story:
[Update 9/18: Thanks to all who contributed so generously to this effort! This campaign has closed, but you can still donate to our projects here. Onward!]



 "Do you understand that climate change threatens to cause the collapse of civilization? Do you have the strength of character to protect the American people from catastrophe? Will you Pledge to lead a World War II-scale mobilization to fight climate change?"

This is what presidential candidates need to be asked. Not whether they believe in climate science! The climate system, our common home, is in acute crisis. This situation demands an all-out, emergency response.

Without a World War II-style Climate Mobilization, human civilization will most certainly collapse this century amidst catastrophic sea level rise, global food and water shortages, and a mass extinction of life on earth. This election season, we must make clear that the presidential candidate who “believes” in climate change yet offers a weak policy response that will not actually solve the problem is hardly better than the climate change denier. 

We can no longer accept the politically fashionable "carbon gradualism" that continually kicks the can down the road. Instead, we must demand the response that so many leading environmental analysts and scientists tell us will actually save civilization from climate change — a World War II-scale mobilization! 

America needs heroic political leadership to steer us through the gathering storm of climate change. We need a President who levels with the American people about the gravity of the climate emergency — a President with the courage and competence to mobilize our economy and society in order to eliminate our nation’s net greenhouse gas emissions at wartime speed.

The Climate Mobilization, a growing movement that started last fall, demands that political candidates both publicly recognize that climate change threatens the destruction of civilization and publicly commit to a World War II-scale Climate Mobilization in response. After 10 months of intense movement-building, we are raring to intervene in the Iowa Caucuses and confront presidential candidates with this critical challenge. With your help, we can deploy veteran organizers on the ground in Iowa on that very mission!



Every day, many of the 20 announced candidates for President of the United States are campaigning in Iowa. The national media follows their activities, as well as the political preferences of Iowans, quite closely. (See a recent article on Hillary Clinton getting heckled about climate in New Hampshire, for an example!) 

With your help, we will develop a core of Iowa Mobilizers who will organize their communities and put direct pressure on political candidates to sign the Pledge to Mobilize, catapulting the idea of a WWII-scale, emergency Climate Mobilization into the presidential campaign, the national media, and the mainstream of American politics.The Pledge, a breakthrough organizing strategy, calls for a WWII-scale, full-employment mobilization to eliminate America’s net greenhouse gas emissions by 2025. The Pledge also calls on the U.S. to lead an international effort to restore a safe climate. Citizens who sign the Pledge commit to support candidates who have signed the Pledge with their vote, time, and money, and to spread the Pledge to others.

Ed Fallon, a veteran Iowa lawmaker, radio show host, and climate activist, is ready to enlist in the Climate Mobilization and lead the campaign to mobilize the Iowa Caucuses. He is ready to Mobilize Iowa using the Pledge to Mobilize. But he can’t do it without your help. 

With your support, we can have Ed mobilizing Iowa in a matter of days. 
To understand what Ed will be doing on the ground in Iowa, you should understand how The Climate Mobilization – and our primary tool, the Pledge to Mobilize – works.

The Iowa caucuses are only seven months away. This may not seem like much time — but the Pledge to Mobilize is a strategy built for rapid growth.

The Pledge is a public acknowledgment that the climate crisis threatens the collapse of civilization, as well as a call for the United States to initiate a WWII-scale mobilization to eliminate our national net greenhouse gas emissions by 2025 and enlist in an international effort to restore a safe global climate (Please see The Case for Climate Mobilization for a detailed scientific and economic explanation of these demands). The Pledge also contains a set of political and personal commitments to build the social mobilization required to achieve these demands. 

Join us! Please consider signing the Pledge to Mobilize yourself!

In the ten months since we launched The Climate Mobilization, the Pledge to Mobilize has been signed by more than 1800 Americans and international allies, including Ralph Nader, Winona LaDuke, Citizens' Climate Lobby founder Marshall Saunders, Rainforest Action Network founder Randy Hayes, Former Greenpeace International executive director Paul Gilding, internationally recognized ecological economist Richard Heinberg, former congressman Jim Bates, Florida congressional candidate Alina Valdes, and San Francisco mayoral candidate Amy Farah Weiss (Watch Amy take the Pledge in a public ceremony outside City Hall!).

   

We have assembled a Mobilization Advisory Board of top minds across a range of disciplines, including Gilding, Heinberg, and the world-class climatologist Michael E. Mann. We were also recently endorsed by leading climate activists Reverend Lennox Yearwood Jr. and Tom Weis.

Join us! Check out exciting volunteer opportunities within TCM! 

We have also started holding public events! On June 14th, we held the first ever National Climate Mobilization Day, with 15 events across the country, as well as in Paris and Playa del Carmen, Mexico, all demanding all demanding urgent, WWII-scale Climate Mobilization. These events ranged from the simple —spreading the Pledge in a farmers market or a church coffee hour —to the elaborate: Rallies were held in Santa Cruz, Washington D.C., and San Diego, where former congressman Jim Bates reenacted Paul Revere’s midnight ride in the streets of San Diego, warning that “climate change is coming - Mobilize!”  When the congressman arrived  in Balboa Park, more than 100 San Diegans greeted him for a midnight rally.

Ed Fallon is a former Iowa lawmaker, veteran organizer, talk radio host, and accomplished climate activist. Ed was an Iowa state legislator for 14 years from 1993 - 2006, and ran for Governor in 2006, receiving 26% of the vote in the Democratic Primary.

He has a broad and deep network in Iowa, especially among the climate-alarmed. Ed shares our dedication to the mobilization cause; he has been referring to the need for a WWII-scale Climate Mobilization for more than three years! He took the Pledge to Mobilize in May, at an anti-oil sands rally.

Ed is currently the host of The Fallon Forum, a radio show that reaches thousands of independent and commercial radio listeners every week and features Ed’s interviews with Iowa’s civic and religious leaders, presidential candidates, and others.

Ed is also a dedicated and highly experienced climate organizer. In 2013, he organized the Great March for Climate Action — an epic, 3,000-mile trek from Los Angeles to Washington, D.C. In March 2015, he walked 400 miles along the length of the proposed Bakken Oil Pipeline, rally opposition to the project and building relationships with hundreds of farmers he met on his journey. The Des Moines Register’s editorial board characterized him as a “smart fellow” with a “principled dedication to a cleaner environment.”

Over the years, Ed has accrued extensive political organizing experience, as well as a sizable online following that includes Iowans from all walks of life and across the political spectrum. Ed has an email list of 6,000 Iowans for the Fallon Forum, and the Fallon Forum site receives 14,000 visitors a month. From his climate activism work, he has built a national email list of 7,000.

Ed has offered to bring his dedication, expertise, and networks to bear to build a grassroots movement for The Climate Mobilization in Iowa, starting on August 1st.

For $5,000 a month, Ed and his colleague Shari Hrdina will introduce the Pledge to Mobilize to Iowa! They will build a powerful campaign, driven by Iowa voters, pressuring presidential candidates of all parties to sign the Pledge to Mobilize and commit to a WWII-scale Climate Mobilization that drives the American economy to zero net greenhouse gas emissions by 2025. 

Ed has had decades of experience using the Iowa Caucuses for advocacy, and has seen the strategy work very well — especially when it is done right. He notes:

“Some advocacy groups make the mistake of hiring non-Iowans, who then travel the state posing the questions themselves. After two or three appearances, candidates recognize that person, and everyone — candidate, general public, and the media - stop taking him or her seriously...The value of having the kind of network we come with is that each question will be asked by somebody who says, ‘Hi, I’m from here, and I’m going to the Iowa Caucuses on February 1st. I’m concerned about climate change, and I want to ask you a question.’ This type of grassroots, bottom-up engagement is what candidates and the media take seriously.”

Ed and Shari will recruit and train at least 50 Iowa Mobilizers who will:

  • Hold at least one meeting about TCM in their community
  • Bird-dog presidential candidates from all parties (with a goal of having volunteers ask pointed questions about the need for a Climate Mobilization at 3 candidate events every week) 
  • Bring a large-format version of the Pledge to Mobilize to candidate events and talk with attendees about the climate crisis and the Pledge
  • Recruit and publicize elected officials who agree to sign the Pledge.
  • Recruit and publicize community leaders who sign the Pledge in academia, business, religion and other prominent professions.
  • Recruit 1,000 Iowans in the Climate Mobilization. 
  • Ed will also promote the Climate Mobilization and the Pledge to Mobilize on his weekly talk show. See Ed and Shari’s 5-page proposal for more specific details explaining how they will mobilize Iowa.
The Climate Mobilization's success in San Diego demonstrates the power of combining the Pledge with strong local organizing. Nancy and Derek Casady have leveraged their respect in the community and broad networks to spread the Pledge incredibly effectively.
In less than 6 months since taking the Pledge themselves, the Casadys have recruited Bishop George McKinney, Citizens' Climate Lobby founder Marshall Saunders, former congressman Jim Bates and Judge Robert Coates.
We are just getting started. Our strategy revolves around the 2016 elections, our country’s chance to elect a mobilized Congress and President who will lead us through the mobilization. Between now and then, we need to spread climate truth — the need for emergency mobilization — as broadly and effectively as we can. We need to create a collective awakening and quickly convert that into political power. With your help, Ed Fallon and Shari Hrdina will take the Climate Mobilization to a new level of prominence with a grassroots mobilization in Iowa this year!


The Climate Mobilization launched in September 2014, when we began spreading the Pledge to Mobilize at the People’s Climate March in New York City. We have grown tremendously since then—and all through the power of volunteer Mobilizers! Click here for more on the establishment and activities of The Climate Mobilization.


*If you prefer to mail donations instead of donating to this campaign online, you can send contributions to our mailing address:

The Climate Mobilization
PO Box 2083
New York, NY 10025


Thank you for reading!  

Join us: Take the Pledge to Mobilize NOW!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Aminat Odunbaku and I am the founder of DSR PR. I am a Houston native now living in Los Angeles, CA, to pursue my dreams in the arts and entertainment industry. I founded DSR PR in January 2015, as an expansion of DSR Fashion founded 2011, after planning multiple events and developing brands across the city.

DSR is starting an indie gogo campaign because she needs a home to be more creative. A space for artists of all sorts to express themselves, whether it be dance, yoga, photography, art and fashion shows etc. With the amount of connections DSR has created over the past few years, we feel as though having our own space to utilize for multiple events throughout the year would be beneficial and lucrative to all artists especially in a city like LA where creative spaces are always in demand.

DSR believes that art is a necessity in everyone's life. "Without art there is no light". To help keep artistic individuals alive you could kindly help contribute to DSR STUDIOS and see this space come to life.

What We Need & What You Get

In order for DSR to come alive we will need raise $10,000. This money will be going towards rent for the space (at least first 3 months). The equipment for our events (sound system, mics, photography and film equipment, lighting, and storage: fridge, tables, chairs etc.)

Not only will artists that are utilizing the space get to benefit, but those of you that contribute will get perks as well. You can choose either perk you feel will be beneficial.  Ranging from shout outs, paintings and even some hours that you could invest in for your work when the studio opens up as well.

If we don't happen to reach our goal, we will store the funds raised and continue to invest in equipment that we need until we're able to get the space.

    The Impact

    So far, DSR has managed to create a advantageous event called the "The Art and Fashion Pop Up Shop," where a group of 12 to 15 local artists and vendors come out and sell their merchandise to a live crowd. These events give an immense opportunity to vendors and guest, to build relationships which is the ultimate goal for any business.

    We have also planned show for entertainers such as comedians, singers and poets as well.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you're unable to contribute to this campaign at the time, sharing this link will help bring awareness to someone who notices that could be interested in investing.

      Thank you so much for your time, God Bless!

story:
Empresa social de red de tiendas de salazones formada por personas con minusvalía , especialmente diagnosticadas con enfermedad mental, como capital humano. Colectivo estigmatizado y discriminado que merece una segunda oportunidad.

Tiendas pequeñas, manejables, flexibles, bien ubicadas, bien en centro comercial o barrio centrico de los grandes nucleos de población. Apertura de lunes a Domingo de 10 a 22. Inicialmente tres personas por tienda. Amen de vitrinas refrigeradoras, mostradores, caja registradora, estanterias, decoración, alquiler y mercaderias.

La idea es abrir tiendas inicialmente por todo el litoral mediterraneo español, siendo no obstante el proyecto exportable a otros paises con alto consumo de salazones.

Siendo el salazón de pescado el producto diferenciador se abarcaran tambien otros salazones para ampliar la gama y diferenciarse por amplitud de oferta.

El objetivo es abrir muchas tiendas y asi generar un gran numero de puestos de trabajo para personas de estos colectivos.

Solo los perdedores pueden ganar en este juego. Los perdedores en el juego de la vida que serian las personas diagnosticadas con enfermedad mental tendrian una segunda oprtunidad en un entorno favorable para poder ganar finalmente.

Al ser un proyecto de caracter social se solicita donacion pura y dura sin contraprestaciones, esperamos que lo entiendan.

Puedes soñarlo, puedes hacerlo.

Enterprise social network of salting stores formed by people with disabilities, especially diagnosed with mental illness, as human capital. stigmatized and discriminated group that deserves a second chance.
Shops small, manageable, flexible, well-located stores or in mall or central district of large population centers. Open Monday to Sunday from 10 to 22. Initially three people per store. Amen refrigerated shelves, counters, cash register, shelves, decoration, rental and merchandise.

The idea is initially open stores all over the Spanish Mediterranean coastline and exportable to other countries with high consumption of salted fish project nevertheless being.

As the fish salting the product differentiator also cover other cured meats to expand the range and breadth differentiated by supply.

The goal is to open many stores and thus generate a large number of jobs for people in these groups.

Only losers can win in this game. The losers in the game of life that would be people diagnosed with mental illness would have a second chance in a favorable environment to finally win.

Being a project of social character pure and without consideration donation is requested, we hope you understand.

You can dream it, you can do it.

story:
Statera (Latin) :
1. balance 2. grade, standard of quality

Statera Trading Co. is an online lifestyle shop specializing in city-to-city lifestyle goods rooted in style and substance. Our goal is to change the way people shop online by providing a source for customers to find the best in quality crafted, handmade, and artisanal goods, made in cities across the country, all in one place. One of the main ways we hope to accomplish this, is through our subscription box service called "seek."


seek

is an invitation to change the way people shop, experience, and value their everyday goods. Through an ongoing collection of lifestyle goods ranging from coffees and teas, to apparel and fashion accessories, we provide an outlet for conscious consumers to make a difference by supporting small businesses each month, experiencing their quality products, and learning about the stories behind them. 

We've partnered with some of the most recognized names in Chicago-made goods, and true cultivators of Chicago's local lifestyle experience, to put together one of the most consciously curated collections of lifestyle goods available to date. 

At our start, we're staying close to home with a definitive collection of makers and brands in Chicago, but have already began tapping into other cities with great lifestyle cultures like Brooklyn, Austin, and Seattle.

                                                            (Made in Chicago)

How it works:

Customers will have the option to subscribe in 1, 3, 6, and 12 month intervals. With their subscription, they'll receive a collection of 5-7 city-made lifestyle goods with a combined total value ranging from $80-$90 per collection, plus our exclusive experience vouchers for local subscribers, and coupon codes and discounts for anyone out of state. 

Examples of local experience vouchers are:

* Brew for Two at any Bow Truss location in Chicago. 

* Half-off skincare treatments at Scratch Goods in Chicago

Examples of our Out-of-State savings are:

* Save 20% on your purchase at ashlandleather.com with coupon code XXXX

* Save 25% at scratchgoods.com with coupon code XXXX


Our Chicago Partners:

Bow Truss Coffee Roasters
"our goal is to make specialty coffee more approachable, bringing fantastic single origins, naturals, and delicious direct trade to you through partnerships and collaborations around the world" 

Metric Coffee Roasters
"Metric Coffee is a Chicago, IL based Coffee Roaster that aims to provide Quality Coffee to the community it serves."

Scratch Goods
"Scratch Goods is a Chicago skincare salon and goods maker using conciously-sourced food-grade ingredients to provide the best in holistic self-care."

Town & Anchor
"Town & Anchor is a concept designed by a husband & wife team in Chicago, IL. Our skin & hair products are botanically inspired, naturally effective, & ethically driven. Everything is hand-poured, small-batch, made in USA & cruelty-free."  

Ashland Leather
"Ashland Leather Co. was created by two long-time tannery workers in Chicago, Dan Cordova and Phil Kalas. Both have worked in tanneries for a majority of their professional careers, and consequently they developed a great passion and love for leather."

Anastasia Chatzka
"Anastasia [Chatzka] is an American designer, creating a heritage level Collection one year at a time. Anastasia has two eponymous boutiques in Chicago. Her Atelier is located in Ukrainian Village and her newest location is in Hyde Park."

Alfred * Lane 
"Alfred Lane combines creative talent, technical expertise and an undying passion for quality in order to create this unique line of men’s solid colognes. Handcrafted in Chicago, Illinois and sourcing suppliers from the USA, we believe in the power and ingenuity of small business."

Chicago Candle Co. 
"At Chicago Candle Co. we only use up-cycled wine bottles and hand pouring soy wax featuring our unique wine, cocktail and drink flavored scents."

Baker Miller 
"Baker Miller is a whole grain bakery, restaurant and flour mill in Chicago. We serve breakfast, lunch, pastries, pies, grain bowls and bread."

Artumi Candle Studio
"Artumie Candle Studio is a small-batch candle company based in Chicago, IL. Our ambition is to rock your world through the sense of smell."

Why Indiegogo

With the help of Accion Chicago, "a nonprofit that helps communities grow by investing in people who build businesses and generate jobs in [Chicago]," and scrounging up whatever we could, we'd put together just enough to realize that creating something that could make a difference was possible. As our vision has grown from what people could typically expect from a subscription box, to us striving to share an experience through quality goods and the stories behind them, our financial needs have grown as well. 

Breakdown of Contributions

Generous contributions to this campaign will be applied to the following efforts in the following increments:

$1000 : Packaging Production: design, printing of boxes, packaging and printed materials essential to the experience inside

$4000 : Inventory Production: high quality, handmade goods take time. Time means that we need to order a good amount of our quantities in advance, and we'll need a good amount of funds to do so. 

$1000 ; Marketing: a strong consumer base is essential to our success. With a stronger ability to reach a greater number of people, we can continue to provide a great experience, and continue to grow alongside our partners.

$2000 : Website build and Design ; We want to provide a not only a well-designed online experience, but also a seamless and user-friendly shopping experience. With the right amount of support, we can do both!

Risks and Challenges

Beyond the usual risks and challenges that go into any new business, maintaining our subscription schedule and making sure our customers are happy with our products and service are priority one. Financial preparation and organization are two important factors in making sure we're able to do so. This campaign is a huge part of making sure we're able to accrue inventory as needed, which ties directly into our ability to schedule and fulfill our orders.

With years of service industry experience among the three of us, and a passion for shopping local, we know what it's like to be on the other end of the customer experience. In knowing what we look for in brands, services, and products, we'll know when we're not up to par, and where we'll need to improve to exceed our own standards and expectations.

Meeting a high demand based on supplies from smaller-scaled businesses is another hurdle we're anticipating. To take this on, we know we'll need to create limits according to what our suppliers' maximum quantities will be, and also source suppliers who have bigger production and shorter turn-around rates.

Wrapping up:

Since we started this mission back in April, we've been motivated and inspired by the passion, skill, and hard work that's gone into all of the businesses that we've chosen to work with. Their shops, and products make the impossible seem possible, and provide not only experiences within the city that helped make them, but give their customers something to remember them by with each visit. 

We believe this is how business should be, and believe it makes all the difference between supporting your most conveniently located Superstore (or online megastore), and supporting the places that give more to their brand or product because they want to give more to their customers. 

It's in support of these places and in support of our own dreams and motivations that we greatly appreciate your support to our campaign. 

Thank you all for visiting our campaign, and for any and all contributions!

Sincerely,

Chiko, Statera Trading Co.

story:
Our company name gives away the punch line, but let’s pretend you don’t see that huge logo while we take you through this fun little intro. 

Our Mission

We wish to provide the attendees of comic conventions a basic human right that millions of people around the world are denied every single day. This revolutionary endeavor will provide happiness, peace of mind, and energy to all that experience it. This innovation will be a breakthrough in the world of conventions, making the experience better and healthier for ALL attendees, not just those who experience our booth. What is this necessity? What could possibly give the convention a fresh outlook? We are here to pioneer the idea of adults sleeping during the daytime. That’s correct. Naps.

Our Vision

 The whole thing is going to be dripping with satire. Kindergarten nap-time for the Comic Con children-at-heart. 

Naps? That’s it?

In addition to this base concept we have been developing several other ideas, some occurring during conventions and some subsidiary projects to carry on throughout the year. 

While a nap booth would be our main focus at conventions, we also plan to provide a variety of other services. First, we know the struggle of waiting hours upon hours to see a panel and missing out on experiencing the rest of a convention. Naps wants to provide someone to do that for you! We plan to have eager line-holders at your service, so you can shop for a new light saber and still get a panel seat close enough to smell your favorite famous nerds. Don’t worry, your proxy will be a courteous and entertaining replacement with snacks and games for the other line-goers who weren’t clever enough to employ our services. 

An aspect that we are currently working tirelessly to develop is a raffle for exclusive and exciting VIP adventures. Besides helping the world be a little less cranky with an influx of adult napping, PowerNaps! aims to provide patrons with unique fan experiences. We hope to create opportunities for fans to interact with their favorite convention VIPs in ways that make photo-ops look like child’s play - by incorporating actual child’s play. From board games in pillow forts to full-on sleepovers, Naps! is working to bring you revolutionary fan experiences that your friends will never believe (until they see your Instagram posts)! We have chats and emails and meetings and other mumbo jumbo already in motion to make this possible, but your support will help us convince the VIPs that spending a few hours with a bunch of strangers doing strange things is actually a good idea. 

Outside of Conventions


Our first major (and most developed) PowerNaps! subsidiary is our podcast, PowerChats! This podcast would include interviews with VIPs in the format of a fun conversation. With this we hope to provide listeners with a unique insight into the lives of the VIPs, something they would not get from a typical interview. We will be looking to you on social media to help us come up with questions and share your stories with our VIPs. Think of it as a weekly, audio, comic-con panel - run by fans. 

There are several other projects that are still in the early stages of planning, so we are not quite ready to share them yet - but we promise not to disappoint! These projects are well worth the wait and the convention world has no idea what’s coming! 



Why do we need help? 

The road for a start-up is riddled with obstacles and PowerNaps! has been no exception. This business is a work in progress, but in a few short months and with some truly dedicated individuals we have made it here. We have created a strong team that refuses to give up, no matter what struggles we face, and a team that knows when to ask for help. Because of this we humbly come to you, internet, to ask for your support in our crazy endeavors. We built this company for you - in order to bring more happiness, fun, and sleep into your lives. Who wouldn’t want that? Plus, we’ve got some pretty sweet perks (because you know, who doesn’t love a great bribe?), check them out!

Early Bird Special!

First 50 contributors will receive 10 free nap vouchers !


Invading the Nerd World

No matter the outcome of this campaign, our team will retain its dedication and love to this project and we can guarantee that PowerNaps! is coming to a convention near you. See you soon, fellow nerds!


Our Team

 

Jimena Gereda AKA Jiminey Cricket
President

Jiminey Cricket is a native Texan with a slight obsession with her pug, Scout. She enjoys art and history and macarons of all colors. Jimena came up with the idea for Powernaps while the screams of nearby Howler Monkeys kept her from her precious sleep during a backpacking trip in Guatemala. True story. What began as a personal journey of slumber has translated into metaphorical interpretations of cannoli and crenelated battlements. Jimena has been known to spend hours in museum gift shops and will get cranky if you ask her to leave. She currently splits her time between The Pantheon and her kitchen.


Gil Arias AKA Sir Gilliam the Immortal Conqueror
Vice President

Sir Gilliam was born and raised in west Texas and no does not ride a horse - why does everyone always ask? He is a fan of tabletop gaming, Dungeons and Dragons, and tropes of all kinds. Gil joined PowerNaps! accidentally on purpose and has loved it ever since. He can be found rolling dice and cursing imaginary deities, for cursing said dice, just about any time. When he's not doing that  he will probably be standing right behind you. Please don't turn around. I swear I wasn't doing anything weird. I just... Oh god, this is awkward. look away!

 

Amber Harridge
Convention Coordinator
PowerChats! Host

Amber lives in Austin, where she has an unhealthy relationship with breakfast tacos and her basset hound, Wally. Speaking of Wally, Amber may or may not have "accidentally" turned her apartment (and her life) into a shrine for The Flash - specifically Wally West. She is an aspiring comedian and actress who excels at finding delicious beets, throwing beakers, and concocting intricate revenge plots against anyone who unearths her old MySpace photos. When she is not out working on her fitness (he's her witness. Wally, Wally is her witness. because she's a responsible dog owner that takes her precious dog out for frequent runs), you can find Amber doing what every other girl wishes they could do - perfectly executing Pinterest Projects. This skill, while completely forged out of independent woman strength and for the sake of herself and no man, will undoubtedly impress her future life partner, Chris Evans. She is also an incredibly proud Hufflepuff and will tear you to pieces if you dare bash her house. Just don't do it. 



Sergio Manriquez
Convention Coordinator

Sergio was born in Las Vegas and no, not New Mexico. He is in Texas for college studying the secret art of dance and yes, he must wear tights in ballet...no, they are not uncomfortable. He got started in high school learning to break dance before he decided to make it a career. He is currently ranked in the top 3% in the video game, Destiny.


Christina Gonzalez AKA Xtinadiva69
VIP Manager

Christina is the sassy cat lady of the team with a heart of gold. She is a Theatre Major at the University of Texas where she shines on stage. Christina moonlights as an Internationally-renowned cosplayer under her pseudonym, Christina Dark Cosplay! In her spare time you can find her acting out scenes from Jurassic World in the local mall parking lot (as a raptor, obviously) or drinking matcha tea.



Julian Maldonado
VIP Manager

Jules is an incredibly busy and talented performer, currently starring in the UTEP Dinner Theater's production of West Side Story. Being an incredible dancer, it is no surprise that he was also previously cast as the main character in Footloose, but more importantly - he does an impeccable Emperor Kuzco impression. When he's not dancing or acting, you can find Jules either at home playing Destiny or eating his way through a Panda Express.  



Tori Egbert 
AKA TortsMagorts AKA Tornado AKA Tortle Cheesecake AKA Torpedo
Project Development Director
PowerChats! Host

When Austinite, Tori, isn’t coming up with oodles and oodles of superfluous fancy words for PowerNaps! business shenanigans and subsidiary endeavors, you can find her in a kitchen covered in flour. After leaving pharmacy school and finding happiness in the culinary arts, Tori baked and piped her way through jobs before landing at the perfect bakery and stumbling upon the wonderful magnificence that is PowerNaps! With her two greatest passions (food and comics) being her actual real-life adult jobs, you’ll often find Tori working with a huge smile on her face and her heart filled to the brim (or Netflix binge-watching pretty much everything and anything). She is also a ready-minded Ravenclaw and a nickname collector. Try to come up with one she hasn't heard of, we dare you. 



Daniel Rios
Booth Manager

Daniel Rios hails from the small, west Texas town of El Paso where he has been involved in a cornucopia of odd jobs from Stage Management for theatre to running a competitive fencing club, and ultimately finding a home in PowerNaps. He enjoys filling his schedule with just about anything that makes him smile and dislikes silence, idle hands, and sleep (gasp! he dislikes sleep? who's in charge of hiring for this company!? this seems like something that would be screened on day one. tsk tsk. it's too late now...)  ; being only a man, however, these are things he must cope with on a day-to-day basis. Most days. Besides work, some of the things that take up his time include writing, medieval reenactment, and finding new, exciting way to combat the evils of sleep.



Elisa Carrillo
Assembly Manager

Elisa is a certified geek and nerd. In her spare time she enjoys walks with her dogs, working out with her friends, wine, and long walks on the beach. Too bad she lives in the desert. She will be graduating this December with a degree in Mechanical Engineering and hopes to pursue a Master's in Biomedical Engineering shortly. She is a passionate Wholigan and a steadfast Gryffindor.



Kyle Vincent
Assistant Assembly Manager

Kyle is a homegrown Kentuckian, working as an assistant assembly manager for Powernaps!, helping with his knowledge of hardware and carpentry. He's currently studying to be a music educator to spread his love of music to the next generation. When he's not slappin-da-bass or playing trombone, you can find him riding across town on his motorcycle, fighting bears, or grooming his beard.



Raul Chavez
Assistant Manager

Raul is a theater performance major at the University of Texas. He loves doing all stage performance, but has a special place in his heart for Shakespeare. This proud potter head is an avid movie goer and loves drinking “girly” cocktails with absolutely no shame. His highly competitive soul also loves scary movies and puppies. When he laughs really hard, you can't stop him from snorting. (We've heard it's really cute and hilarious.) In addition to sharing her height, Raul is basically Shakira - a little sassy fire cracker, so don't let his size fool you. 


Samantha Fiducci
Web & Graphic Design Artist

Sam is the main graphic designer for naps. She's sort of qualified in that way because she's getting a BFA in December of 2015 with a concentration in graphic design. If you ask her to describe her perfect date, she would say April 25th because it's not too hot and it's not too cold. Currently she resides in southern Kentucky, though she hopes to stay in no place for too long. You can often find Sam crying at her university's computer lab (with no shame) or looking up pictures of baby [insert any animal here].



Rachel Sacco
Creative Director

Rachel lives in sunny Florida and spends her free time reading her favorite books to manatees and alligators. She is passionate about afternoon naps and English crumpets. She is a die-hard Slytherin.

We hope to create opportunities for fans to interact with their favorite convention VIPs in ways that make photo-ops look like child’s play - by incorporating actual child’s play. From board games in pillow forts to full-on sleepovers, Naps! is working to bring you revolutionary fan experiences that your friends will never believe (until they see your Instagram posts)! We have chats and emails and meetings and other mumbo jumbo already in motion to make this possible, but your support will help us convince the VIPs that spending a few hours with a bunch of strangers doing strange things is actually a good idea. 

Outside of Conventions

Our first major (and most developed) PowerNaps! subsidiary is our podcast, PowerChats! This podcast would include interviews with VIPs in the format of a fun conversation. With this we hope to provide listeners with a unique insight into the lives of the VIPs, something they would not get from a typical interview. We will be looking to you on social media to help us come up with questions and share your stories with our VIPs. Think of it as a weekly, audio, comic-con panel - run by fans. 

There are several other projects that are still in the early stages of planning, so we are not quite ready to share them yet - but we promise not to disappoint! These projects are well worth the wait and the convention world has no idea what’s coming! 

Why do we need help? 
The road for a start-up is riddled with obstacles and PowerNaps! has been no exception. This business is a work in progress, but in a few short months and with some truly dedicated individuals we have made it here. We have created a strong team that refuses to give up, no matter what struggles we face, and a team that knows when to ask for help. Because of this we humbly come to you, internet, to ask for your support in our crazy endeavors. We built this company for you - in order to bring more happiness, fun, and sleep into your lives. Who wouldn’t want that? Plus, we’ve got some pretty sweet perks (because you know, who doesn’t love a great bribe?), check them out!Early Bird Special!First 50 contributors will receive 10 free nap vouchers !
Invading the Nerd World
No matter the outcome of this campaign, our team will retain its dedication and love to this project and we can guarantee that PowerNaps! is coming to a convention near you. See you soon, fellow nerds!Our Team
 
Jimena Gereda AKA Jiminey CricketPresident
Jiminey Cricket is a native Texan with a slight obsession with her pug, Scout. She enjoys art and history and macarons of all colors. Jimena came up with the idea for Powernaps while the screams of nearby Howler Monkeys kept her from her precious sleep during a backpacking trip in Guatemala. True story. What began as a personal journey of slumber has translated into metaphorical interpretations of cannoli and crenelated battlements. Jimena has been known to spend hours in museum gift shops and will get cranky if you ask her to leave. She currently splits her time between The Pantheon and her kitchen.Gil Arias AKA Sir Gilliam the Immortal ConquerorVice President
Sir Gilliam was born and raised in west Texas and no does not ride a horse - why does everyone always ask? He is a fan of tabletop gaming, Dungeons and Dragons, and tropes of all kinds. Gil joined PowerNaps! accidentally on purpose and has loved it ever since. He can be found rolling dice and cursing imaginary deities, for cursing said dice, just about any time. When he's not doing that  he will probably be standing right behind you. Please don't turn around. I swear I wasn't doing anything weird. I just... Oh god, this is awkward. look away! 
Amber HarridgeConvention CoordinatorPowerChats! HostAmber lives in Austin, where she has an unhealthy relationship with breakfast tacos and her basset hound, Wally. Speaking of Wally, Amber may or may not have "accidentally" turned her apartment (and her life) into a shrine for The Flash - specifically Wally West. She is an aspiring comedian and actress who excels at finding delicious beets, throwing beakers, and concocting intricate revenge plots against anyone who unearths her old MySpace photos. When she is not out working on her fitness (he's her witness. Wally, Wally is her witness. because she's a responsible dog owner that takes her precious dog out for frequent runs), you can find Amber doing what every other girl wishes they could do - perfectly executing Pinterest Projects. This skill, while completely forged out of independent woman strength and for the sake of herself and no man, will undoubtedly impress her future life partner, Chris Evans. She is also an incredibly proud Hufflepuff and will tear you to pieces if you dare bash her house. Just don't do it. Sergio ManriquezConvention Coordinator

Sergio was born in Las Vegas and no, not New Mexico. He is in Texas for college studying the secret art of dance and yes, he must wear tights in ballet...no, they are not uncomfortable. He got started in high school learning to break dance before he decided to make it a career. He is currently ranked in the top 3% in the video game, Destiny.
Christina Gonzalez AKA Xtinadiva69VIP ManagerChristina is the sassy cat lady of the team with a heart of gold. She is a Theatre Major at the University of Texas where she shines on stage. Christina moonlights as an Internationally-renowned cosplayer under her pseudonym, Christina Dark Cosplay! In her spare time you can find her acting out scenes from Jurassic World in the local mall parking lot (as a raptor, obviously) or drinking matcha tea.Julian MaldonadoVIP ManagerJules is an incredibly busy and talented performer, currently starring in the UTEP Dinner Theater's production of West Side Story. Being an incredible dancer, it is no surprise that he was also previously cast as the main character in Footloose, but more importantly - he does an impeccable Emperor Kuzco impression. When he's not dancing or acting, you can find Jules either at home playing Destiny or eating his way through a Panda Express.  Tori Egbert AKA TortsMagorts AKA Tornado AKA Tortle Cheesecake AKA TorpedoProject Development DirectorPowerChats! HostWhen Austinite, Tori, isn’t coming up with oodles and oodles of superfluous fancy words for PowerNaps! business shenanigans and subsidiary endeavors, you can find her in a kitchen covered in flour. After leaving pharmacy school and finding happiness in the culinary arts, Tori baked and piped her way through jobs before landing at the perfect bakery and stumbling upon the wonderful magnificence that is PowerNaps! With her two greatest passions (food and comics) being her actual real-life adult jobs, you’ll often find Tori working with a huge smile on her face and her heart filled to the brim (or Netflix binge-watching pretty much everything and anything). She is also a ready-minded Ravenclaw and a nickname collector. Try to come up with one she hasn't heard of, we dare you. 
Daniel RiosBooth Manager
Daniel Rios hails from the small, west Texas town of El Paso where he has been involved in a cornucopia of odd jobs from Stage Management for theatre to running a competitive fencing club, and ultimately finding a home in PowerNaps. He enjoys filling his schedule with just about anything that makes him smile and dislikes silence, idle hands, and sleep (gasp! he dislikes sleep? who's in charge of hiring for this company!? this seems like something that would be screened on day one. tsk tsk. it's too late now...)  ; being only a man, however, these are things he must cope with on a day-to-day basis. Most days. Besides work, some of the things that take up his time include writing, medieval reenactment, and finding new, exciting way to combat the evils of sleep.


Elisa CarrilloAssembly Manager
Elisa is a certified geek and nerd. In her spare time she enjoys walks with her dogs, working out with her friends, wine, and long walks on the beach. Too bad she lives in the desert. She will be graduating this December with a degree in Mechanical Engineering and hopes to pursue a Master's in Biomedical Engineering shortly. She is a passionate Wholigan and a steadfast Gryffindor.


Kyle VincentAssistant Assembly Manager
Kyle is a homegrown Kentuckian, working as an assistant assembly manager for Powernaps!, helping with his knowledge of hardware and carpentry. He's currently studying to be a music educator to spread his love of music to the next generation. When he's not slappin-da-bass or playing trombone, you can find him riding across town on his motorcycle, fighting bears, or grooming his beard.


Raul ChavezAssistant Manager



Raul is a theater performance major at the University of Texas. He loves doing all stage performance, but has a special place in his heart for Shakespeare. This proud potter head is an avid movie goer and loves drinking “girly” cocktails with absolutely no shame. His highly competitive soul also loves scary movies and puppies. When he laughs really hard, you can't stop him from snorting. (We've heard it's really cute and hilarious.) In addition to sharing her height, Raul is basically Shakira - a little sassy fire cracker, so don't let his size fool you. 


Samantha FiducciWeb & Graphic Design Artist


Sam is the main graphic designer for naps. She's sort of qualified in that way because she's getting a BFA in December of 2015 with a concentration in graphic design. If you ask her to describe her perfect date, she would say April 25th because it's not too hot and it's not too cold. Currently she resides in southern Kentucky, though she hopes to stay in no place for too long. You can often find Sam crying at her university's computer lab (with no shame) or looking up pictures of baby [insert any animal here].



Rachel SaccoCreative Director
Rachel lives in sunny Florida and spends her free time reading her favorite books to manatees and alligators. She is passionate about afternoon naps and English crumpets. She is a die-hard Slytherin.

story:
Summary

Pastor Girton pitched a tent in the heart of one of Indianapolis’ most violent communities in our city. His street campaign resides at the corner of 30th Street and Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. Street for thirty days. The goal is three-fold:

  1. To raise awareness of the senseless violence that is impacting families (generations) throughout the city of Indianapolis;
  2. To encourage unity. Pastor G invites city, faith and business leaders, along with survivors and victims of violent crimes to meet in the tent and bring ideas to unite to face the root causes of violence and to show a force of unity by saying #EnoughIsEnough and that it’s time to Unite For Change;
  3. To initiate a proposal to construct an epicenter of empowerment and education in the northwest community intended to coordinate programming throughout challenged Indianapolis communities where violence and hopelessness is common. (Goal: $500,000)

What We Need & What You Get

Our financial goal is aggressive, yet critical to the future of our north Indianapolis community. We're setting a goal of $500,000 to secure the property on the corner where the tent campaign is located. The church currently owns the property, however, an aging inner-city congregation and dwindling membership has made it nearly impossible to keep as a support for the future vision of their incoming pastor, Pastor G. The property is currently for sale and could fall into the hands of exactly what the community doesn't need such as a liquor store or check cashing establishment. Alternatively, Pastor G wishes to construct an Epicenter of Empowerment & Education that will benefit the future growth and viability of the entire community.

Depending on the level of giving, donors could receive:

  • Recognition on the Unite For Change Memorial Wall of Change
  • UniteForChange.org T-Shirt

The Impact

As of this writing, Indianapolis is on pace to match a record number of homicides in our city since 2008. Poverty in Indy has increased at a rate higher than the national average. Poverty among our children in low income homes is higher in impoverished communities in Indianapolis than in more affluent communities. We have an opportunity to turn this around by providing creative, community-based solutions such as:

  • Job skills resources and training
  • Parenting skills and education
  • GED and HSED Program assistance
  • Advocacy at the local and state level
  • Increased support to educational resources such as 21st Century Scholars

Other Ways You Can Help

#UniteForChange and help give #EnoughIsEnough as much visibility as possible. Pastor G is asking that you do at least one of the following:

  • Post UniteForChange.org messages, testimonies and ideas to end the violence in our community to our Facebook page: www.facebook.com/cmbc.org
  • Tweet about the UniteForChange.org unity campaign using #EnoughIsEnough #UniteForChange
  • Advocate for media coverage and send to any bloggers in your network
  • Use your social media accounts and off-line contacts and partner coalitions to organize unifying actions/messages, etc.
  • Call/fax/send letters to: UniteForChange, 1001 Eugene St., Indianapolis, IN 46208, 866-792-8187 fax

story:
Are you as pissed off as we are, that the GOP has strong-armed its way into the leadership of the Tea Party, only to turn it into just another Republican "Get out the Vote" program?  

The nation is circling the drain, and the Republican Party is playing politics as usual: checking, blocking, and shutting down the only group of people making any effort to try to save it.

While the Tea Party runs registration drives, and bus trips to the polls, We are organizing a grassroots effort to pass a series of Public Referendum to take our Nation Back!

The first Revolution BEGAN with the Tea Party, it did not end there, and neither will this one...

Our proposal is to create a Website to rekindle the Tea Party, back into what it was intended to be: a third Political Party in the United States, a Party to put the Democrat-Republican Party out of business, returning us to a Constitutional Government, and saving our economy and Nation.

I have extensive business experience as Owner and CEO of a multi-State Security Guard Company with over 100 employees, in Arizona, California, and Nevada: being able to retire by age 45.  Now that I'm retired, I wish to dedicate my "second career" to create, and run, a Nationwide Website: drawing those 200 million American Citizens, which turned out into the streets during the  early 2000's to protest the disgraceful conditions in our government, economy, and military strength.

The Website will be unique, in the respect that when a user logs in, they are connected with everyone else in their County.  This allows them to discuss local issues and city political candidates.  Nothing is more frustrating than trying to carry on an intelligent conversation, in a chat room, and someone from the other end of the country jumps in and starts shouting you down, on issues he never heard of, and has no business arguing...  This website solves this problem...  At the County Level, you are only talking to your friends and neighbors in your own county.  

This also creates the foundation of the political party - a ground up organization: where County groups set the rules and agenda for the State party, and the State parties set the rules and agenda for the National Party.  Unlike the Tea Party, after being taken over by the GOP: who haven't held a single vote for the leadership in over a decade of their existence.

This is also where we have another advantage.  This allows us to accept advertising from every Mom and Pop corner store and business in the county.  Because they have a closed community of friends and neighbors, it makes it advantageous to them to advertise on our website.  For $100.00 a month, we can give them a JPG file billboard, A one minute Audio file to play as a radio commercial, and a one minute video or slideshow to be shown as a Television Commercial.  Showing each of them thousands of time a month. And at $100.00 per month, who couldn't afford it.  Besides a small town newspaper, this will be the first and only advertising outlet in the country for small town businesses to advertise to their entire county, only to their county, and at a very reasonable price.

But, we don't stop there. We also have a switch which allows the user to jump up to a Statewide website, for their State only.  This gives them a private platform for their State's politics.  No one from other States will be found there, to argue nonsense which may not apply to your State.  Plus, it opens up a Statewide advertising platform for those multi location businesses, and franchises (like auto dealerships, etc...) to be able to advertise with us, as well.

And what would a political website be, if we did not include a switch to allow the user to jump up to a National website, allowing them to talk about national and international politics with the entire nation.  Which also gives us a National advertising platform for products and national franchises (like fast food restaurants, etc)...

So once the website is up and on line, and we have thousands of people coming to use the site, we will have multiple streams of income to expand and run the website for decades into the future.  If the site goes viral, which we fully expect - based on Tea Party Protesters involvement a few years ago, we will have way too much funding for the Website alone, and we will donate the extra money to the New Political Party. 

The New Party will use all revenues, donations, and annual membership fees raised to build brick and mortar meeting halls, like the American Legion, in every county in the country.  Creating the infrastructure for the New Political Party: The New Liberty Party.  A Conservative Right wing Constitutional Party. 

All three of these platforms allow the users to upload Audio, Video, and text Blogs, to be posted to everyone in their county.  We nicknamed the project: "The Political YouTube Channel."  Everyone in their county may vote: like, or dislike, on these postings.  The very best (most liked) posts will rise up to the State level, where everyone in the State may vote on them.  The best ideas from each State will rise to the National level - where they are voted on again by everyone in the Nation.  This is designed to filter out bad ideas, and float the very best political solutions to the top of the National discussions.  Then the State and National Parties may organize solutions to our problems, based on these great ideas.

The site will also have live (text based) chat rooms in all three areas of the site.

In addition, the website will allow the users to setup their own conference calls, goto meetings, and voice chat rooms.  They can even use these chat rooms to host their own radio political talk shows, with the audience listening in by joining the room. 

And finally, we include an Online Internet Clock Radio, which will allow users to set the web address of any online radio station, and then tell the program on what days and at which times they wish this address to be listened to.  This will allow you to save hundreds of schedules, and change the radio station automatically based on your own priorities. You never have to miss your favorite talk show, or program, ever again. 

The Political Platform which the party stands for, has been posted on our Youtube page: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCM99f9Mz0tfK8fdrfXnVSOw .  If, for whatever reason, the hyperlink does not work properly, you can find us by searching for SICH (pronounced zeke).  We feel you should fully understand and agree with what we want to do - if you are going to support our project.

We have laid out and designed how we want the site to be organized and presented, laying it out in 23 phases, to be introduced in versions, and we found a local company (after interviewing six website design companies),  this designer has lots of experience in designing and creating online database websites. The web Designers want $30,000.00 for all 23 phases we have drawn out for them, plus another $15,000.00 for maintenance and support of the Website over the next decade, and for the rental of the Website's URL addresses: which we will prepay a credit card account, and auto pay the designer company monthly.

We will use the remaining $5,000.00 we are asking for in this request, to pay the fund raising fees and expenses on this Crowd Funding Site, to hire a lawyer to file a NonProfit 501C4 political action committee corporation application, and to prime the pump by mailing tens of thousands of postcards to dozens of counties across the country - one State at a time...  

As new members sign up and make donations, and pay their party dues, the money will come in to send out more postcards to every household in the next county on the list...  And so on...  Eventually, every address in America will receive a postcard, introducing the concept, Web Address, and invitation to every American. This is ultimately a Multi-million dollar venture, which will be paid for by the Website's various income streams.

story:
What is this?

We've had several people ask us for ways that they can support our business. We are humbled to have phenomenal clients that are aware of the frailty of the local small business.

Large corporations have millions and billions of dollars in assets and the ability to hire lobbyists to convince the government to bail them out.

But small businesses operate on very small margins and can be gone in an instant.

I have hesitated to start a campaign as I don't wish to ask for handouts from people who are also struggling with job loss, quarantine, and other difficulties during this crazy time.

Are you asking for a handout?

Absolutely not. We are responding our customers that have asked for an additional way to show their support.

At this time we are still open for to-go and are offering curbside delivery when you place your order through our branded app (http://tapgo.to/kaY2XS) or the Cloosiv app (http://onelink.to/cloosiv).

You can order bags of coffee online at https://ninjawarrior.coffee and, as it has been for 3 years, you can get delivery here in Easley.

This campaign is a way that you can overpay for those same things... :-)

How this helps

As any small business, we have overhead and responsibilities. We desire to provide a quality product with great customer service for a fair price.

This campaign is for people who wish to show their support in helping us meet those needs by paying a price that is higher than normal to help us offset our overhead.

Risks & Challenges

If you wish to participate, know that we are eternally grateful!

If you are also experiencing difficulties during this time - don't participate! Know that we are here to encourage you and be your friend. You can do this!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Follow us on social media
  • Share/Like our posts
  • Tell your friends about us
  • Send us prayers/good vibes/funny dog videos

Are you asking for a handout?
Absolutely not. We are responding our customers that have asked for an additional way to show their support.
At this time we are still open for to-go and are offering curbside delivery when you place your order through our branded app (http://tapgo.to/kaY2XS) or the Cloosiv app (http://onelink.to/cloosiv).
You can order bags of coffee online at https://ninjawarrior.coffee and, as it has been for 3 years, you can get delivery here in Easley.
This campaign is a way that you can overpay for those same things... :-)

How this helps
As any small business, we have overhead and responsibilities. We desire to provide a quality product with great customer service for a fair price.
This campaign is for people who wish to show their support in helping us meet those needs by paying a price that is higher than normal to help us offset our overhead.

Risks & Challenges
If you wish to participate, know that we are eternally grateful!
If you are also experiencing difficulties during this time - don't participate! Know that we are here to encourage you and be your friend. You can do this!

Other Ways You Can Help

Follow us on social media
Share/Like our posts
Tell your friends about us
Send us prayers/good vibes/funny dog videos

story:
Short Summary

We’re traditional. We’re trying to go back to the basics to bring the real spirit of Christmas all year round. We want future generations to be able to grow up knowing that magical feeling of a toy train driving around its tracks underneath a 7-foot evergreen. We want our store (both online and local) to be able to reconnect with community. Community is our main focus.

We want our customers to know that we care about them and we are so thankful that they took the time out of their day to experience what we have worked so hard to create for them. We’ll get to know each and every one of our local customers at our small coffee shop where the community can reconnect with each other and grow old together just as community should be.

Whether you’re browsing through our multitude of unique and timeless products, or you’re sipping a nice hot cup of coffee, we want to be able to give you that magical feeling of Christmas as soon as you pull up into our lot. 

 

Background

We already have the means to continue our online sales BUT we have huge dreams.

Prince Edward Island is one of the most beautiful places in the entire world, not just because of its breathtaking scenery, but also because of its people. The communities on our little island are some of the most, old fashioned, down to earth, caring bunch you’ll ever meet. We would be silly to not try to physically implement that dream and desire into our small town. 


Our names are Abbey and Kerri Thomson (The mother daughter duo) and for years we’ve dreamed about opening our very own Christmas Store. Specifically, we’ve always dreamed for a traditional Christmas store on Prince Edward Island. We have been beyond blessed to have been relocated back to our home province where generations of family have lived before, now the only thing left to make the last part of our dream come true is the building. 


Kerri established the online “Star & Stable Christmas Store” back in 2017 while at the same time Abbey created her own business “The Freehand Artisan”. Both businesses produced handmade signs (Custom and general designs) as well as traditional Christmas décor. It wasn’t until a year or two later that we teamed up and started a layout for our first physical shop. We have the opportunity to build right in our own home!

What We Need & What You Get


The next step in accomplishing this dream is the finances which is why we’re asking for your help.  

We’re always keeping everything we do community centered which means that as a thank you for your support we’re doing many different giveaways to keep life exciting and also to show how much we appreciate you.

We also have our own YouTube channel where we’re going to post weekly vlogs and updates so we can make sure that you are all with us every step of the way. We’re also going to be filming for years to come to allow the ones who can’t necessarily be with us in person to feel like they’re a part of our community. Also stay up to date with our progress and our messages to you through our social media pages (Facebook and Instagram) where we will be posting regularly as well as doing interactive lives to answer any of your questions as well as get some ideas of what you’d like to see us bring into the store. 

 

Risks & Challenges

There's always excitement around launching new ideas. It's even more exciting to have people partner with you, but launching businesses and ideas is hard work and requires a lot of effort, interaction, permits, applications, construction, marketing and communication. That's why we need your help! We appreciate any help and support you can provide. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that not everyone can give financially. That's ok! You can support us simply by sharing our posts, encouraging others to give on social media and just participating in community. 

We appreciate you and thank you for taking an interest in the success of Star & Stable Christmas Store.

story:
Our Story

Like many great stories it starts with a dream, vision, and passion. Brando envisioned a place where friends could go grab a pizza, a beer, and hang out. Kris wanted a place he could call his own and showcase his cooking skills without limitations. With the help and support from their older brother and parents, the two brothers hope to bring Watsonville a pizzeria to be proud of. 

 

Born and raised in Watsonville, means it is important for us to contribute to our community. We believe the city is bursting at the seams with culture, life, and beauty. Watsonville is a unique place and we intend to keep it that way. As natives we felt compelled to give our community a little more life and fun with a place to eat and hang out in downtown Watsonville.

 

Slice Project has been the result of countless conversation with family and friends. We debated and discussed the types of places we would like to have in our city and why we wanted these places. We found ourselves traveling to other nearby cities far too often to find a place to eat and enjoy ourselves. These conversations motivated us to create Slice Project. A place where you could eat, drink, and build friendships. All while keeping it local.

 

We are more than excited to offer the community Slice Project, a NY-style pizzeria serving craft beer, desserts, and small bites. We will be located at 300 Main Street (Fox Theater). We hope to bring back old memories and create new ones with you.

 

Build a New Downtown Watsonville with Us!

A whole pizza is meant to be shared and we want to share a slice of that pie with you. This campaign is to give South County the opportunity to bring back a lively downtown Watsonville. For years I’ve heard stories of a downtown Watsonville bustling with people walking up and down the street. Downtown was a place to socialize and build community. Our goal with Slice Project is to bring that history back. And it is an opportunity for us give a little something back to you, for your support.

Check out our perks! Lot of great opportunities to contribute to our campaign and get something back.  

 

What We Need

A show of support and demand from the local community will help Slice Project transform downtown Watsonville and create a space for all to enjoy. Help us raise $25,000 to upgrade and revive our downtown pizzeria!

 

The funds raised will be used to:

  • Hire and pay an interior design service to help us convert our vision into reality.  
  • Upgrade interior and give the pizzeria front of house essential improvements. 
  • Upgrade our beer taps, handles, lines, etc. And add a few more! 
  • Purchase tables, chairs, plates, glassware, and all other decor.
  • Pay for equipment maintenance and upgrades (our equipment has not been used in a long time, we need to make sure it is all working great to give you the best pizza!)

If the goal is not met, we will still open Slice Project in 2019.

 

No Money, No Problem! Spread the Word!

We recognize that we live in one of the most expensive areas in the country and money must be spent wisely to keep food on the table. And you know what, we understand, we love you and value you. Help us by simply spreading the word around in anyway. Whether it's sharing this campaign or just telling others that Slice Project is opening up. Thank you!

 

Follow our Instagram (@sliceprojectpizza) to see frequent updates and our journey!

story:
Who am I?

 Food Without A Face began when I started the vegan transition 2 years ago.  I realised there was a definite lack of help for people who were looking to become plant based and so I started to develop an idea for an app that would give people directions to the nearest vegan friendly business no matter where they were in the world.

I've always loved food and I'm not a salad eating kind of person, so what really appeals to me are the foods that vegans would normally miss - scrambled "eggs", meat free bacon and burgers, chunky wraps and, most importantly, good coffee and cake!

With that in mind, having sampled a lot of what the area has to offer, I've noticed a distinct lack of vegan friendly businesses near where I live and along the coast of the North East of Scotland.

 

What makes your cafe so special?

Aside from being the only vegan cafe for miles, FWAF will have several special features:

Eco Friendly Practices: electricity will be supplied by renewable energy companies; food will be served in recycled packaging that is also compostable; we will push for an electric car charging point in the car park and discount will be available to those driving electric vehicles; recycled plastic coffee cups will be sold that will discourage the use of disposable cups; recycling bins will be available in store

Vegan Comfort Food:  yes, there will be healthy options.  But my goal is to encourage EVERYONE to eat here, not just vegans!  In order to attract omnivores and show them just how great our food can be, there will be all sorts of tasty stuff available - maybe even some Cullen Skink!

Dog Friendly:  as a crazy dog lady, I absolutely 100% will encourage you ALL to bring your dog friends after your walks.  There will be snacks and water waiting for them!

Bird Friendly Coffee: as a place that promotes kindness to all living creatures, it would be wrong to ignore the impact that coffee farming has on our feathered friends.  With that in mind, all of our coffee will aim to come from companies that are certified Bird Friendly - coffee is grown in the shade, meaning that the combination of foliage cover, tree height and animal diversity provides suitable migratory bird habitat while maintaining productive farms. Producers must be recertified every three years to ensure they continue to meet these requirements and can truly call themselves Bird Friendly.

Creative Space For Hire: whether you run a camera club, an art group or even just want to meet here before heading out with your running group, the space will be available for people to hire for a small charge.  

What will it be like?

The aim for this coffee shop is to be unlike anything else in the area.  The interior will be relaxing and warm with upcycled furniture, comfy seating and lots of cool artwork by local artists.

There will be shelves of vegan friendly products that you can purchase to take home and we will also be running community events every now and again.

story:
Short Summary

The Copper Spur is so much more than incredible music, entertainment, and food! The extent of the reach of the experiences we create for our guests is difficult to measure. It is made evident by their kind comments, laughter, tears of joy (literally), memories and stories shared, hugs and whispered thank yous as they reluctantly leave after an unforgettable experience.

This campaign is about realizing my dream that started in 2015.  Based on a business model that thrived in Colorado for 43 years, we are moving everything to the next level.

Years of pouring passion, blood, sweat, and tears into an incredible project + 1 person reneging on agreements = our need for funding to move this dream to life.

What We Need & What You Get

We have exciting and unique perks to share when you become part of our community. From free drinks to lifetime show tickets, private parties with the band, Sing Your Dream experiences and more. Please check out our Perks Page.

If we don't reach our entire goal, the funds received will be put toward securing our location as we ramp up again for another campaign and seek investors.

Start-Up Expenses

Buildings/real estate $20,000

Leasehold improvements -

Capital equipment 9,800

Location/administration expenses 43,050

Opening inventory 12,000

Advertising/promotional expenses 2,600

Other expenses 12,523

Contingency fund 2,000

Working capital 3,000

Total Startup Expenses $104,973

The Impact

Your contribution:

  • Affects the lives of thousands of people by bringing joy, culture, delight, education, and fun into their lives.
  • Impacts 4 generations of people as they share, learn and experience the value of Western heritage through art, music, food, activities, and story.  

Approaching Opportunity with Eyes Wide Open

We know that expansion to a year-round venue and starting over with a new name comes with unique challenges. Here's our plan for success.

Product/Service Summary

Our 4 distinct, core Products and Services provide 4 revenue streams.

  1. Breakfast-A fresh, quality product that appeals to the above listed demographic and incorporates a creative presentation that celebrates the wild west theme, while offering a modern twist on both healthy and indulgent choices. Breakfast will drive a 6 day a week morning business.
  2. Corporate Events- Spirit of the Wild, Wild West Team Development-These are private events that begin with breakfast and end with the western show and chuck wagon supper. The main offering is a high-tech simulation program which is focused on developing and analyzing specific qualities which can be applied to any business. The simulation is integrated with live “western skill” activities that are creative and fun, such as gun slinging tricks, lassoing, gold panning and an “escape box game”. Corporate Events will drive a segment of the Tuesday-Friday daytime business and will add numbers to the breakfast and dinner service, as well as bar revenue. Attendees will join the public in the evening for the chuck wagon dinner and show, which increases weekday attendance while we continue to build additional group business.
  3. Western Music, Comedy and ‘Chuck Wagon’ Dinner. A family-friendly event-like no other-with excellent quality performers and dining deliver an unforgettable experience. Includes special activities for kids, live historic performers during pre-show, including “camp-fire” stories, lassoing, gold panning, etc. The musicians also act as servers during dinner and mingle with guests to enhance the guest experience. The Dinner and Show will be marketed to all the above-listed market segments. Bar and Merchandise will create additional revenue opportunities.
  4. ‘Late Night’ Weekend Show -Following the chuck wagon dinner, the ‘show only’ features a revised western show which includes nationally known western music artists and includes a local musician "sit-in" option. The Show Only provides an option for those who don’t want dinner, want to experience a different show, guests who spontaneously stop in when in Lyons, etc. Appetizers and bar will provide additional revenue opportunities.

Business Strategies

  • Deliver an authentic Western dining, musical experience guests can’t get anywhere else. The quality, variety and creative presentation of food, music and overall guest experience are not being offered by any other Western Show and Chuck Wagon. Our musicians are the best at what they do. Our dedication is to deliver outstanding, unforgettable experiences that exceed guest expectations every time.
  • Promote and market to people of all generations with Spirit of the Wild, Wild West values.
  • Deliver Western style service excellence. Our motto “Cowboy Kindness and then some…” is a reflection of our passion, commitment, and joy in delivering “over the top” customer service that creates memories for our guests that surprise and delight them and are long remembered.
  • Be the market leader in product service and experience innovation. Our competitive edge is a result of our creativity, presentation, marketing, advertising, and delivery. We will stand out with sustainable value, something that we can maintain and develop over time - the experience of interacting with characters from history, musical performers doubling as servers and interacting with guests; the line of daily life blurring into the fantasy of experiencing the past. The competitive edge that puts us ahead of any competitors is the opportunity to live and interact in history. Stepping into our world will reveal discussion with people of the time and physically doing things with them - while enjoying a great meal and a show.
  • Leverage the brand. Our Mission, Values and Vision work together to drive our brand. The best marketing effort in our business is customer service, repeat business and word of mouth advertising. Our brand is reflected in everything we do, say, our social media presence, all marketing and every aspect of operations. Our staff is trained within the guidelines of our Mission, Values and Vision. The Spirit of the Wild West Corporate Training program is also extended to the training of our employees. We operate within the premise that every person counts, every action counts and all things work together to create the environment we desire

THE BRAND

  • Based on the classic, proven model chuck wagon suppers across the nation are built on, we provide an engaging, wholesome alternative for early evening, family entertainment.
  • An “authentic cowboy supper” will be expanded into an offering that includes a choice of steak or chicken along with the traditional beans, baked potato, cornbread/biscuit and dessert will be served from a genuine “chuck wagon” and served Dutch oven style. A comedy-filled western music show that engages guests of all generations from age 3-93 follows.
  • Builds on the western heritage that so richly describes Colorado. The Copper Spur offers live, engaging entertainment, that brings to life the old west and the cowboy’s way of life, including genuine “Western” music. 
  • Our house band The Wild West Wranglers are experienced Western musicians who are passionate about Western Music and Western Heritage. Our Guest Artists are well-known and world-class musicians who represent Western Music at its finest and have played with the greats in this genre!

 

Other Ways You Can Be Part of The Copper Spur Community

SHARE!

Please follow us on Facebook and share this campaign with your friends on Facebook using Indiegogo's share tools!

Thanks for your support!
