Stepping into our world will reveal discussion with people of the time and physically doing things with them - while enjoying a great meal and a show.

Leverage the brand. Our Mission, Values and Vision work together to drive our brand. The best marketing effort in our business is customer service, repeat business and word of mouth advertising. Our brand is reflected in everything we do, say, our social media presence, all marketing and every aspect of operations. Our staff is trained within the guidelines of our Mission, Values and Vision. The Spirit of the Wild West Corporate Training program is also extended to the training of our employees. We operate within the premise that every person counts, every action counts and all things work together to create the environment we desire

THE BRAND

Based on the classic, proven model chuck wagon suppers across the nation are built on, we provide an engaging, wholesome alternative for early evening, family entertainment.
An “authentic cowboy supper” will be expanded into an offering that includes a choice of steak or chicken along with the traditional beans, baked potato, cornbread/biscuit and dessert will be served from a genuine “chuck wagon” and served Dutch oven style. A comedy-filled western music show that engages guests of all generations from age 3-93 follows.
Builds on the western heritage that so richly describes Colorado. The Copper Spur offers live, engaging entertainment, that brings to life the old west and the cowboy’s way of life, including genuine “Western” music. 
Our house band The Wild West Wranglers are experienced Western musicians who are passionate about Western Music and Western Heritage. Our Guest Artists are well-known and world-class musicians who represent Western Music at its finest and have played with the greats in this genre!

 
Other Ways You Can Be Part of The Copper Spur Community
SHARE!
Please follow us on Facebook and share this campaign with your friends on Facebook using Indiegogo's share tools!
Thanks for your support!

story:
About Just Be Well Yoga

Founder of Just Be Well Yoga

For those of you who don't know me, I'm Amanda Quintanilla. I've done a lot of things in my life: hairstylist, gymnastics coach, retail manager, business consultant, and for the past 7 years, I've taught yoga. Opening a studio has been a long-time dream of mine. I feel so lucky to have reached the point where this dream is manifesting into reality. I can’t wait to share the studio and the benefits of adventure yoga with you all. Thank you for participating in the Just Be Well Yoga community.

“I love all of the folks at Just Be Well Yoga. Amanda the owner brings a playful attitude to her yoga practice. Her classes are full of dynamic movement and are complemented well by the other instructors' unique styles. All classes are accessible to all skill levels, even Acro Yoga! I have made so many great friends through Just Be Well Yoga. Can't recommend checking out this studio highly enough!! PS don't be scared to come solo to an Acro session - no partner required!” – Cait longtime student and Pharmacy Professor

Adventure Yoga Facility

Just Be Well Yoga is a full-service yoga studio with intimate class sizes for more individualized attention and private or semiprivate sessions. JBWYoga represents my ideals for a yoga studio: beautiful, hardwood floors, a well-lit space with natural light streaming in, 16’ high ceilings, climate control, and a wide variety of props.

And at the top of the prop list: aerial yoga hammocks! Aerial Yoga is used for a variety of purposes including releasing tension in the spine and deepening standing poses, twists, backbends, and restorative poses.

Just Be Well Yoga will provide daily classes covering alignment vinyasa, strength, mobility, vinyin, acro, and aerial; monthly, 2-3 hour, workshops on specific themes and topics; quarterly weekend workshops. During warmer months we will provide weekly SUP yoga classes, monthly full moon SUP meditations, annual SUP yoga teacher training and retreats.

What is Adventure Yoga?

Adventure Yoga is a mix of different yoga styles to deepen your asana practice by bringing it into different avenues. Taking yoga from the traditional vinyasa and hatha practice and adding various props like yoga wheels, aerial hammocks, paddle boards, and partners all give your practice a little more sense of adventure.

We have found a well rounded practice inspired by the traditional styles of alignment yoga and adding these props allows students to find more balance, strength, and playfulness in their practice.

Not only have we combined these modern yoga practices, but even more unconventional classes like black light flows and lunar meditations has helped our students find that childlike playfulness that is often missing in our adult lives.

What we need:

The costs of modifying a preexisting space into a functioning yoga studio can really add up. We can see the potential in the space, but there’s quite a bit that needs to be done.

In order to make Just Be Well Yoga the adventure environment we’re looking for, I need to add the following:

  1. FLOORING – Flooring will be installed in the studio, providing a solid, sturdy, beautiful foundation for our adventures.
  2. AERIAL YOGA –  Rigging supplies and hammocks themselves. All components of the Aerial Rigs are assembled for precision and safety. We will need to hire a structural engineer as well as a professional rigger to assist with initial installation.
  3. LIGHTING – We’re increasing the natural light by adding a clear ceiling roof panel. Dimmable lighting allows us to control the light as needed for different classes.
  4. WALLS – As an old warehouse building some insulation and drywall still needs to be hung in order to reduce any noise from our neighbors and outside as well as to help maintain a comfortable temperature in the studio space.
  5. PAINT – the interior of the space will need a clean coat of paint to make our studio as welcoming as possible. We are also looking to finish the stairs leading up to the studio space with a durable paint.
  6. PROPS AND RESOURCES – Props, props, and more props! On top of existing props we will add a full set of Yoga Wheels, a few sets of handstand canes, blocks, handstand wedges, and a set of wooden stall bars.

None of these aspects on their own is cheap, but taken together they become truly costly.  We want to provide the already existing Fort Worth yoga community with the best possible adventure yoga facility and are asking for your help to make this dream a reality.

Here's how you can help:

Choose your perk!

We're offering a wide variety of packages so you can try out the studio and see what Just Be Well Yoga can do for your health and wellness. Look over the perks and see which is right for you. 

Share!

If you’re a regular Just Be Well Yoga student, please share this campaign on social media to let other potential students know about this new yoga opportunity! Simply click on the links at the upper right corner (next to the video) to share on Facebook and other sites.

story:
What will the money be used for?
We are under contract for the former Parkside Seafood restaurant next to Columbian Park. We have successfully rezoned the adjacent residential lot, which will allow us to tear down the dilapidated house currently on that lot, and add onto the existing restaurant building to allow space for our brewing equipment. Your donations will help us gather the money we need to finalize the purchase of the property and help us add to the growing brewing community in the Greater Lafayette area.

New Perks!
But Heather and Jason, you say, I already got a t-shirt in your last campaign! Never fear, we have a whole new set of perks this time around! We have the sticker of many uses: now with corners! We also have a new branded high gravity snifter, and exclusive mission patch only available through this campaign, a new t-shirt design with our beer drinking spaceman on it, and a sweet zip up hoodie. On the experience side of things, the Commander Pack offers a private beer pairing dinner for 10 held in our brewery! Each contribution over $100 (retroactive for the previous campaign) will get their name on our Pioneer Plaque, which will be proudly displayed.


Sounds good, but tell me more about the brewery
Glad you asked. The brewery will utilize a 7bbl Blichmann Engineering Pro Series brew house, creating 5 year-round beers and seasonals. We will have a full range of vegetarian/vegan food cultivated from our travels and love of diverse food.  Jason's personal love of space travel and astrophysics led to the astronautical branding.

The Food
Why Vegetarian? Heather and Jason have been vegetarian for decades, and feel that abstaining from meat is the healthiest thing we can do for ourselves and for our planet. After losing several family members to heart disease, the importance of this has become even more clear. We want to feed our community food that is delicious, but is also good for them and our environment!

Sustainability
Our goal is to create a business that contributes more to the environment and community than it takes. The beginning of this for us is to run a business that produces as little waste as possible while creating quality beer and food. Jason is currently working with several Indianapolis breweries to establish a committee on sustainability that we hope will provide resources and guidance for sustainable practices to breweries and restaurants throughout Indiana including recycling programs, composting programs, and energy savings such as high efficiency lighting.

About Jason
Roughly ten years ago I got the bright idea to make my own beer. After some confused looks, I was gifted a homebrewer starter kit and started making some beer. Bad beer. Instead of being grumpy about the bad beer, I instead thought, “Why is it bad? How can I make it better”? This has led me on an intensive journey leading up to this point. Escape Velocity Brewing Company is the culmination of a decade of learning everything I could about brewing, with some big help along the way.

I jumped to all grain brewing quickly, to have more control over my brew. I’ve read every brewing book I could get my hands on, listened to hundreds of hours of brewing podcasts and, of course, brewed my ass off. I was lucky enough to have support from friends and family when I needed equipment upgrades or honest feedback. I was also lucky to get a jump into the professional brewing world. I learned about commercial bottling and event planning in the three years I worked at Fountain Square Brewing in Indianapolis. Daredevil brewing company gave me the opportunity to expand my commercial brewing knowledge by letting me apprentice brew. I learned large scale brewing, proper cleaning and sanitation of commercial equipment, canning beer, kegging beer, cleaning kegs (lots of kegs), and the level of work it takes to make beer on the professional level. Most importantly, I learned how to make consistent, quality beer.

I started to enter competitions and fairly quickly saw results. In 2015, I placed 2nd in the Upland Brewery UpCup competition. In 2016, my stout placed 2nd in the first round of the national homebrew competition, and later in 2016, my stout took gold in the Indiana State Fair Brewer’s cup, then went on to beat 349 other brewers who entered 849 other beers to take home Best in Show in the Brewer’s cup.

I’m ready to start making beer for you and turn this love of the beer industry I have into my career.

About Heather
Heather spent the first half of her working life in the food and restaurant industry, spending time as a produce clerk, server, bartender, and finally restaurant manager. She is now an academic librarian, but is excited to be back working in the industry. Heather is a huge fan of craft beer, and she and Jason have visited approximately 220 breweries around the world. She founded the Lafayette chapter of Girls Pint Out, and loves the community building that comes with local beer.

Spread the word
Every little bit helps, so even if you’re not in a position to contribute financially, telling others about us is helpful and greatly appreciated.

Stay Connected
Stay connected with us, follow our progress, and learn more about us at:

Http://escapevelocitybrewing.com

http://twitter.com/Escapebrewery

http://www.facebook.com/EscapeVelocityBrewery

Or email us at info@escapevelocitybrewing.com

story:
Who We Are

GoYoga is a locally owned, family of 5 (soon to be 7) yoga studios that started 8 years ago thanks to one woman's vision.  It is our aim to provide a welcoming atmosphere and a more accessible way for people in our community to enjoy the incredible benefits of a regular yoga practice.  What you'll notice with GoYoga is a strong upholding of our values at all of our studios and a deep commitment to leaving you feeling your best self and supporting you in living your best life.  Whether you are coming to relax and relieve stress or to feel stronger, more flexible and physically healthy, we promise you:

  • Friendly, knowledgeable and passionate instructors who are committed to helping you achieve your wellness goals
  • A welcoming and comfortable atmosphere that is free from judgment and common yoga stigmas 
  • The best variety of classes in Columbus.  We'll launch with over 30 classes on our schedule in styles ranging from Relax & Restore to Hot Power + you have access to over 200 GoYoga classes citywide with your membership!

Founding Member Perks

As a valued Founding Member, you get to secure special edition packages, pricing and perks!  This beautiful location will contain 2 studios, heated and non-heated classes, 3 bathrooms (one with a shower!) and a courtyard space for post-class hangouts!   

All Founding Member packages include perks you can only get through our Founding Member campaign including:

  • Founding Member Lifetime Pricing (once your package expires you get to renew at our lowest Founding Member rates)
  • Retail shopping passes valid for a limited time on all full-priced mats, gear and apparel at the Brewery District Studio
  • Free class guest passes to share with your family, friends & co-workers
  • A free week of yoga for you and a guest during our VIP Opening Week 11/12 (your Founding Member package will activate the first day you use it after the free week)
  • A limited edition GoYoga tank or tee plus a GoYoga swag bag

We Are Grateful

We thank you for your support of our newest studio and for trusting in us as a partner on your wellness journey.  

We'd love it if you'd share this opportunity with others!  Use the Share feature so you get to practice alongside your favorite people!

If you have any questions about the studio, our Founding Member Packages or about us, please reach out!  You can email us at info@goyogausa.com or call us at (614) 591-4168.

story:
What Shezmu Cellars Means to Us

We grew up in rural Kentucky only a few miles from the home place of Bill Monroe, The Father of Bluegrass Music.  Hillbilly may be an accurate descriptor of how we grew up hunting to fill our freezer and visiting neighbors on horseback; but the poverty line be damned because we were rich in the love of our parents and each other. Since we can remember, we were taught to value  family, and specifically our brotherly bond, more than anything because “one day your brother will be all you have.” Unfortunately, that day got a little closer when our father passed last year from lung problems. 

In the wake of dad’s passing, we spoke a lot on what life looks like going forward. We concluded that Adam shouldn’t be risking his own health as an underground coal miner. Further, we would like to build something for the people we care about. As Cody was already an award winning craft whiskey distiller, we decided to build a winery/meadery. 

Quickly, that simple decision grew into an expression of our desire to add value to the world around us. With Shezmu Cellars we will:

  • Save the pollinators (we are partial to bees) as they are currently under attack from agricultural progress.
  • Support and implement safe transportation programs for our surrounding community because too many lives are damaged by drunk driving.
  • Experiment with pay structures and benefits packages to help change the service industry for the better.
  • Most importantly, we will be able to express our belief that a company is the most responsible link in the social chain by taking care of our community and our employees.
  • While we do all of this, of course, we will continue to produce tasty, award-wining beverages!

Why We Will Succeed (Bullet Point Version)

  • Already have over 3 years of successful industry experience
  • Great products 
    • Mead - Focusing on lower proof and less sweet (wine or beer like)
    • Wine - Georgia and California wines
  • 30 beer taps from day one featuring various local craft beers
  • Across the street from KSU: Marietta and down the road from Lockheed Martin and Dobbins Air Force Base (yay student and military discounts!)
  • Partnership with recently awarded #1 amber honey in America, Hometown Honey
  • Free weekend shuttle between Shezmu Cellars and 3 other craft alcohol manufacturers

What We Need & What You Get

We need $10,000 to help put the finishing touches on our concept and get us through some initial deposits and fees to opening. Of course, the more we can raise here, the better our initial opening will be so don't stop at 10k let's do this like we mead it! 

When we designed our perks we wanted to maximize YOUR value. Sure, we have some amazing gear like the Koozies, but we wanted to include straight up house cash to really make it worth your while! House Cash is a gift card good in store and online... and yes we will be shipping our beverages! To stretch out that house cash, all backers will receive 10% off any purchase at Shezmu Cellars through December 2019! 

Then we got creative and decided we'd love to make alcohol with you so we decided to host private winemaking sessions where you create a recipe and execute it alongside us. Of course, we need seating so if getting your name engraved on a permanent fixture is more your style, you should sponsor a bar stool or table! 

OH! All backers from the $100 level and up will be invited to our exclusive soft opening for early access to Shezmu Cellars!

These last two are our favorites, though. They include a Pharaoh Club Membership which is our version of a wine club, but better! It's lifetime and carries with it a permanent discount, exclusive member events, and quarterly wine/beer shipments!

The final perk is the private event and is really just our excuse to help you show off to as many of your closest friends as you want!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute and we get that, but that doesn't mean you can't help! We need your help spreading the word. Use the hashtag #LikeYouMeadIt anytime you're posting! Talk us up to your friends and see if they even know what mead is.

If you want perks without backing, create an Indiegogo account and use the share tools to help us make some noise about Shezmu Cellars and this campaign. We are tracking the people who generate the most money through sharing and they will get gear and house cash!

FOLLOW US to keep in touch. Our Instagram is our most active @shezmucellars but we have a facebook page and twitter too. Also checkout our website at shezmucellars.com

House Cash is a gift card good in store and online... and yes we will be shipping our beverages! To stretch out that house cash, all backers will receive 10% off any purchase at Shezmu Cellars through December 2019! 
Then we got creative and decided we'd love to make alcohol with you so we decided to host private winemaking sessions where you create a recipe and execute it alongside us. Of course, we need seating so if getting your name engraved on a permanent fixture is more your style, you should sponsor a bar stool or table! 
OH! All backers from the $100 level and up will be invited to our exclusive soft opening for early access to Shezmu Cellars!
These last two are our favorites, though. They include a Pharaoh Club Membership which is our version of a wine club, but better! It's lifetime and carries with it a permanent discount, exclusive member events, and quarterly wine/beer shipments!
The final perk is the private event and is really just our excuse to help you show off to as many of your closest friends as you want!

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute and we get that, but that doesn't mean you can't help! We need your help spreading the word. Use the hashtag #LikeYouMeadIt anytime you're posting! Talk us up to your friends and see if they even know what mead is.
If you want perks without backing, create an Indiegogo account and use the share tools to help us make some noise about Shezmu Cellars and this campaign. We are tracking the people who generate the most money through sharing and they will get gear and house cash!
FOLLOW US to keep in touch. Our Instagram is our most active @shezmucellars but we have a facebook page and twitter too. Also checkout our website at shezmucellars.com

story:
Why invest in my business:

- I have worked in retail / grocery / food service for 15 years.

     - Learned customer service skills, food prep standards, efficiency.

- I have worked in marketing & promotions for 10 years.

     - Learned that people love giveaways, sales, events, attractive branding & aesthetic.

- I have a Bachelor’s degree in Art (focused on design) & experience curating art shows & displays.

- I have 2+ years successfully owning & operating a small business (GeoClean).

     - Learned about hiring, accounting.

- Through GeoClean and other avenues I have developed a wonderful network of local friends.

- Wonder Lake is a beautiful, diverse, thriving, small community (pop 4,000), conveniently nestled right between larger towns (McHenry pop 27,000 to the east, Woodstock pop 25,000 to the west, and Crystal Lake pop 40,000 to the south). Property values are on the rise but most residents go out of town for shopping. There are very few community-friendly businesses in town, all we have are bars and convenience stores and pizza parlors but not a single cafe, resale store, nor gallery, and nowhere that kids can go to hang out. Many members of the community have expressed interest in a cafe but nobody has opened one yet.

- This is my lifelong dream which will bring together my interests of art & design, baking, and serving my community.

 

 

Concerns:

- Wonder Lake is generally a lower income area. I will price goods accordingly, sell only affordable curated resale items and art.

- I’ve talked about moving out of state. While I love the southwest and do have interest in moving there at some point, it would be a disservice to everyone who supported me in moving to Wonder Lake if I didn’t do what I said I would do here, which was to buy a home that I could realistically pay off in order to live mortgage-free and then live off of my art and serve my community. The goal has always been art-motivated, and I can’t make art if I’m working full-time in a non-creative field to pay the bills. With a shop I can get creative and work on art there during downtime. I have at least 5 years left on my home mortgage, so why not use that time to do what I love?

- What about GeoClean? I will have to bring my housecleaning schedule down to very part-time in order to open a shop, possibly quit altogether, but hope to hire a cleaner to continue the business in my place. I will not let my clients down, who have been instrumental in supporting me to reach for this goal.

- What about Coronavirus? We will have tip-top cleaning standards and wear gloves & masks while mandated. We will encourage social distancing and limit customers in the store while told to do so. We will have outdoor seating, weather permitting. And I’m confident that eventually, it’ll be safe to gather indoors again.

 

 

Why this business is going to be awesome:

- We’ll serve fresh coffee, tea, other bottled beverages, prepackaged baked goods (no baking in store), possibly sandwiches, and also sell artisan goods and curated resale items, as well as display and sell art.

- We are going to do lots of promotions and giveaways, such as “name of the day” (which gets tons of interaction at other establishments in the area), raffles, events such as paint nights, maybe classes…

- It’ll have a very fun, colorful design & aesthetic, totally instagrammable. I’m thinking murals on the walls. Elegant & mature psychedelic vibes. Vintage and retro from the 60s, 70s, & 80s mixed with a bit of modern. Loosely Alice in Wonderland inspired.

- If food service inspections will allow it, I’d love to keep a rabbit in the shop for customers to visit. Maybe in a fully enclosed "tank" so there's no contamination risk. And perhaps a different rabbit each week (I have 10) to keep things exciting.

- I will have a full "free library" bookshelf so that customers can sit down and read while sipping their coffee or tea.

- As mentioned before, there’s nothing like this in town. And if there’s nothing remotely Wonderland-themed in Wonder Lake it’s a major missed opportunity!

- Target demographic is women in their 30s, and their kids, partners, Moms, Dads… something for the whole family!

- I’d love to interact with other local businesses & sell local artisans’ creations.

 

 

Inspirational businesses:

The General Store (Greenwood), Ethereal Confections (Woodstock), Conscious Cup (Crystal Lake), Cracker Jax (DeKalb), Blue Box Cafe (Elgin), The Half Full Nest (Dundee), Epic Deli (McHenry).

 

 

Possible Locations:

7518 Hancock (my favorite, owned but vacant, in communication with owner),  7502 Hancock (for sale $75K, owner would consider renting), 7512 Hancock (owned but vacant), all are downtown “Wonder Center” across from gas station with good foot traffic.

 

 

Budget:

1K - first month’s rent & utilities

1K - construction: coffee bar, sink, lighting

1K - painting, seating, shelving, hardware

1.5K - appliances & supplies (see Amazon list https://www.amazon.com/hz/wishlist/ls/2IQTVSU3C... )

1.5K - merchandise & advertising

 

Goal is to open by spring 2021. If I can raise half of this budgeted amount, I can invest the other half myself. If I can raise more than this amount, it all goes back into the community by allowing me to purchase resale merchandise from other local artisans. Every person who donates and provides their address will be mailed a coupon for a free beverage. Some investors have greater means than others, but every bit counts and is deeply appreciated! If every resident of Wonder Lake donates just $1, we can make this dream reality!

 

Please consider investing, and share with friends!

story:
Flood destroyed 983 houses, damaged 1916 houses. Citizens of Sochi need your help.

Здравствуйте, этот проект организован организацией "Волонтеры без границ", мы находимся в Краснодарском крае.

Каждый из Вас знает, что в городе Сочи 24-25 июня произошло сильнейшее наводнение. Постадало 1916 жилых дома, повреждено 983 дома, количество проживающих в них людей порядка 4000. Сумма ущерба предварительно составляет 350 млн. руб. (http://www.sochiadm.ru/emergency/46262/)

В дни, когда бушевала стихия, по телевидению нон-стоп шли репортажи с места событий, Интернет был заполнен фотографиями разрушенных зданий, массовой эвакуации и прочими ужасами, с которыми столкнулись жители Сочи и Адлера. А спустя неделю все уже об этом забыли и у местных жителей опускаются руки при виде развалин, в которые превратились их дома. 

Несмотря на то, что сейчас режим ЧС уже отменен и в полной мере ведутся восстановительные работы, пострадавшим от наводнения катастрофических масштабов, необходима помощь. Установлены компенсации: жители, "частично утратившие имущество", получат по 50 тыс. руб., утратившие имущество полностью - по 100 тыс. руб.

Выделяемых средств ничтожно мало для тех, кто оказался в эпицентре стихии, чьё имущество пострадало от наводнения.

В данный момент необходимо:

одежда, постельное белье, инструменты, тепловые пушки, чтобы просушить затопленные помещения, бытовая химия, средства гигиены, детские вещи и игрушки, очень много строительных материалов для восстановления повреждённых домов.

Жители города очень нуждаются в Вашей помощи. Мы все любим приезжать отдыхать на побережье, многие из нас были на Олимпиаде 2014. Теперь же пришло время для поддержки. Друг познается в беде. Мы не можем предложить Вам дорогие подарки за Вашу помощь, но эти вещи позволят Вам сохранить память о Вашем добром поступке.

story:
Introductions
Hello! Firstly, I would like to thank you for coming onto my campaign page before formally introducing myself. My name is Senay, I am a Human Nutrition B.Sc. holder with a passion for all things nutrition and vegan.

I want to take this passion for nutrition of mine and educational background and put it into good use. What I want do with it is start up an NGO that will be geared toward tackling under-and-malnutrition in the developing world.

If you, like myself, think it’s about time nutritional deprivation was completely eradicated then help me get NOPE off the ground by contributing toward my campaign.

What is the NOPE campaign all about?

NOPE, which stands for Nutritional Optimisation Programme, is an NGO in the making that will be aimed at tackling malnutrition, under-nutrition and a phenomenon known as hidden hunger.



How will NOPE do this?

NOPE will do this through a range of micro-nutrient powders (MNPs) that are especially formulated to tackle key micro-nutrient deficiencies such as vitamin A deficiency (VAD) and iron deficiency. The unique thing about these MNPs is that they’ll also add to the caloric intake needs by providing an adequate energy supply. This will serve to ensure both caloric and micro-nutrient needs are equally met.


Is there a need for NOPE?

Yes, there is a crucial need for MNP programmes like NOPE. This is because there are currently over 800 million people who are suffering from chronic states of under-nutrition, hidden hunger and severe acute malnutrition.  What this means is that all of these hundreds of millions of people are unable to get the caloric energy and micronutrients they need in order to achieve optimal health.


What is meant by optimal health?

Well in this context what is meant by optimal health is being freed from the adverse health effects caused by poor nutritional uptake, what could also be described as nutritional deprivation.


Just what are these adverse health effects?



Who are most susceptible to these micronutrient deficiency disorders?

The very poorest members of societies in the developing world are the most likely to end up with one of these micronutrient deficiency disorders. Most of these affected individuals are made up of infants, young children and females, simply because they are the least economically empowered members of society. These conditions can however be easily prevented through the right nutritional interventions. NOPE wants to do just that. The money will be put into developing and providing MNPs tailored toward infants, young children, expecting mothers and young woman.


What will these MNPs do?

Each MNP will contain a mixture of micro-nutrients that are not being appropriately sourced from an often limited diet. These key micro-nutrients will be packaged to tackle crucial issues such as vitamin A, folic acid, zinc, iron, iodine deficiencies, as these can have devastating effects.


How much will all of this cost?

NOPE will need £50,000 to formulate its range of micro-nutrient powders (MNPs) that could be used to fortify and supplement the nutrient and caloric supply of the nutritionally deprived. £50,000 would get the programme up and running for 12 months.

The programme will firstly target a specific country such as Cambodia, where malnutrition affects 40% of all under 5 year olds, before expanding its operations. The Programme aims to produce enough MNPs in the first year to cater for a thousand people throughout the year. 


What are the risks & challenges?

All of the money raised will go toward designing and producing the MNPs, getting NOPE up and running, marketing and promotion, as well as making sure contingencies are in place. All of this will be very challenging and quite difficult to achieve without a healthy dose of perseverance and belief in the cause. However, you can rest assured I have the passion and dedication to make this work.


Costs Analysis:

·  MNP design & production (£20k)

·  NOPE registration & start-up (£15k)

·  Marketing & promotion (£5k)

·  Contingencies (£10k)


Conclusion

So if you want to invest in a cause that will pay dividends in terms of building social capital, through a much needed and effective programme, then please consider  funding NOPE. It will specifically be geared toward the demographics that need it most and produce tangible results.

story:
We at Vefley believe that every moment has the potential to become a memory. 





           

                                  

         

                      EVENT FEED                                                    SEARCH EVENTS


              THROW AN EVENT                                             EVENT DESCRIPTION



         










          

The moment of truth: we know in today's high-tech world, there's a new app on the block each day. Although we have full faith in Vefley and are determined to do whatever it takes to turn it into the awesomeness it deserves, we are not Superman(we wish!)


There's a Japanese term 'Otaku',which is an adjective used to describe a person passionate about something. At Vefley, we all are Otaku at heart and hence, our target audience is also people who are really passionate! As they say, one can't please everyone. So, we want to cater to the needs of a niche of audience and make sure they make the best of Vefley. 
 

Rest assured, whatever funds we raise,  would be invested  in Vefley. In case we are unable to reach our goal, we would restructure our budget without compromising on quality.

The backbone of Vefley's working would be it's vast database of events and reviews. Which needs highly capable tech people. But don't worry. We have it covered there. 

              


Even if you can't afford to give towards our project we really appreciate that you've come to our page and found out Vefley, and read this far... Thank you! 
If you really want to help us, tweet/blog/post about us and share our Indiegogo campaign! 
We'll love you nonetheless!

story:
Hello Everyone,

We started this campaign to aid in disaster relief efforts in Myanmar due to the recent floods. Our initial goal was to provide immediate relief of food & clothing, however, we have since changed our primary objective to rebuilding efforts. The floods have affected more than one million people in 10 states out of the 14 states. The official death toll just registers above one hundred. 

Four states of Rakhine, Magway, Chin and Sagaing, have been declared as natural disaster regions. 1.2 million acres of rice fields have been destroyed, houses were swept away, and entire villages were submerged. Thousands of people were left with nothing - no home, no clothing, no saved seeds to plant in the upcoming season. Since the majority of Myanmar's rural population are farmers, this is disastrous. If farmers are unable to recover, food shortages will occur in the upcoming year. 

This campaign is to help with the rebuilding efforts done in Myanmar. As students studying overseas, we initiated this campaign to help with the relief efforts being done in the country as much as possible as we are not able to be there ourselves. 

The donations will be directed to aid in rebuilding efforts. Rotary Club of Yangon's Myanmar Flood Relief Program will be one of the organisations we'll be directing the donations to. 

$100 can help a family rebuild entirely.


For More Information, Contact Us.

Eric Win                                                    Yint Hmu
+61413242878                                       +16463064114
eric_win25@hotmail.com                   yinthmu@gmail.com

story:
Hi, my name is Kyo Pang and I was born and raised in Malaysia. I'm here to introduce you to my store, Kopitiam. 

Kopitiam will be the Traditional Malaysian Coffee House at 51B, Canal Street, on Lower East Side in Manhattan, New York. We specialized in traditional Baba Nyonya cuisine & beverage, which also is one of the oldest traditions in Malaysia. 

Our delicacies are very colorful, flavorful and visionally exciting. On top of that, we do not use any additive. Just like in the old days, we use natural ingredients, such as flowers and leaves to create the colors and flavors of the treats that we carefully handcrafted. 

Nevertheless, in order to maintain the authenticity of the taste, most of the ingredients we used were carefully handled and shipped all the way from Malaysia. 



Many people might not know what does "Baba Nyonya"actually means. Baba-Nyonya are terms that were used for the descendants of the 15th through 17th century Chinese immigrants to the British Malaya. "Baba" referred to men and "Nyonya" referred to women.

Back in the days, our cultures were very much influenced by the local Malays & Europeans, so were the cuisines. Since women took the major responsibilities in the cookings, Nyonyas (women) were well known for a wide variety of traditional street foods and cake (kuih).

                


Unfortunately, Baba Nyonya cuisine is a fading tradition because the preparation process is so delicate and very time consuming. Hence, as the third generation of Nyonya in my family, I feel that it is my obligation to keep this beautiful tradition going. 

Growing up in my grandmother's kitchen, I have seen how much she spent times and loves to prepare all the delicate delicacies. Many people that were raised in my generations were not encourage to pursue in food businesses. Hence, it is very sad if something beautiful like is fading away from time to time.



For years, I've been struggling to pick a side between my passion and what I have got in my degree, however, my wife encouraged me to take the advantage of the gift that my family have given to me. Throughout the time, starting from our neighbors and friends in our circles, we received very good feedbacks from everyone. 

Started earlier this year, my wife and I started selling some Baba Nyonya foods at some of the New York Street fairs. Since then, the interest in our food has grown to the point that we have many social media followers follow us around five boroughs. It is very satisfying to see how people loves our food and come back for more of them. 

Running around to different street fairs are very fun experience. However, it is not good for a long run. Hence, in order to produce more quality Baba Nyonya food, we we need a stable location and a store, and that's why we are starting one now.   

We rented a place and already started renovations. However, our abilities are limited. With your help, we planned on being up and running by this Fall. We are still missing a few things such as furnitures and equipments, that is why we are running this campaign. So, please help us to keep this beautiful tradition alive by supporting Kopitiam.

Your support will be extremely appreciated and any donation count. Of course, you will be rewarded with some cool perks. Please follow our updates and hope to see you soon for some Pulut Inti at our Kopitiam!

story:
BACKGROUND

The idea of HopLore was born nearly a year ago when former schoolmates with similar interests in craft beer sat down and discussed aspirations to take a hobby and turn it into a profession.  Much time has been spent visiting breweries, comparing quality against the best in the industry. We reached out to brewers, owners and employees of successful small breweries and asked important questions that included what they felt was done right, what surprised them, and what they would have done differently. As with anything, learning from others is better than taking the more difficult path and learning through hard knocks.

We have spent countless hours working on our business plan tweaking, adjusting and streamlining the business.  We have brewed numerous batches of beer to develop high quality recipes in various styles. We have developed our own proprietary methods to developing our own tastes. We have spent hours researching brewery set ups, had meetings with advisors, investors and supporters. 

HopLore is closer to reality than ever before. 

THE CONCEPT

The most amazing part of the craft beer industry is that it is rooted in things we all hold dear: Family, Friendship, and Community. 

As the concept for HopLore became more concrete it was apparent that we had to have those things at our core. As a brewpub we are creating a setting to share a unique experience with friends and family.  HopLore is not only a place to enjoy great food produced largely from local sources, but great beer made in house for the beer geeks of the world. It a great hang out with the guys, but also to take the Mrs. that doesn't drink beer because local wines will be available.  HopLore will be a place to explore new beer styles, but will also offer something for those that aren't feeling as adventurous.

We believe that a setting in the middle of farm country at a historic mill is ideal and sets the scene for a unique experience that only a destination brewpub can provide. 

Besides being a production brewery, HopLore will also offer a full kitchen, relaxing outdoor dining space and space for live music.

DINING

Nothing goes with beer quite like barbecue! We will be sourcing as many local ingredients as possible. We will be exploring traditional as well as chef driven dishes with a down home feel. We will seek to utilize local growers for seasonal offerings. Once open we will look to source beef and pork from local farms while providing them with spent grain from the brewing process for feed. 

ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY

We feel strongly about sustainability and being environmentally friendly. We will recycle as much as we can, for example using the spent grain from brewing for farmers feed. We will utilize water from the brewing process to water our hops. We will seek to responsibly use energy and eventually become self sustaining with solar power. 

SPECIAL EVENTS & OUTDOOR SPACE

HopLore's outdoor space will be a friendly dining environment with space for some live music, firepit, outdoor games. We will also utilize this space for special events, releases, and charitable events.  As a business we believe that giving back to the community is essential to what we hold dear: Family, Friendships, and Community. 

What can I do to help? 

Indiegogo helps start-up businesses like HopLore create and bring to market projects with the help of the community.

We need lots of small donations from people who love small business, local food and drink, live music and share our belief in becoming like family, cultivating friendships and strengthening the community. 

 WHERE DOES THE MONEY RAISED GO?

Opening a brewery is not easy. With your help, we will build our brewpub from the ground up. But, before we can begin commercial production of our beer, HopLore needs to become licensed with the State and Federal Government. 

The money raised from this campaign will provide the capital required to take the next steps and show the demand for this type of business in the lakes area. 

The other things we need capital for are:

- Licensing and Bonding fees   - Legal services

REWARDS

Indiegogo doesn't allow us to give alcohol as a reward, but we reward with things to open beer, drink beer out of and an opportunity to be a part of HopLore for years to come.

story:
Meet Hopscotch

In October, 2015 Kelly and I met after a birthday cake delivery. Since then, our paths have crossed many times both personally and professionally. Kelly is an artist at her own Design Sunshine and Kaya is the pastry chef and owner/operator of Hopscotch. We are coming together to create a space that is both beautiful, useful, and inspiring for the neighborhood and community they are so much a part of. 

With differing, yet complimentary design backgrounds, Hopscotch: Bakery + Market offers a fresh, unique aesthetic to the Champaign-Urbana area with a focus on locally sourced ingredients and products.

The community's response to Hopscotch: Cakes + Confections location inside Art Mart has been amazing and now we are ready to move baking operations from the Art Mart location to a beautiful rehabilitated historic location at 802 West John Street in Champaign. We have secured financing for the commercial kitchen build-out and now we are working on the finishing touches to make the shop an even more special and unique experience for our customers. 

The building has been a hallmark of the neighborhood for nearly 100 years and the old "dietary store," as it has been for the last 50 years, needs a bit of love to bring it back up to snuff. Depending on your time in the neighborhood you may remember it as "Kelsey's" or even "Gallian's." We plan to pay homage to the building and its history with your help. 

​What Are You Funding?

With the funding we receive we will be able to create a space that is not only beautiful, but also organized and functional. This will support increased potential for long-term success and growth for our business and, in turn, will contribute to a thriving neighborhood community. Additionally, it is most important to us that our customers have a unique, positive experience in our shop and each of these items will contribute to a more streamlined and beautiful shopping experience for everyone who walks through the door at Hopscotch.

 

We are very grateful to have secured a loan and we are using our savings for our shop's build-out costs, but there is a lot more that goes into opening a bakery/shop than just building the walls, purchasing and installing the windows, doors, cabinets, counters and sinks and sourcing high-quality refrigeration. 

The funds raised during this campaign will help enable us to pay for the following for our shop:

Point-of-sale system, including iPad register, iPad register stand, credit card swiper, receipt printer and tape, cash drawer, label printer and labels, bar code scanner, and provider services.

WiFi speaker system for streaming lovely tunes in the shop.

High quality bakery grade pastry tables, flour bins, dishwasher, coffee mugs, and pastry plates.

Supplies for crucial daily shop operations, including plastic wrap and boxes for transport, boxes/gift boxes and packaging, ribbon and twine for making your packages and cake boxes pretty and unique.

Basic but necessary items such as plumbing and HVAC units to blow cool in the summer and warm and cozy in the winter. 

Shop Opening Inventory, including Brian Seversen flour, cane sugar, Kilgus milk and other hand-picked & curated lovely gift items that we will feature in our shop alongside our desserts.

If we are fortunate enough to exceed our campaign goal we will use those funds to begin chipping away at our build-out loan expenses and to create a more stable opening working capital for our brand new shop.

Our Thank You to You

Check out our perks for details on a variety of unique and special offerings that we will be providing to those who contribute to making our dream Hopscotch shop a reality.  You don't want to miss them - whether you are already a Hopscotch customer or if you are new to our services these perks are really good!

Part of Something Bigger

Our Hopscotch: Bakery + Market shop will be located in the old 802 West John Street building, located in old-town Champaign.  The revamped building will be a vibrant, open-air concept marketplace where residents and visitors can gather to enjoy food, drinks (and of course, desserts) in a warm and inviting atmosphere.   Hopscotch is very excited to be a part of the historic neighborhood.  The overall impact of the 802 building on our beloved old town Champaign is sure to be one of positive experiences and growth for our community.

Risks & Challenges

Running a small business is not for the faint of heart!  We are fully aware (and freaked out by!) many of the risks involved in expanding our business and opening a bakery/retail shop and here is why we have chosen to take the leap...

Since Hopscotch began, our customer's have asked us "where is your shop?" and "where can I come see more or your products?".  We have worked very hard at establishing positive customer relationships and trust in our products and designs during our first year of business so we are beyond grateful and happy that our community only seems to want more access to Hopscotch's offerings.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is in a position to contribute to our campaign, but if you cannot contribute financially you can still help spread the word about what we are doing.  We are so grateful to everyone who will help share and spread the word about our campaign!

Thank you for your support!

 <3 Hopscotch / Kaya + Kelly

story:
Short Summary

   My campaign is about raising funds to purchase a soft cake machine so l can start a street business and through the profits, use the money to empower other young people who are clueless about how to make it in life.
story_txt:
Short Summary
   My campaign is about raising funds to purchase a soft cake machine so l can start a street business and through the profits, use the money to empower other young people who are clueless about how to make it in life.

story:
I'm Martha - Kokolita is my nickname. It was a pink round cookie that apparently I resembled a lot as a kid :)

After a rough child hood and an even rougher teenage life full of challenges, being a teen mom among many other things. I finally got a grip on my life. I got a job in retail and climbed that ladder and started a family. In getting ready for black Friday I completed my duties and let my boss know I'd be taking a few days to tend to my 4 month old. Her response: "You need to get your priorities straight. How will you take care of your family without a job". My response: A resignation letter and a plan to open my own shop that not only made killer unique products, but an important mission - Feed the hungry, help single parents, help the children, help youth in addiction recovery, show hope for victims of abuse! - Prove to them that there is hope and possibilities out there is you are will to go for them!

Kokolita's was born and the grand opening was on 11/11/11, which was also Veterans day...another cause to support. From my little shop over the last 5 years we have helped over 8,000 deserving people make their lives better.

With your contributions we will reach the next level as a business and it will blow up that number from 8,000 to 800,000 to 8,000,000 one day. It will amplify our Mission's Success: "change the world, feed the needy, one treat at a time". With your contribution YOU get to be the change the world. YOU become a part of that 8 million. We can't do it without YOU!!

Here's the opportunity we have in front of us... 

We worked long and hard and got a connection to the buyers for COSTCO. We were invited to demonstrate our empanadas in their test kitchen at their corporate office. They LOVED them and just like that we got the opportunity to sell them raw in the frozen section to the public at select COSTCO stores.

After lots of research and the proven track record of frozen items sold, we realized that this opportunity will make all the time and energy my family and I have sacrificed, the many nights they had to go to work with me worth it for their futures and for all the people we help through our little company. But to make it happen we needed a plan...

Here's the plan: We need to raise 85 thousand dollars! - We have to have walk in freezers and refrigerators installed. That alone will cost about 30 thousand. We have to purchase packaging, not only food grade but freezer safe, because the empanadas have meat in them.  I need to get my kitchen USDA certified as well as pass the COSTCO audit process. Here we're talking about another 12 thousand. Then we have the first run of payroll, ingredients, production and climate controlled transportation to the warehouses. We also have to produce the items we are giving away with pledges. Based on the quotes we have received this will be another 30 thousand.  We have also been in business long enough to know that things come up a long the way, so we knew that raising the exact amount would be unproductive and leave us unable to finish what we have started. If we don't reach our complete goal we will do what we can with what we get, starting with fulfilling the items promised to YOU, our awesome contributors! Then installing the walk in freezers and of course the work we have to go through for the COSTCO audit.

When all this hard work becomes reality we will continue to make an impact on this world they way we know how... Together through this project we will help more single parents, feed more homeless, give youth in recovery of addiction something else to fixate on through our classes and even employment. We will create jobs while creating a great quality product which is a MUCH healthier option than most frozen food items available on those shelves today!

After 5 years we have gone though the ups and downs. We have thrived through a recession and we have built a strong brand. We have helped 8,000 deserving people and we have known what it's like to deal with government agencies and employment turnover. I'm so thankful for the management experience I obtained for the 10 years I did it. It helped so much.

Any contribution is totally appreciated! We will update you on what's coming and what's left to do a long the way. We will give you the coolest thank you gifts as promised in the packages. And if you can't contribute - no problem!! if you could just take the time to watch the video and share, share, share it. You would not only be impacting me and my kids - but more importantly the thousands of people in need!

Thanks so much for your support!

Her response: "You need to get your priorities straight. How will you take care of your family without a job". My response: A resignation letter and a plan to open my own shop that not only made killer unique products, but an important mission - Feed the hungry, help single parents, help the children, help youth in addiction recovery, show hope for victims of abuse! - Prove to them that there is hope and possibilities out there is you are will to go for them!
Kokolita's was born and the grand opening was on 11/11/11, which was also Veterans day...another cause to support. From my little shop over the last 5 years we have helped over 8,000 deserving people make their lives better.
With your contributions we will reach the next level as a business and it will blow up that number from 8,000 to 800,000 to 8,000,000 one day. It will amplify our Mission's Success: "change the world, feed the needy, one treat at a time". With your contribution YOU get to be the change the world. YOU become a part of that 8 million. We can't do it without YOU!!
Here's the opportunity we have in front of us... 
We worked long and hard and got a connection to the buyers for COSTCO. We were invited to demonstrate our empanadas in their test kitchen at their corporate office. They LOVED them and just like that we got the opportunity to sell them raw in the frozen section to the public at select COSTCO stores.
After lots of research and the proven track record of frozen items sold, we realized that this opportunity will make all the time and energy my family and I have sacrificed, the many nights they had to go to work with me worth it for their futures and for all the people we help through our little company. But to make it happen we needed a plan...
Here's the plan: We need to raise 85 thousand dollars! - We have to have walk in freezers and refrigerators installed. That alone will cost about 30 thousand. We have to purchase packaging, not only food grade but freezer safe, because the empanadas have meat in them.  I need to get my kitchen USDA certified as well as pass the COSTCO audit process. Here we're talking about another 12 thousand. Then we have the first run of payroll, ingredients, production and climate controlled transportation to the warehouses. We also have to produce the items we are giving away with pledges. Based on the quotes we have received this will be another 30 thousand.  We have also been in business long enough to know that things come up a long the way, so we knew that raising the exact amount would be unproductive and leave us unable to finish what we have started. If we don't reach our complete goal we will do what we can with what we get, starting with fulfilling the items promised to YOU, our awesome contributors! Then installing the walk in freezers and of course the work we have to go through for the COSTCO audit.
When all this hard work becomes reality we will continue to make an impact on this world they way we know how... Together through this project we will help more single parents, feed more homeless, give youth in recovery of addiction something else to fixate on through our classes and even employment. We will create jobs while creating a great quality product which is a MUCH healthier option than most frozen food items available on those shelves today!
After 5 years we have gone though the ups and downs. We have thrived through a recession and we have built a strong brand. We have helped 8,000 deserving people and we have known what it's like to deal with government agencies and employment turnover. I'm so thankful for the management experience I obtained for the 10 years I did it. It helped so much.
Any contribution is totally appreciated! We will update you on what's coming and what's left to do a long the way. We will give you the coolest thank you gifts as promised in the packages. And if you can't contribute - no problem!! if you could just take the time to watch the video and share, share, share it. You would not only be impacting me and my kids - but more importantly the thousands of people in need!
Thanks so much for your support!

story:
WE ARE CRAFT BEER.

Gunbarrel Brewing Company is owned and operated by James Fox & his wife Marie. We are your friends, your community and the heart and soul of Gunbarrel Brewing Company. We are friendly, honest and hard-working people who are passionate about craft beer and building a company that enriches all of the lives it touches.

The brewery is located at 7088 Winchester Circle in Boulder, Colorado, facing 71st street. The brewery is named for the small, independent-minded unincorporated Boulder community of Gunbarrel which it calls home. Renovations of our 20,000 sq ft. facility are underway, brewing equipment is waiting in storage, and we are on the brink of opening in March of this year. We're beyond excited to serve all of you by bringing audacious beer and community-minded business to our corner of Boulder!

 

SOON TO BE GUNBARREL'S "LIVING ROOM"

Our casual, spacious, and lively tap room will be a place for both local residents and visitors to gather and enjoy the Brewery’s regular beers, as well as experimental and limited production beers offered only on-site.

Our beautiful outdoor beer garden will be a fantastic gathering spot for a sunny game of corn hole or relaxing under the stars around the fire pit with friends.

Enjoy an evening out in Gunbarrel! Gather round the taproom for live performances from local and visiting musicians.  Unwind with friends around the pool table, throw some darts, play shuffleboard or enjoy any of our other assorted games. Visitors the the brewery will find a selection of delicious locally made food products to nibble on, as well as a selection of innovative food trucks from the surrounding area. We will offer guided tours of our brewery facilities, as well as regularly hosted educational events. 

Those seeking a more private affair can utilize our event facilities for neighborhood meetings, parties, corporate and other special events.

 

CHEERS TO OUR FRIENDS!

Opening a 20,000 sq foot brewery in Boulder is no small task.  Our $27k goal is what we'll need to put finishing touches on our taproom and really bring it to life and make it special. We value your contributions and are showing our thanks with a slew of awesome rewards. If you'd like to make a monetary donation without receiving a tangible perk, please click the pink "BACK IT" button above. Your reward for a donation includes our undying gratitude and splendiferous high-fives!

 

 

 

 

 

WHAT MAKES US SO DARN SPECIAL

quality assurance

We will employ our own laboratory from day one in order to craft the best beer possible. The laboratory is a  key component of our Quality Assurance Program ensuring excellence in our beer. James' extensive scientific  background and training will allow for knowledgeable implementation of these programs, which will save both time and money on outside testing. We are fortunate to have the expertise on site to implement these programs which are unfortunately uncommon in most craft breweries.

culture craft

Gunbarrel Brewing Company is among an elite society of International breweries to employ a coolship. We are the first brewery in the United States to open with one, marking our commitment to continuing the tradition of spontaneous fermentation started long ago in  Belgium.

A coolship is a large, shallow, open vessel in which fresh wort is exposed to wild yeast and bacteria from the environment. After exposure these beers are then allowed to ferment and age in oak barrels. This process allows for unique flavors to arise from the local wild organisms along with flavors derived from each individual barrel, giving our beer a special sense of place. With time, patience, and love, these beers develop into exceptionally unique beers that vary from batch to batch and year to year, bestowing new and intriguing tastes upon our consumers.

eco consciousness

We make sustainable resource and disposal choices, to lessen our impact on the environment, enhance overall efficiency, and convert waste into a valuable product.

  • Implement universal zero waste requirements and comply with the Universal Zero Waste Ordinance.
  • Donate spent grain, the leftover malt, to farmers to be re-purposed into animal feed.
  • Packaging product only in serving tanks, kegs and cans instead of bottles whenever possible.
  • 100% clean energy powered business by offsetting our energy usage with Green-e certified Renewable Energy Certificates from American wind farms.

community

Craft beer brings people together from all walks of life in the name of the best hobby there is - appreciating all things craft beer. We will host our own regularly planned beer education club. Stay tuned for details! Additionally, visitors will enjoy trivia, games, themed parties, beer and food pairings.

Our annual Found Fruit Project highlights the enthusiastic donations of fruit from community members throughout Boulder County. The project helps to keep perfectly good fruit from going to waste, while pushing our imaginations to produce some really innovative brews with a real sense of place! In 2017, we will be hosting a huge party at the brewery to celebrate the beers we make with community sourced "found fruit"!

investing in our people

While aspiring to brew some of the best beers in the world, we also want to be the best company to work for that we can be. We are building a team of hardworking, passionate, driven and  talented people who share our love for outstanding craft beer.

  • Our passion for great beer is what defines us. Having everyone in our company not just share this passion, but also share the knowledge that underpins this passion is imperative to our mission. The Cicerone program is similar to Sommelier qualifications but it is completely focused on beer. We provide training for all of our co-workers, we fund the exams and study materials, provide training sessions and even give people an automatic pay raise for each level of the accreditation they pass.
  • Great service is a cornerstone of our success and what defines our customer relationships and interactions with each other as a team. We intentionally create an organizational culture that nurtures great service. We teach each and every one of our employees the recipe that we have developed for great service.

We treat everyone we come into contact with as an individual and with care. We provide them with high quality service to match and EVEN enhance the high quality CRAFT beer that WE SERVE.

 

IMPACT

The past three years have been leading up to this moment.  We searched far and wide and finally have a place that will be perfect for the brewery of our dreams (and yours too we hope!). Your contribution to this project represents a very unique opportunity to be a part of something special and impactful. 

Thanks so much for checking our campaign out - if you can't contribute, please consider sharing this with your friends and helping us spread the word!

Sincerely, 

Jamie & Marie

story:
Do you know someone who...

      

Shaving with an electric shaver or beard trimmer can cause a mess!

Causing frustration!

VanityGuard helps you cleanup after you tidy up!

Stick the VanityGuard over the surface you want to protect using the tape on the edges of the sheet. Let the debris fall on the sheet, and throw away!

Creating a thumbs up experience for everyone!

History

Rahman Jones created VanityGuard when faced with the hassle of cleaning the sink after shaving his face and head with an electric razor.

Rahman was awarded a patent on his invention. 

We need your help!

By contributing to our campaign you will allow us to begin the sale and manufacture of this clean, elegant, thoughtful product, VanityGuard!

   

Tell your friends!

Thank you for sharing our story!

story:
There are many different fragrance and skin care products on the market but there are few that have mostly natural ingredients and even fewer still that have been developed by Pharmacists.  Let's face it, pharmacists know about formulation and pharmacists also know about chemistry, biology and can do the calculations necessary for success.  All of this makes for excellent products!

The Apothecary's Gift is a fragrance, skin care and hair product line that is owned and developed by me.  My name is Vanessa LeSure-Walker. 

 I am a pharmacist, with about 20 years behind the counter

 and 12 years of experience teaching, training and helping Pharmacy Technicians pass the credentialing examination. 

 I also visit Senior Citizen Centers to help them understand their medications.  


Now I am using my experience as a clinician and educator to create something special through The Apothecary's Gift.


One of the newer products that I created is Flowkra gel a hair and face product that is made from Flax , Okra and Marshmallow.  Using this product as a face mask is a way that more people can get the spa experience at home.

So far, I have given samples of my product out and some of the comments that I have had about my products are as follows:

"My mom uses one of your lotions and it smells so good"--Samantha B.


"Your product made me feel like a lady who deserved to be pampered.  Very relaxing and soothing.  I was happy to use the product before going out to dinner.  I felt like I had a spa treatment!  Cannot wait to use it again." - R. Smith


"Your gel goes right into my hair and leaves no residue"--Diane P.
                                               -------------------

The Apothecary's Gift allows me to help more people benefit from what I know and that is so very satisfying!  I can use my knowledge and skill set to  help people turn where they stay into a spa for a day... 

Won't you help me help people reduce stress, beautify their skin and hair and live a better quality of life by donating to my campaign?  This is my plan to use the money:

form an LLC                                                                                                                  $2000

 buy equipment                                                                                                             $1150

               filtration apparatus

                industrial mixer

                industrial printer

 get some flyers to advertise to local beauty shops and spas                         $200

 barcode my products for Amazon                                                                           $200

 purchase more inventory and packaging supplies                                          $2000

 pay insurance for 1 year                                                                                               $800

Secure a designate space for a lab and office                                                     $1500

 have a website designed                                                                                              $450

 and put my business in the Circle of Sisters Event in NYC this October   $1500

This comes to                                                                                                                 $9800

               Will you help me by supporting my business?

story:
What is The Jammy Dodger, and what the heck is Nosh and Nerdery?

The Jammy Dodger will be a one-of-a-kind, café that serves sandwiches, soups, salads and other light fare, as well as a large selection of baked goods, like cupcakes, cookies, pastries and other sweets.  We'll also carry quality coffee drinks, teas, hot chocolate, lemonade and other beverages.  That is the nosh.  It's a British term for food and drink.  The Nerdery will consist of comics, tabletop games, collectibles, t-shirts and related items  

You'll be able to come in for just a cup of coffee, breakfast, lunch or snack, or you can hang out, stay awhile and play a library of amazing board games, pick up the latest Deadpool comic, or shop our awesome t-shirts or POP figures.  

We'll also have themed game nights, options for birthday parties and special events and other awesome things to do.  

What does the Jammy Dodger Have to Offer?

A library of tons of games, available for unlimited play

A positive space to interact one-on-one with friends and family

Light fare, from sandwiches to pastries, cupcakes to homemade soups.

Delicious beverages- we'll have a full coffee bar, proper English teas, lemonade, hot chocolate, and more.

An educated staff to suggest and teach new games, dish on the latest comics  or just bring you a latte`!

Why Do We Want to Open The Jammy Dodger?

We love New Braunfels, but feel like it's lacking a good outlet for people that like comics and games.  There is a huge culture of people that are "nerdy", and not enough outlets for them.  We also have a family and feel like there's not enough places in NB that cater to families with kids over the age of 5.  We want you to come hang out with your family without electronics (okay, maybe the occasional selfie is okay :) ).  We love playing with our kids and think you will too!  We think The Jammy Dodger is a place where you can really have fun and interact one on one.

We love the idea of creating a space where people can interact in person, having fun together without breaking the bank.

Why We're Crowdfunding

While we have the down payment, a business plan that has been praised by every bank we've taken it to, and four banks that are working on our application as we speak, opening a cafe costs a LOT of money.  We're putting a lot of our own funds in,  but we also wanted to give the community the opportunity to supplement our funds.  The $10,000 we're raising will help cover getting the spot we have our heart set on (at the Marketplace), renovations, a better espresso machine, two ovens instead of one, or a beer and wine license faster than we'd planned.  It will also help us to ensure we are making The Jammy Dodger the best place it can be.  

Be sure to check out our awesome perks- little ways for us to say "thank you!" for anything you might be able to contribute.

Risks & Challenges

Opening any small business is always risky.  We've been working on the early stages of opening The Jammy Dodger for almost a year and have become accustomed to the fact that things will very seldom go as planned, there were always be one more thing to do and it's important to be flexible.  However, we've also put in a ton of time and research and done everything we can to meet with people who know better than us to make sure we've accounted for all the pieces we need to complete in order to successfully open in the Spring of 2017.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you aren't in a place to contribute right now, doesn't mean you can't help:

Get the word out- share our twitter (@jammydodgercafe), instagram (https://www.instagram.com/thejammydodgercafe/), and facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/jammydodgercafe/)

Check out our website at www.thejammydodger.cafe!

Tell your friends!

Thank you, thank you, thank you!
