Why We're Crowdfunding
While we have the down payment, a business plan that has been praised by every bank we've taken it to, and four banks that are working on our application as we speak, opening a cafe costs a LOT of money.  We're putting a lot of our own funds in,  but we also wanted to give the community the opportunity to supplement our funds.  The $10,000 we're raising will help cover getting the spot we have our heart set on (at the Marketplace), renovations, a better espresso machine, two ovens instead of one, or a beer and wine license faster than we'd planned.  It will also help us to ensure we are making The Jammy Dodger the best place it can be.  
Be sure to check out our awesome perks- little ways for us to say "thank you!" for anything you might be able to contribute.
Risks & Challenges
Opening any small business is always risky.  We've been working on the early stages of opening The Jammy Dodger for almost a year and have become accustomed to the fact that things will very seldom go as planned, there were always be one more thing to do and it's important to be flexible.  However, we've also put in a ton of time and research and done everything we can to meet with people who know better than us to make sure we've accounted for all the pieces we need to complete in order to successfully open in the Spring of 2017.
Other Ways You Can Help
Just because you aren't in a place to contribute right now, doesn't mean you can't help:
Get the word out- share our twitter (@jammydodgercafe), instagram (https://www.instagram.com/thejammydodgercafe/), and facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/jammydodgercafe/)
Check out our website at www.thejammydodger.cafe!
Tell your friends!
Thank you, thank you, thank you!

story:
Update #1

THE FINAL HOURS:  A LAST-MINUTE EXTRA PERK FOR ALL CONTRIBUTORS TO THIS CAMPAIGN IS NOW AVAILABLE  

SIX HOURS LEFT and I'm adding one major new perk for contributors to my campaign -- ALL who have backed my business "re-startup" are entitled to receive a 10% discount on all regular price purchases of single and double scoops of ice cream and sorbet, but only when you wear or show your Henry Brown's lapel pin!!

I want to show you, my backers, how much I appreciate you! 

That's 10% off!! That applies all year long, from January to December 2017. Lapel pins will be available for pickup when the shop reopens in mid-late January.  It didn't take long for 2017 to start looking like a better year already, eh???  ;-) 

Update #2

Since I didn't reach my fundraising goal of $12K Indiegogo won't continue to accept contributions through the campaign page... that said, my fundraising efforts need to continue, so please feel free to contact me directly re: post-campaign contributions either here through the messaging function, or email me: karen AT henrybrowns DOT com

Thanks and have a great day!  :-) 

***

 Short Summary

Photo by Benjamin Washington Photography

I’m Karen Burson. Ed Wong is one of my oldest, dearest friends.  Together we opened Henry Brown’s Small Batch Ice Cream in July, 2015!   We've been delighted to be part of a group of vendors at the Hamilton Farmers' Market's REAL FOOD COURT.  We're known for creating an energetic new prepared food environment.  Vendors throughout The Market are a big part of the excitement, too!!

We've been astonished by and grateful for how many loyal customers we've gained in our time there.  It has been (at times) exhausting, yet it has always been both exciting and incredibly gratifying.  Visit our website to learn more about the company:  www.henrybrowns.com

Staying with Henry Brown’s feels right.  Some of you may know of me because of my work as a project manager and community-builder, promoting local, sustainable food while creating tangible new links between all kinds of food communities across our city – connections made through my six years of non-profit work at Environment Hamilton’s Hamilton Eat Local.  I love local food.

 

What I Need & What You Get

 

WHAT I NEED:  My business partner is moving his share of the business to Toronto, which means I’m starting my ice cream business from scratch.  As of today, I’m seeking the funds to do so here on Indiegogo because I need to raise $12k by December 31, 2016.  That’s all it’s going to take to fund my start up!  Or should I say “re-startup”?

I need to rebuild my shop from the ground up: I'll need whisks and bowls and a new cash register.  To start my first batches I'll need the milk and cream and the organic Fair Trade raw sugar and chocolate that make our product so special.  I will need a stock of ice cream cups, cones, napkins and more in time for our opening day.  I'll need to rent and buy freezer equipment as well as purchase four new Breville ice cream making machines, a refrigerator, an induction burner and other kitchen appliances.  Shelving will be required and supplies will be needed to make repairs made to the existing kitchen cupboards, too.  I'll need to keep the bills paid and the rent covered right from the start.  I'll need a portion of the funds for my salary.  It’s a long list of bare minimum items!  As before, I will source them as much as possible from places like The Re-Store and independent local businesses wherever possible, to make good use of cash resources.  These are just some of the items that are necessary to re-start Henry Brown's.

WHAT YOU GET:  Folks who contribute to my campaign will be supporting a sustainable, locally based food business and in return they will reap some fine rewards.

Perks range from a little lapel pin and a subscription to our new monthly newsletter to an in-home "Ice Cream Party at Your Place".  You can choose a perk that includes an invitation to "Henry's Big Ice Cream Party" in February 2017 (a downtown location, TBA).  One donation level makes you a member of my new "Quarterly Quart Club" and another level can makes you a member of my monthly "CSI: Community Supported Ice Cream" Program -- details below. There's a perk for every budget and every level of engagement.  You can enjoy the rewards yourself or they can be great holiday gifts for the Henry Brown's fans in your life!

(WHAT ABOUT THAT "CSI" THING… ?)

My CSI program is inspired by the "CSA" programs that have become increasingly popular in recent years.  It’s my attempt at a nod at one of the coolest things in sustainable local food access and development: the CSA (which stands for Community Supported Agriculture) is a way to support food growers/farmers by purchasing a share of the farm's annual output at the start of the growing season -- and reaping the rewards of your support by getting shares of the food grown at harvest time.  Cool, eh?

The "Henry Brown's Community Supported Ice Cream (CSI)" program is designed to help get Henry Brown's on solid ground financially, and it only makes sense to thank you for that support with "shares" in the form of scoops, pints and quarts of my fresh, small batch ice creams and sorbets.

If you do select one of the CSI Perks then just contact us at info@henrybrowns.com to place your order at least 5-7 days ahead of your ideal pickup date.  Make sure that your order is confirmed as being ready before you come to pick it up – you will be notified however you prefer: phone or email.

 

The Impact

 

Over the six years that I worked for Hamilton Eat Local people everywhere were telling me how much they value local food, especially food that is made with care, by hand, with high quality ingredients.  In my time at Henry Brown's, I keep hearing the same things from my customers: how much they truly appreciate the great ingredients and understand that what goes in and what stays out is important to them and to their families.

Our customers have talked about going out of their way to find foods made with ingredients that are authentic, made with handmade care, and above all, foods that don't just taste real -- Hamiltonians want foods that are real.  They've expressed the importance of supporting local food producers with their wallets.

The word about Henry Brown's has certainly spread by word of mouth, social media, bloggers and the business press.  We've had visitors who have travelled from Toronto and from Markham just to taste our products!  And at least one food critic wrote in a blog post that there is nothing like Henry Brown's to be found in Toronto.  Yes, we're still blushing over that one: http://www.dinemagazine.ca/2016/11/hamilton-renaissance/

 

Risks & Challenges

 

As with any new business, there are some potential hurdles.  The first is continuing to increase sales year to year to ensure the long-term sustainability of the business.  The other challenging aspect of the location is the cyclical nature of the business... some months revenue is scarce, while in other months the cash is as free-flowing as the ice cream.  Understanding these cycles and adjusting operations to work through them takes patience and adaptability.  A small business like this one can definitely be described as agile!  If business gets so busy that the four new machines can't keep up with production, fundraising to step up to a commercial machine would be the next step. 

I'm confident that with my years of experience with establishing and managing city-wide food projects such as Rural Routes Farm Bus Tours and the Hamilton Good Food Box (an affordable local produce purchasing program with depots right across the city), I will be able to continue to keep Henry Brown's up and running downtown.  I will have to make a few changes (with financial sustainability in mind) but what you will always find at Henry Brown's is great tasting locally made ice creams and sorbets in a range of flavours created to delight you.

If this crowd-funding effort fails to reach its goal of raising $12k, I have other plans in place to make up the shortfall and to adapt my business plan as needed.  Henry Brown's will still be around!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If a financial contribution to our campaign isn't possible for you at this time, there are still some important ways that you can help:

1) Get the word out!  Tell people you know in conversation and on social media about our campaign -- chances are that someone you know will want to help.  

2) Use Indiegogo's range of easy social media tools for sharing the news!

3) Whenever you can, vote with your dollars -- stop by for an ice cream, whether it's a mini scoop or a pint to share with friends and family.

4) Follow us on Instagram for updates, great pics and more: https://www.instagram.com/henrybrowns/

You can support local food systems in these easy (yet powerful) ways.  

Thank you so much,

*karen b

story:
Short Summary

We are a family (American husband, Japanese wife, and two kids) that live in the countryside of Japan, just outside of Tokyo. We have been working on a project to renovate a 150 year old farmhouse into a farm-to-table with Japanese chefs that cater locally grown organic food, and a bed and breakfast for people from around the world.

Since after the 3-11 Tohoku earthquake in Japan, we have become more aware of what we eat and how we spend our time. We moved out to the countryside that's close enough from Tokyo to experiment what life would be like in the countryside.

We realized that there is an abundance of nature, experience, and organically and locally grown food that would be amazing for the rest of the world as well to enjoy. That's when we had the idea to renovate an old farmhouse nearby, so we can create a place for people to stay, enjoy, eat, and experience what we love about this place.

This three-storied farmhouse is a gem of a place with a huge cellar is like none you have ever seen. However, once we started the renovation we realized that the house was in a bad condition, rotting from the foundation. Initially we thought it only needed some face-lifting, but as it turned out, a major construction and rebuilding from the ground up was necessary to make it presentable and usable.  It has extended our timeline and also made us go way over budget. This is why we have set up a campaign to share the project with the rest of the world and to ask for some support to complete the project. 


What We Need & What You Get

The most expensive part of the housebuild, at least in Japan, has been the money needed to pay the carpenters. We spent well over 20,000USD for the 5 carpenters that came to help us since February 2015. We were originally going to ask for help in funding a part of this, but since the video was shot, due to our delayed timeline we had to move quickly to make the place "usable".  However, it is still not complete and we still need help - with the bathhouse, the deck, the 2.5th floor, the pizza oven. This is where we would like to ask for your help.

Here is a breakdown of the estimated costs of the remaining work:

Traditional Japanese Bathhouse: Hot water for the sink and a shelf, and the outdoor bath structure needs to be completed, alongside a cover/wall/shrubs all around it for privacy. (estimated cost: 350,000 yen) 

Deck:  We took down the old deck that was rotting away and we would like to build a new relaxing space. (estimated cost: 300,000 yen)

2.5th floor: As the farmhouse was used for silk production, there is a 2.5th floor with a lower ceiling that is kind of a "hideout". New flooring and woodwork needs to be done to make it usable. (estimated cost: 250,000 yen)

Pizza oven: We would like to put this in the yard, built from clay, bricks, etc. (estimated cost: 60,000 yen)

Garden: We plan to apply concepts of permaculture design into a beautiful garden. (estimated cost: 40,000 yen)

If we luckily exceed our goal, we will invest that extra money for other projects we also have in mind, such as to make a rocket stove near the entrance, and for cleaning up the cellar to make it more usable.

We intend to provide unique perks - we would of course like to giveaway some complimentary stay at the beautiful lodge (note: valid for one year, subject to availability/occupancy), but on top of that, we want to give away one-of-a-kind experience, as that is our thing!  We will provide perks such as:  chicken tour (we have been raising free-range chickens since 2012) + lunch using the fresh eggs you pick up, organic farm tour + lunch using the seasonal vegetables that you pick,  woodcarving workshops with craftsmen who made some of the furniture for the house+ lunch, pizza oven workshop + pizza for lunch, rocket stove workshop + lunch cooked on that oven, etc.

Even if we don't reach our entire goal, we still plan to provide you with the perks that you have signed up for.


The Impact

The farm-to-table concept is still very new to Japan, although we know that it is getting quite popular and well-known in other parts of the world, especially in places like Hawaii and some parts of the U.S.  Japanese countryside has SO much to offer - locally grown organic food + amazing Chefs and nature to name a few. Let's make it more well known so you and others can experience them and enjoy them!
Also, we are not new to running lodging in Japan,  as we have been running 2 apartments and a house on AirBnB for vacation travels since 2014. You can rest assured we know what we are doing, and that we are  committed to making it as successful as it can be. That is why we are here today.

Risks & Challenges

We had many obstacles along the way.  Like I said earlier, the house was in a much worse state than we initially imagined, costing a lot more to fix than initially intended.  Not only that, because the house has a traditional frame and structure, we had to hire special carpenters who had skills to work with a house like this, and they were not easy to find, and pricier than others. But as a result, we were able to aim for a very unique and beautiful style and design.

Also, since the house is not in Tokyo and is a bit in the countryside, we need to  get continuous PR and have enough guests come stay and enjoy the place, so we can keep the place running for many people to enjoy, for many years to come.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many ways that you can be a part of the project and we would appreciate it tremendously. Even if you just can't contribute right now, if you could help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign, that would mean a lot to us. Apparently there is a Indiegogo share tools, and you can use that, or just share what we have on our FB page.

Thank you for reading it all and many, many  thanks for your interest!

story:
Hello there... welcome! We are a group of Boomer Women who have come together to re-define aging... would you like to help us?

We belong to a stage in a woman's life that has never before existed in the traditional "maiden/mother/crone" stages of a woman's life. Not ready to be a Crone yet? well, with all due respect, neither are we!

In our little lifetime 3 major events have changed 10,000 years of women's history with regard to the stages of a woman's life:

  • the invention of "The Pill "...  This allowed us the unprecedented gift of 'Choice'. For the first time in women's history, we - as a generation - were able to decide if/how/and when we chose to start (& equally important, when to stop) our families... leading to longer, healthier lives.

couple this with...

  • the ongoing spirit of the Women's Movement... which precipitated many much needed family law revisions to the legal system, allowing women to choose to live on their own with guaranteed financial security from the recognition of their marital contribution. 

and lastly...

  • the sheer numbers of baby boomer women (40 million - conservative estimate)... have been affecting our society since the day we were born - from the need for more hospitals, schools, & housing - to now changing the nature of retirement facilities... even the very nature of retirement itself!

All combined have set the stage so that somewhere between the "mother" and the "crone" our generation has become a whole new ballgame... a whole new stage of healthier, more financially stable, mature women ... just not ready to take on the mantle of the "Crone" yet.

But what should this new stage of a woman's life be called? I was out walking with a 72 year old friend of mine when she said "well we are women of wisdom, we should know what to call ourselves" ... and the penny dropped! ...of course,  we'll call ourselves WOWs  (Women Of Wisdom) and in this new stage of a woman's life we'll be known as the WOW FACTOR! 

We are building a tasteful, informative, interactive, easy-to-navigate website. It will be called BoomerWomenAreUnique.com and you can preview it here. We want it to deal with issues pertaining to us and cover the body/mind/heart/& soul. I learned how to use HTML to set things up and the other women chose areas of expertise we call 'corners' (for example, in the 'Alkaline Corner' in the Body section...  AlkaGal presents her favorite tried & true alkaline food recipes to help keep your system on the alkaline side, along with information on what exactly we mean by "alkaline" and why it's important to our bodies... while in the 'Fantasy Corner' DivaVonFiFi   will keep you titillated with her stories, ranging from romantic to smokin' hot... and in the Mind section, in the 'Advertisers Listen Up' corner PattyPeeve gives everyone a chance to rag-on about what irritates us the most with advertising today... from using 40 yr old models trying to show us the wonders of a skincare product,  to us convincing hair care manufacturers to put a giant "S" & "C" on their shampoo& conditioner
bottles so we can use them in the shower without our glasses... and so on. We currently have 16 specific corners and plans for expanding those are underway. TAKE A PEEK HERE AT WHAT'S IN STORE FOR YOU...

A big part of our site is the ability for our members to share with us your wisdom, your outlooks, your expectations, your challenges, your very special individual ways of being in the world. We believe that we ourselves and we, our planet, can move forward to a healthier, wonderful future. ...AND...we at Boomer Women wholeheartedly believe we will best achieve this through the sharing of ourselves and the joining of our positive energies. And we make it easy... our brilliant programmer, TecnoGal, has coded pre-formatted, large, easy to use windows on each page... for you to share yourself with us... and all you have to do is type your heart out! 

So...we are well on our way, so much so that we have put together a preview level for you to see (peek above... or view our screen-shots in the Gallery)...but we need a little help to come down the home stretch and flesh out our members level. Our remaining expenses are graphic design, research, additional programming to make the site function on all mobile devices, additional software, and dedicated hosting servers. We sincerely hope to reach our goal, but ANY monies we raise will go directly to these. We have designed our perks with you in mind, since they are ones we ourselves would want! 

Won't you help us bring forward the change to 10,000 years of women's history? With our generation... the Boomer Women's generation... there will henceforth always be 4 stages to a woman's life... Maiden, Mother, WOW, & Crone!

Care to Join? Just choose either a 50% off an annual membership, or a 40% off a lifetime membership... right here on our Indiegogo perks!


Other Ways You Can Help??

Some people just can't contribute, and we totally understand... but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • You can do so by using the Indiegogo share tools!
Each of us is sending this to about thirty people. If each of those 30 send it to only ten more (30 x 10 = 300) ... and those 300 send it to only ten more (300 x 10 = 3,000) ... and so on, by the time the message reaches the sixth generation of people, we will have reached over THREE MILLION consumers!

I'll bet you didn't think that you and us... together... had that much potential, did you? Acting together we can make a huge difference. If this makes sense to you, please pass this message on.

Love and eternal gratitude... the WOWs!

there... welcome! We are a group of Boomer Women who have come together to
re-define aging... would you like to help us?
We belong
to a stage in a woman's life that has never before existed in
the traditional "maiden/mother/crone" stages of a woman's life. Not ready to be a Crone yet? well, with all
due respect, neither are we!

In our little lifetime 3 major events have changed 10,000 years of women's
history with regard to the stages of a woman's life:


the invention of "The
     Pill "...  This allowed us the unprecedented gift of 'Choice'.
     For the first time in women's history, we - as a generation - were
     able to decide if/how/and when we chose to start (& equally
     important, when to stop) our families... leading to longer,
     healthier lives.


couple this with...


the ongoing
     spirit of the Women's Movement... which precipitated many much needed family law revisions
     to the legal system, allowing women to choose to live on their own
     with guaranteed financial security from the recognition
     of their marital contribution. 

and
lastly...

the sheer numbers of baby
     boomer women (40 million - conservative estimate)... have been affecting
     our society since the day we were born - from the need for more hospitals,
     schools, & housing - to now changing the nature of retirement facilities...
     even the very nature of retirement itself!

story:
The original campaign has ended - but we are continuing to raise funds through our new Indiegogo Campaign - The Footbridge Project-2


Please click on the link to go directly to the new campaign

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-footbrid...

Sight of the Original Footbridge
Help support Crossnore’s efforts to rebuild their historic landmark!

Rachel Deal is spearheading the town of Crossnore's efforts, with the help of Crossnore Community Enhancement (a non-profit), to raise private funds to rebuild the town's landmark - the footbridge over Hwy 221.

Rachel Dellinger Deal is the niece of Mary Martin Sloop, founder of the Crossnore School. It was Mary Martin Sloop who was responsible for having the first wooden footbridge put up over Hwy 221 in the 1930's. That bridge was replaced in the 1950s and stood until an overloaded logging truck ran into the bridge in the 1990s.

Mary Martin Sloop built the original bridge so that the townsfolk and the children of the Crossnore School would have a safe way to cross over the highway. Many people have fond memories of seeing the children walk hand-in-hand, two-by-two down the road and over the bridge. There are memories of lazy Sundays sitting on the bridge watching the world go by, making wishes under the Archway, proposals were made and newlyweds posed for wedding pictures. The bridge was an integral part of this small community’s day-to-day life.

The Stone Archway
 

Rachel was instrumental in reclaiming that second bridge, a bridge she walked daily in her youth, and it now sits over a creek in the town helping to connect the walking trails.

Bridge of Memories in its new home over Crossnore Creek

It is one of Rachel Deal's dreams to see the footbridge replaced over Hwy 221, a bridge that would provide safe passage over the highway, allowing the children of the Crossnore School, the community, as well as visitors the pleasure of walking to and from town on the trail system. Rebuilding the bridge will also preserve a local landmark and the scenic beauty of the area surrounding the small town of Crossnore.

For this campaign we are looking to raise $75,000.00 to get us started. The initial round of funding will cover the planning stages of the bridge – the survey and site plans,  engineering geotech studies,  civil engineering  for the encroachment over Hwy 221 and the final working architectural drawings of the headwalls and staircases.

Over the coming year we will need to raise $300,000.00 to complete the project. Your donation will help to make the footbridge a reality – letting Rachel Deal and the townspeople of Crossnore and the surrounding counties know that dreams really can come true!

Rachel Deal has a long history of making dreams come true. She devotes her time to volunteerism, working with the animal shelter she helped found, working with seniors, women, churches, in education, and medical care. 


Rachel Deal featured in a short video by the 12x12 initiative Spring 2015

Rachel has been awarded at least eleven major state or area awards for her volunteer work. She has twice been Avery county Woman of the Year and was named a Citizen of the Century at the Avery County Centennial Celebration.  In 2012 Rachel was presented the Order of the Long Leaf Pine, one of the most prestigious awards presented by the Governor of North Carolina and considered the state’s highest civilian honor.

Rachel Deal receiving State Order of the Long Leaf Pine 

We know that not every one who reads this will be able to contribute financially – but you can still contribute by helping us spread the word – talk about the campaign, tell your friends and co-workers share on Social Media – together we can do this!

story:
Short Summary

If you watched our video, you see who we are. You might be wondering why are we reaching out? Our Undergraduate Student Government at Arizona State University decided not to fund the run this year. We count on them every year and this year, we were not funded by them. Put simply, we need your help. Badly. 

Who are we? We are a group of passionate individuals with a specific goal of success in mind. Together we make up a small, yet powerful and motivated team; Wendi Arnold - President, Mat Sherman - Media Director, Nick Bobrowitz - Productions Director and Rayne Foster - Public Relations Director.

What does saving this event entail? It means getting enough funding to put on the event next spring, and potentially an event during the fall semester, without USG's financial support. 

To fill that void, we are asking for your support. Will you support us?

What We Need & What You Get

We need $15,000...That's on the low end too. It sounds like a lot of money so we will be as transparent as we can with you:

  • Security, barricades, and fencing ($5,000 ) - To ensure that this is a safe event, we need to have an influx of security there (Pro Em). Thousands of students come and we want to make it as safe as possible. 
  • Food - ($5,000) People need to eat. Although the core of this event is charity, people are going to want to chow down on some Raising Canes after the run or before the run to prepare. 
  • Production (%5,000) - A core part of this event is the entertainment. We are are a charity event but the students who come also expect a production to be put on, or else many wouldn't come and donate in the first place.  
So you know, this is flexible funding so if we don't hit $15,000 we get a huge percentage taken off from how much you donated. The reason we did this is because we are a registered 501(c) organization and flexible funding was the only option that indiegogo gave. 

The Impact

This event has produced 44,000 pounds of clothes thus far. That is an average of over six thousand a year. By donating to save the run, you are contributing to an event that will likely result in over 6,000 pounds of clothes for our charities. Who are our charities?
  • Camp Swift - https://www.campswift.org/
  • Andre House - http://andrehouse.org/
  • Goodwill - https://www.goodwillaz.org/
Research them, learn to love them like we love them. You aren't just investing in the run. You are investing in these charities.

Risks & Challenges

There are people that want us to fail. There are people that want to defund us. There are people that want our run to fall to the ground and never to rise again. 
However, the event could be too big for the staff at the moment to plan which means we will just have to recruit more staff. If you are interested in helping out with this event and being apart of our incredible team, please fill out our staff application.
www.docs.google.com/forms/d/1Mo3jSRFRkVAWJDJUmU...

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't donate, no worries at all! You can help by liking and sharing our stuff on social media OR by joining our staff of incredible individuals, passionate to help this event continue!
www.facebook.com/asubbrun
www.twitter.com/asubbrun
http://asubbrun.org/

Invest in us. Invest in the future of the run.

story:
A.L.I.V.E. Christian Center (Church of God 7th Day)

We're an 18-year old, non-profit/501(c)(3) Christian Ministry that endeavors to obey the teachings & commands of Jesus Christ. Our Savior clearly instructed that His followers are to "Do unto others, as we would have them do unto us." And even more importantly... He commanded that we love others (care for, help, support) as we would for ourselves!  Jesus also stated in Matthew 25:40 that "Inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these my brethren, ye have done it unto me." We take all of His words very seriously and we try to serve our community in a consistent and meaningful manner:

  • FREE FOOD VIA OUR FOOD PANTRY                                                                      (Free Food Distributed Tuesdays & Thursdays)
  • FREE CLOTHING MINISTRY
  • SHORT-TERM HOUSING ASSISTANCE
  • PERIODIC MEDICAL & DENTAL MISSIONS
  •  WEEKLY NURSING HOME BIBLE STUDIES 
  • SICK & SHUT-IN VISITATIONS
  • MARRIAGE & GRIEF COUNSELING
  • HOMELESS & BATTERED WOMEN BANQUETS 
  • WEEKLY SABBATH WORSHIP SERVICES
  • ONLINE VIDEO BIBLE STUDIES
  • TELECONFERENCE PRAYER LINE
  • COMMUNITY GOSPEL CONCERTS
  • EVANGELISTIC & MINISTERIAL TRAINING
  • EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS TRAINING
  • (TBA) AUDIO & VIDEO PRODUCTION TRAINING FOR AT-RISK YOUTH 

However, as a Christian Sabbath-keeping ministry, we've always been small in number compared to mainstream denominations. Please know that we love & fellowship with numerous Sunday congregations. And since we hold our worship services on Saturdays, for years we've rented our Church on Sundays to wonderful Sunday Churches. It has been the only way we could afford to remain in our current building, that we've invested so much in construction and design. 


But what distinguishes us from our Brothers & Sisters that regard Sunday as their day of worship, is that we believe that all of the Ten  Commandments are to still be obeyed, 

Including the 4th Commandment:

(Exodus 20: 8-11) "Remember the Sabbath day, to keep it holy. Six days shalt thou labor, and do all thy work: But the seventh day is the Sabbath of the Lord thy God: in it thou shalt not do any work, thou, nor thy son, nor thy daughter, thy manservant, nor thy maidservant, nor thy cattle, nor thy stranger that is within thy gates: For in six days the Lord made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that in them is, and rested the seventh day: wherefore the Lord blessed the Sabbath day, and hallowed it." 

(Deuteronomy 5: 12-14)                                                                              Keep the Sabbath day to sanctify it, as the Lord thy God hath commanded thee. Six days thou shalt labor, and do all thy work: But the seventh day is the Sabbath of the Lord thy God. 

But herein lies our problem. We honor the 7th Day & worship on Saturdays, whereas most well-known Churches worship on the 1st Day, Sundays. So unless some type of miraculous Sabbath Day revival occurs, we'll never remotely resemble a mega-church. But Yahweh has done glorious things with our small but committed flock. We've always been a hardworking congregation, but having less than 40 actively committed members is taking a toll on the necessary finances needed to maintain our ministry.

WE NEED YOUR HELP! We provide vital physical & spiritual services to our community and we even have a viable outreach throughout Jamaica. We also oversee a small group of Churches in India. Your tax-deductible contributions will help keep The Alive Christian Center... ALIVE!

We promise to use your charitable gifts wisely. Our full-time Pastor is Dr. Anthony Blackwood. He does not drive an extravagant car nor does he live in a mansion on a hill. As a matter of fact, due to our lack of funds, he has not been able to receive even a modest salary on a regular basis for the last 2 years! But he has remained a faithful shepherd of God's flock since day one.

Your generous gift will not only allow us to maintain our outreach ministries, but will also help us with even the most basic of needs. To be honest, it's been all we can do to keep our Church's rent paid. Not to mention, that our electric bill has been as high as $800 in one month!

That we've gotten this far these 18 years, is only by the grace of God. We've made it through a flood, a few deaths of well-loved members, and even the Great Recession! But now we find ourselves at a crossroad. We're seasoned enough to know that our Heavenly Father always makes a way for His people. But we covet your prayers and we pray that you'll consider being a blessing to  our humble work, here in the Atlanta metro area. 

Please view our video above to get just a taste of our commitment to Jesus and to our community. We think you'll agree that with ministries like Alive Christian Center, the world is a better place!

MAY GOD CONTINUE TO RICHLY BLESS YOU  
FOR YOUR KINDNESS TOWARD US & THOSE WE SERVE!

Including the 4th Commandment:


(Exodus 20: 8-11) "Remember the Sabbath day, to keep it holy. Six days shalt thou labor, and do all thy work: But the seventh day is the Sabbath of the Lord thy God: in it thou shalt not do any work, thou, nor thy son, nor thy daughter, thy manservant, nor thy maidservant, nor thy cattle, nor thy stranger that is within thy gates: For in six days the Lord made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that in them is, and rested the seventh day: wherefore the Lord blessed the Sabbath day, and hallowed it." 


(Deuteronomy 5: 12-14)                                                                              Keep the Sabbath day to sanctify it, as the Lord thy God hath commanded thee. Six days thou shalt labor, and do all thy work: But the seventh day is the Sabbath of the Lord thy God. 
But herein lies our problem. We honor the 7th Day & worship on Saturdays, whereas most well-known Churches worship on the 1st Day, Sundays. So unless some type of miraculous Sabbath Day revival occurs, we'll never remotely resemble a mega-church. But Yahweh has done glorious things with our small but committed flock. We've always been a hardworking congregation, but having less than 40 actively committed members is taking a toll on the necessary finances needed to maintain our ministry.
WE NEED YOUR HELP! We provide vital physical & spiritual services to our community and we even have a viable outreach throughout Jamaica. We  also oversee a small group of Churches in India. Your tax-deductible     contributions will help keep The Alive Christian Center... ALIVE!


We promise to use your charitable gifts wisely. Our full-time Pastor is Dr. Anthony Blackwood. He does not drive an extravagant car nor does he live in a mansion on a hill. As a matter of fact, due to our lack of funds, he has not been able to receive even a modest salary on a regular basis for the last 2 years! But he has remained a faithful shepherd of God's flock since day one.
Your generous gift will not only allow us to maintain our outreach ministries, but will also help us with even the most basic of needs. To be honest, it's been all we can do to keep our Church's rent paid. Not to mention, that our electric bill has been as high as $800 in one month!
That we've gotten this far these 18 years, is only by the grace of God. We've made it through a flood, a few deaths of well-loved members, and even the Great Recession! But now we find ourselves at a crossroad. We're seasoned enough to know that our Heavenly Father always makes a way for His people. But we covet your prayers and we pray that you'll consider being a blessing to  our humble work, here in the Atlanta metro area. 
Please view our video above to get just a taste of our commitment to Jesus and to our community. We think you'll agree that with ministries like Alive Christian Center, the world is a better place!
MAY GOD CONTINUE TO RICHLY BLESS YOU  FOR YOUR KINDNESS TOWARD US & THOSE WE SERVE!

story:
For every shirt sold we donate to our nonprofit partners working to end sexual violence and empower women world wide.

WHY THIS SHIRT EXISTS:

My name is Natalia.  I am a woman and a feminist activist, and a lot of the time I feel powerless.  One of the main places I feel powerless is in public spaces.  In a public space, I become a public space: I am everyone’s property. 

The prevalence of street harassment points to the much larger issue of the acceptance of rape culture, to the tune of 293,000 victims of sexual assault a year in the United States (RAINN).

I created this shirt because it is the shirt I want to wear.  I want to wear it because the act of doing so is scary and hard and that is exactly the reason it needs to be done.

So yes, this is just a shirt. And sometimes a shirt is just a shirt.  But sometimes a shirt is a statement, and when enough people make enough statements, they create a movement.

The Still Not Asking For It Project is about creating a recognizable community of activists who wear petitions disguised as t-shirts.  It is about starting the conversation on rape culture at every street you walk down, and taking an active role in changing the status quo of how the bully, the bullied, and the bystander respond to street harassment. The goal?  For enough people to wear this shirt that its message becomes culturally irrelevant, obvious and passé. 

For this shirt NOT TO NEED TO EXIST. 

For every shirt sold, The Still Not Asking For It Project donates to our women based nonprofit partners working to end sexual violence. That means money for rape crisis hotlines, women's health organizations, and pedal-to-the-metal feminist groups doing grassroots organizing.  Have a favorite nonprofit that fits the bill? Go to "Perks" and make them one of our nonprofit partners to receive funding. 


WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET:

The Still Not Asking For It Project is a for-good social enterprise that is launching on Indiegogo, so our main "Perks" will be pre-sales of the shirt, which will be available in both men and women's sizes. After ordering your shirt keep an eye out for an email survey from us requesting your sizing information!

For $20 (plus $6 for U.S. shipping or plus $10 International shipping) you will receive a Still Not Asking For It shirt. 

For $10 you can get a bumper a Still Not Asking For It bumper stick with the same design as the shirt. 

For $75 you can choose your favorite nonprofit to become a partner and receive $25% of our total profit, an amount that will grow as we do over the years.   

Whether or not we reach our goal, all pre-orders will be fufilled!


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

Any help in getting the word out is HUGELY appreciated! This can look like posting a link of The Still Not Asking For It Project campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, or other social media, or sending an email out to friends and family.  Are you a blogger or do you know any bloggers or journalists who would be interested in covering us? Let them know about our campaign or get in contact with us at WWW.TheStillNotAskingForItProject <at> gmail.com. 


Thanks for all your help and support!


XOXO

Your Friendly Feminist,

Natalia S.

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone, I'm Luke, a senior at Singapore Management University (SMU) and a Singaporean who is as saddened as most of us about the unfortunate passing of the Singaporean victims at Mount Kinabalu. 

If you have not read of it, you may do so with the latest updates:

http://www.straitstimes.com/news/asia/south-east-asia/story/sabah-quake-more-remains-be-airlifted-mount-kinabalu-20150607 

http://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/singapore/sabah-quake-update-8/1898114.html 

I'm a strong believer in the what crowdfunding can accomplish, especially when it comes to campaigns that have a widespread impact on us Singaporeans. Crowdfunding has been tested and validated in Community Projects, and I trust that this campaign will be no different. Thus, my main purpose for creating this campaign is to raise funds, which will be distributed to the various families that have lost their loved ones. 

I have little idea what impact these funds will have for the families, but I do know that it will be a form of condolence from us Singaporeans to fellow Singaporeans. Through your contributions, you can be part of a movement that leverages technology to hopefully provide financial relief to those who are undergoing pain. We have seen the news, we have been burdened by the pictures and now is the time to act on it.

What We Need & What You Get

Given that the number of victims are still unconfirmed, I hope to raise any amount, which will all be distributed to the various families via the school or MOE based on the needs analysis conducted by the two organizations. Even though this campaign may not reach the goal (hopefully it does), the amount will still be distributed to the families in the most appropriate manner.

This is purely non-profit, I have no desire of keeping anything for myself. 

Since this campaign is for Singaporeans, by Singaporeans, I have nothing spectacular to give. However, in exchange for the donations that are pulled together, I will be compiling a list of names of donors, which will be posted on the Facebook page that I have created and hopefully other websites (if we can get the traction). 

The Impact

To be honest, I do not wish to make any claims about the size of the impact that your donations will have. However, I firmly believe that any form of financial aid in the form of a token of condolence will be of help to the various families that are affected. 

Though the donation you make may seem small, I know that it will have a lasting impact on not only those who receive, but also on Singaporeans as a whole. Singaporeans have done contributed to successful campaigns in the past, now it's a great time to do it again.

Risks & Challenges

All foreseen risks have been mitigated. Both transferring of funds and distribution channels have been established, following the contact made with Madam Cham, the point of contact for any contribution raising.

1. Transferring of Funds (Indiegogo or Direct Transfer)
As the school staff are heavily stretched from their current operations, the two week period for collection is appropriate, since it will end after all operational dust has settled.

We have been told that there will be a Central Fund set up by the school to collate all contributions together. Thus, we will direct the contributions straight into this designated account instead of the Proposed OCBC account as initially planned. For those who wish to direct transfers, it was suggested to hold off till next Sunday, when the campaign ends, to transfer it straight to the designated account.

2. Distribution of Funds
There has been a concern from people about the method of distribution of the funds. As discussed with Madam Cham, the school is working closely with MOE and the families to have a clear idea of the needs for each family. Thus, once the funds are collected in the Central Fund, it will be distributed by the school/MOE to the families in the most appropriate manner.

To increase the transparency of this campaign, I plan on providing updates via this campaign site and Facebook Page as regularly as possible. Moreover, my contact details will be below if you wish on contacting me with enquiries directly.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to provide any form of contribution, there's nothing to worry about! You can help by furthering the crowd effect by sharing this campaign to those you know via Facebook, Linkedin, Twitter, etc. 

A couple of clicks can go a long way.

If you would like to provide a larger sum of donation and wish to give a cheque, please contact me via my email! I will include the amount in the update when received!

Regards,

Luke Cheang

Senior, Singapore Management University

lukecjl@gmail.com

story:
PROBLEM AND SOLUTION
  • It is estimated that some 40 percent of middle class Americans will not have saved enough money to retire at age 65. 
  •  One reason is that there are few investment opportunities available that return much more than 9% over a long period of time.  With an inflation rate of 3%, the real return is not enough to grow a big enough retirement nest egg.
  •  One solution is to make available to the investing community, investment programs that offer much higher returns and with lower risk.
  • Twenty First Century Investor LLC has a method that has been internally  
    •  audited to have an annualized  return of  23.6%  for the 20 years ending 2013.    This compares to the S&P return of a merger 9,4%.    
  •  The following offers another  demonstration of this method's  capability. A $10,000 investment in 1993 following this method  through the 20 years would have grown to $ 1, 070,000!! 
  • The same amount invested in the S&P 500 would have increased to only $94,00

HOW DOES IT WORK?

  •  We invest only in Fidelity Select sector funds of which there are 40. Each fund represents a sector of the overall market, such as energy, computers and transportation. Each of these funds consists of a number of individual stocks engaged in that particular sector.This feature offers lower risk over investing in an individual stock.
  • We invest in only 5 funds at a time. These are chosen using our unique selection criteria.
  • When a fund fails to meet our criteria, it is sold and replaced with one that does.
  • The turn over rate is small. Over 50% of the funds are held for a year.
  • A periodic emailed newsletter alerts subscribers when to buy and sell funds so that they can align there's with ours,
  • Another example of the method effectiveness. A $10,000 invested in accordance with our porfolio in 1993 would have grown to $1,070,000 by 2013!!
  • A similar investment in the S&P would have increased to only $94,000!
  • Another key feature is that the S&P lost some 30% in 2007 and did not gain that amount back until 2012. Our method gained over 20% during that time.
  • Many who had planned to retire during these years had to delay for several years.

WHAT TO DO

  • As an intrductory offer your can  get a one year subscription to our periodic newsletter for the low price of only $5.00. The regular price is $99.00. So don"t delay. act now and sign up.




 





.

story:
#ITFLUSTARTUP

                                    Marketing Needs - Marketing Solutions

                                   Exciting Innovations - Endless Possibilities

My name is Deb, Founder of IT FLU, a software development and marketing company with a solid reputation of excellence, an exciting portfolio of cutting-edge digital services, and plans for a powerful global reach. We started with one satisfied customer, and five years later that number has risen in thousand. Customers come to us because we offer world-class marketing solutions; because we are unequivocally the best in our field; because we can be trusted; and because we simply get things done!

We have both the credentials and the experience. I hold an MBA in International Business – a degree that has given me a valuable perspective on international business strategies. My team is small, but it is a powerhouse of top-notch IT experts, and we hope to add additional staff of equal caliber. Our energy, exuberance and combined talents fuel our signature creativity, and our customer service cannot be compared. We are based in India, but our clients have the following distribution: 85% of our clients come from the United States, 10% come from other countries, and 5% come from India.

We are extremely proud that we are now in a position to become a key player in the global market, but we need your help to give us the financial boost to catapult us into the big league. Our campaign goal is$300,000. We will use this sum to increase our staff; expand our current infrastructure to accommodate global outreach; and launch new office in USA, innovative software.

All donations, of any size, are appreciated. As Kahlil Gibran says, “In one drop of water are found all the secrets of all the oceans,” In the same way, your donation defines you as a member of a collaboration of visionary donors who have faith in the entrepreneurial spirit, hard work, and determination – who have faith in us!

If we are successful in our campaign, we will be able to introduce our core services to major new markets, including Europe, Canada, South America, South Africa, Australia and Asia.

These services include, but are not limited to:

  • Digital Marketing
  • Content Development and Maintenance
  • Customized Web Design and Development
  • Graphics Design for Impactful Branding
  • iOS and Android Development
  • Games and Apps Marketing Strategies
  • Outsourcing (Hire a Professional) Options

We are confident that we will reach our goal – but if not, we will still expand globally. It may be at a slightly slower pace, but nothing will stop us! Your faith in us will be justified. The future is ours!

IT FLU approaches marketing with integrity, with honesty, and with common sense. We don’t just market blindly for the sake of marketing. We respect consumers, and we are sensitive to their needs and preferences. We know that excellence, honesty, great navigational tools, impeccable content and exceptional web design sets us apart from our competitors. A strong segment of our Internet marketing staff are past Google employees. We KNOW the business!

We also know that there are risks and challenges with any venture. We understand this, and we are not afraid to address potential setbacks. At times, we are concerned about whether IT FLU will be able to “spread its wings” as widely as we expect and whether our software designs will help our clients achieve their goals as quickly as we anticipate. But at those times, our team stands tall and steps forward because we know that our vision is clear; our business plan is solid; we’ve tested the market; we’ve developed international business relationships; and we have the will AND the expertise to succeed.

The impact that we will make on the global market will be powerful. We intend to set an international benchmark for quality service, product development excellence, and professional integrity. We will initiate and model the very best practices in the field.

IT FLU is also a company with a heart. As we expand our business, we pledge to contribute 20% of our proceeds to support programs that address world hunger and the plight of children who have been orphaned because of global conflict. We chose these two causes because we believe that, as world citizens, it is our responsibility to do so.

WHAT ABOUT INCENTIVES?

We offer great incentives to Indiegogo users who invest in our dream. For a donation of $50 or above, we will:

  • Offer a partnership opportunity whereby a donor will be able to become a free affiliate with an office under the name of IT FLU. The arrangement is simple. The donor connects with a new client; we deliver the services; the donor receives a generous portion of the sales.
  • Provide a sampling of the best examples of YouTube and Pinterest ads and a training video that demonstrates how to run an online campaign. This type of YouTube and Pinterest ads training video is valued between $1,000 and $1,500, but our donors receive it a deeply discounted price of $50. The ad training video is designed to help small and mid-size businesses generate more interest in their products and services and/or sell more products on Amazon.
  • Provide a training video with instructions on how to increase the number of Facebook “likes,” Twitter “followers,” Pinterest “likes,” and “posts.”

In addition, our team is creating a fun collection of appreciation “surprises” for donors who make a donation of $5!

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS ABOUT OUR COMPANY AND SERVICES

We grew quickly for 5 reasons:

  • We have a talented and experienced staff
  • We work closely with Google
  • We implemented every one of the marketing techniques that we now include in our services
  • We have never compromised on excellence
  • Our customers are always our priority. Their satisfaction drives our success.

How do I know which service to choose?

We offer a complementary in-depth analysis of your needs before making a service recommendation. We have several standard packages that you can build on or we can create a “custom package” just for you.

What kind of graphic design work do you do?

We do print design (flyers, posters, banners, brochures, catalogues, stationery branding, corporate identity, and logo design); web design(websites, mobile sites, banners, and social media banners); and App design (iOS and Android). Design is one of the most important elements of marketing. If a constituent cannot relate to a design – no matter how elegant or catchy – it is useless. We make sure that all visuals are striking, impactful, relevant and inspire action.

What do you mean by “outsourcing (hire a professional)” options?

Outsourcing was never this easy.  Today we have taken our outsourcing division it to a new level. Whether you need a developer, a designer, or more customized support, we can find the right professional for you. We have numerous benefits to offer, like the option of hiring employees already on our pay roll, which can reduce stress for small to mid-size companies. Before we outsource employees, we conduct a complete “requirement analysis” to make sure that the match is perfect, and our clients then have the freedom to interact with candidate directly for best results.

FAQs ABOUT CONTRIBUTING FUNDS

Can I make a donation even if I don’t have a credit card?

Yes – please email us at contact@itflu.com for information about how you can donate through PayPal or a wire transfer.

How should I donate if I want to make a large donation?

The best way to make a large donation ($10k or more) is via wire transfer. This significantly reduces fees and ensures that more of your funds reach IT FLU. Please email us at contact@itflu.com for instructions.

Why we help you and spend money in your dream?

We are honest people and working every second to fulfil our dreams. This funding will help many people; even our perks will boost your small, large business or selling goods an online. So this is the win-win opportunity to fulfil each other dream.

Why don’t you use your own money?

We are simple people and our bank account has few thousands and it wouldn't be possible for us to open our new office in USA and hire new staff. In this campaigning we are providing great perks which has taken many years for us to develop those marketing skills which are available in few bucks only.

What if I have a donor advised fund?

Donor advised funds can wire funds to our Indiegogo campaign.  Please email us at contact@itflu.com for instructions.

We understand that some of you would like to contribute, but do not have the financial resources to do so. However, you can still help us by spreading the word through your social media contacts and by taking advantage of the Indiegogo sharing tools. Please also share our campaigning with #ITFLUSTARTUP.

These are exciting times! With sites like Indiegogo, entrepreneurs are given opportunities that they have never been given before. Some of the entrepreneurs are new, and their businesses have not been tested. IT FLU has been in business for 5 years – maybe not as mature as some companies – but we have landed strong, and our positive growth pattern has validated the wisdom of our company strategies. With your help IT FLU will fulfil its destiny as a trusted, worldwide marketing resource. Our future is in your hands!

Please help us to make this happen!
story_txt:

Solutions 
                                   Exciting Innovations - Endless Possibilities

started with one satisfied customer, and five years later that number has risen
in thousand. Customers come to us because we offer world-class marketing
solutions; because we are unequivocally the best in our field; because we can
be trusted; and because we simply get things done! 
We have both the credentials and the experience. I hold an
MBA in International Business – a degree that has given me a valuable
perspective on international business strategies. My team is small, but it is a
powerhouse of top-notch IT experts, and we hope to add additional staff of
equal caliber. Our energy, exuberance and combined talents fuel our signature
creativity, and our customer service cannot be compared. We are based in India,
but our clients have the following distribution: 85% of our clients come from
the United States, 10% come from other countries, and 5% come from India. 
We are extremely proud that we are now
in a position to become a key player in the global market, but we need your help to give us the
financial boost to catapult us into the big league. Our campaign goal is$300,000. We will use this sum to
increase our staff; expand our current infrastructure to accommodate global
outreach; and launch new office in USA, innovative software. 

All donations, of any size, are appreciated.
As Kahlil Gibran says, “In one drop of water are found all the secrets of all
the oceans,” In the same way, your donation defines you as a member of a collaboration
of visionary donors who have faith in the entrepreneurial spirit, hard work,
and determination – who have faith in us!
If
we are successful in our campaign, we will be able to introduce our core
services to major new markets, including Europe, Canada, South America, South
Africa, Australia and Asia.

These services include,
but are not limited to:


Digital
Marketing


Content
Development and Maintenance


Customized
Web Design and Development


Graphics
Design for Impactful Branding


iOS
and Android Development


Games
and Apps Marketing Strategies


Outsourcing
(Hire a Professional) Options



We are confident that we will reach
our goal – but if not, we will still
expand globally. It may be at a slightly slower pace, but nothing will stop us!
Your faith in us will be justified. The future is ours!
IT FLU approaches marketing with integrity,
with honesty, and with common sense. We don’t just market blindly for the
sake of marketing. We respect consumers, and we are sensitive to their needs
and preferences. We know that excellence, honesty, great navigational tools, impeccable
content and exceptional web design sets us apart from our competitors. A strong
segment of our Internet marketing staff are past Google employees. We KNOW the business!
We also know that there are risks and challenges with any
venture. We understand this, and we are not afraid to address potential
setbacks. At times, we are concerned about whether IT FLU will be able to “spread its wings” as widely as we expect
and whether our software designs will help our clients achieve their goals as
quickly as we anticipate. But at those times, our team stands tall and steps
forward because we know that our vision is clear; our business plan is solid;
we’ve tested the market; we’ve developed international business relationships;
and we have the will AND the
expertise to succeed.

The impact that we will make on the global market will be powerful.
We intend to set an international benchmark for quality service, product
development excellence, and professional integrity. We will initiate and model
the very best practices in the field. 

IT FLU is also a company with a heart. As
we expand our business, we pledge to contribute 20% of our proceeds to support
programs that address world hunger and the plight of children who have been
orphaned because of global conflict. We chose these two causes because we
believe that, as world citizens, it is our responsibility to do so.
WHAT ABOUT INCENTIVES?
We offer great incentives to
Indiegogo users who invest in our dream. For a donation of $50 or above, we will:


Offer a partnership opportunity
whereby a donor will be able to become a free affiliate with an office under
the name of IT FLU. The arrangement
is simple. The donor connects with a new client; we deliver the services; the donor
receives a generous portion of the sales.


Provide a sampling of the best
examples of YouTube and Pinterest ads and a training video that demonstrates
how to run an online campaign. This type of YouTube and Pinterest ads training
video is valued between $1,000 and $1,500, but our donors receive it a deeply
discounted price of $50. The ad training video is designed to help small and
mid-size businesses generate more interest in their products and services
and/or sell more products on Amazon.


Provide a training video with
instructions on how to increase the number of Facebook “likes,” Twitter
“followers,” Pinterest “likes,” and “posts.”


In addition, our team is creating a fun collection of
appreciation “surprises” for donors who make a donation of $5!

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS ABOUT OUR COMPANY AND SERVICES
We grew quickly for 5 reasons:


We have a talented and experienced
staff


We work closely with Google


We implemented every one of the
marketing techniques that we now include in our services


We have never compromised on
excellence


Our customers are always our
priority. Their satisfaction drives our success.



How do I know which service to choose?
We offer a complementary in-depth analysis of your needs
before making a service recommendation. We have several standard packages that
you can build on or we can create a “custom package” just for you.
What kind of graphic design work do you do?
We do print design
(flyers, posters, banners, brochures, catalogues, stationery branding,
corporate identity, and logo design); web
design(websites, mobile sites, banners, and social media banners); and App design (iOS and Android). Design is
one of the most important elements of marketing. If a constituent cannot relate
to a design – no matter how elegant or catchy – it is useless. We make sure
that all visuals are striking, impactful, relevant and inspire action.
What do you mean by “outsourcing (hire a professional)”
options?
Outsourcing was never this easy.  Today we have taken our outsourcing division
it to a new level. Whether you need a developer, a designer, or more customized
support, we can find the right professional for you. We have numerous benefits to offer, like the option of hiring employees already
on our pay roll, which can reduce stress for small to mid-size companies. Before
we outsource employees, we conduct a complete “requirement analysis” to make
sure that the match is perfect, and our clients then have the freedom to
interact with candidate directly for best results.
FAQs ABOUT CONTRIBUTING FUNDS
Can I make a donation even if I
don’t have a credit card?
Yes – please email us at contact@itflu.com
for information about how you can donate through PayPal or a wire
transfer.
How should I donate if I want to
make a large donation?
The best way to make a large donation ($10k or more) is via
wire transfer. This significantly reduces fees and ensures that more of your
funds reach IT FLU. Please email us
at contact@itflu.com for instructions. 
Why we help you and spend money in
your dream?
We are honest people and working every second to fulfil our
dreams. This funding will help many people; even our perks will boost your
small, large business or selling goods an online. So this is the win-win
opportunity to fulfil each other dream.
Why don’t you use your own money?
We are simple people and our bank account has few thousands
and it wouldn't be possible for us to open our new office in USA and hire new
staff. In this campaigning we are providing great perks which has taken many years
for us to develop those marketing skills which are available in few bucks only.
What if I have a donor advised fund?
Donor advised funds can wire funds to our Indiegogo
campaign.  Please email us at contact@itflu.com for
instructions. 
We understand that some of you would like to contribute, but
do not have the financial resources to do so. However, you can still help us by
spreading the word through your social media contacts and by taking advantage
of the Indiegogo sharing tools. Please also share our campaigning with #ITFLUSTARTUP.
These are exciting times! With sites
like Indiegogo, entrepreneurs are given opportunities that they have never been
given before. Some of the entrepreneurs are new, and their businesses have not
been tested. IT FLU has been in
business for 5 years – maybe not as mature as some companies – but we have landed
strong, and our positive growth pattern has validated the wisdom of our company
strategies. With your help IT FLU
will fulfil its destiny as a trusted, worldwide marketing resource. Our future
is in your hands!
Please help us to make this happen!

story:
Short Summary

Encircle Films works to inspire action. To encourage a revolution in consciousness through education, instigating action, showing films, inviting guest speakers to facilitate audience discussion and supporting the making of educational media. The discussions following our films are led by local activists, filmmakers and subject experts who can inform and educate people to make wiser choices. Our desire is to encourage action to change our world in a more positive way — starting within our own community of Eugene.

Here are a couple of our Guest Speakers and Daring Documentaries:

Norman Solomon, Author, Journalist, Columnist in the film Shadows of Liberty

Doug Fine, Author, Activist, Investigative Journalist  supporting the film Bringing It Home




What We Need & What You Get

We're asking for contributions to Encircle Films' annual budget for:

  • Screening licenses to show the films
  • Promotion and outreach to the community
  • Help with expenses for speakers
  • More screenings to educate and reach a broader audience
  • Supporting independent filmmakers 
What you get:
  • A different viewpoint from what is shown by the mainstream media
  • Ideas for ways you can be involved and make a difference locally and beyond
  • An opportunity to engage in a meaningful dialogue
  • In-depth knowledge from speakers and filmmakers promoting action
  • A more informed way to make decisions about your daily choices in life that impact the environment, healthcare, government, food, human and animal rights and social justice

The Impact

Encircle Films is a politically active organization. 

  • We show up to rallies and speak out
  • We sign petitions and share our opinions
  • We distribute "Act Up" flyers to let people know how to be local activists
  • We volunteer our time and our money for issues that matter
  • We advocate for change in people's hearts and minds

Risks & Challenges

We see little risk or downside in contributing to this campaign. Even if we don't achieve our goal of raising $20,000 we will still use whatever funds we receive to continue our mission.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Here are some other ways you can get involved:

  • Spread the word about our campaign - use the Indiegogo share tools
  • Sign up to be on our mailing list at www.encirclefilms.org
  • Join us on social media: Twitter, Facebook and Google+
  • Come to the films and engage in the discussions
  • Let us know what topics you'd like to see in the future
  • Support locally-owned theaters that screen independent films
  • Attend film festivals
  • Start your own daring documentary series

story:
Short Summary 

The fundamental aim of my campaign is to reach out to those truly in need, the very poor who have find it difficult to meet the basic daily needs of food and shelter, or who would like to send their children to school or start a business.  

My campaign is premised on the assumption that only the poor really know how best to meet their daily needs - government-imposed aid programs often miss the their targets by assuming they know best how to serve the poor and setting up programs that often fail.  For example, piglets and rice seeds are distributed to mountaintop farms in Vietnam - yet are only suitable for the hotter lowlands, which are now experiencing record hot temperatures. 

Your contribution will be immediate - there will be none of the bureaucracy and red-tape associated with other programs.  As a former development banker for the U.S. Government, I helped fund American companies operating in developing countries and creating employment.  These companies were in the manufacturing, tourism, and telecommunications sectors, and helped create thousands of jobs locally.  Yet it often took 12-24 months before people could start working, given the necessary government bureaucratic procedures, approvals and paperwork in both the U.S. and host countries.  Often the kind of jobs created were short-term construction jobs or went to middle-class workers with higher education. 

What We Need & What You Get

I am seeking $10,000 as initial seed capital, from your contributions of $20, $50 or $100, with your donation going to deserving women throughout Southeast Asia to meet their basic needs.  One Vietnamese colleague and I travel (without pay) to the poorest areas of Cambodia, Laos and Vietnam seeking those truly in need.  By giving $50 (equivalent in local currency) to those who are deserving, we hope (with your help) to make a real difference in their daily life or even help them start a new life.  Your impact will be immediate -  each donor will receive a picture of the recipient they helped fund along with a description of how their funds will be spent. 

The Impact

Our guess is that, in the majority of cases, your contribution will make a real difference in the lives of these poor women, who will make sensible choices by buying foods in bulk, enrolling their children in school, purchasing medicine, making repairs to a leaky roof, or starting a new business such as a fish farm or raising chickens.  

Risks & Challenges

One potential challenge involves selecting the appropriate recipient who we can trust will put your funds to good use.  We will choose the candidate - the candidate will not choose us, to avoid supporting those who are scammers and don't truly need assistance.  The campaign will identify the truly needy with the help of my local Vietnamese colleague, who has worked for different charities and will be able to quickly assess a recipient's needs by interviewing each and looking at their various living conditions.  I will assist him in the assessment, having lived and worked in developing countries such as China, Brazil and Vietnam for over 10 years.

We plan on travelling by bus and motorbike to remote poor areas in Cambodia, Laos and Vietnam in search of those in need, and will employ translators as necessary to determine what each recipient would do with an amount between $50 before handing over the funds.  By giving the money directly to women heads of households, we hope to avoid any delays caused by middlemen and trust the funds will be spent wisely and not squandered.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you choose not to donate $20, $50 or $100, please help spread the word to your friends and colleagues - if successful with this initial run, we hope to grow this campaign into something much larger to reach more of the deserving poor!

story: It is my dream to not only own my own business and be my own boss, but to contribute to the art community and to creativity. Art moves the soul, sparks emotions, supports causes and has a huge impact on our societies. It is a passion of mine and I hope to be able to support other artist's passions but also to spread the passion. The funds will be used to open my art store. I will sell art supplies, have studio space available for rent, and provide space to sell local arts' work.

story:
Allow us to be the streetlamp through the fog, and create a new tea experience for you.

Bring London to Los Angeles

Anglophiles unite! Would you like to walk past the red double decker bus, through the TARDIS and into The Paradise? Enter a shoppe of wonders and glorious trinkets that emulate your heart's desire while the tunes of Morrissey waft through the lavender scented air? Don Holmes' greatcoat, find your way over the fine British foods section, and maybe have a cuppa tea while you watch The Young Ones in our tea room? Make new friends while attending our Whovian viewing events, Downtown Abbey tea parties, geeky game nights and Sherlockian murder mystery tours?

The brains behind this wonderful endeavor run Clockwork Couture, The World's Fynest Steampunk Clothier and Clockwork Cature, animal rescue.  It was their love for England that got them into the fantasy world of Neo-Victoriana and what constantly called back to them.  We want to continue to rescue another 300+ animals and support local artists in this new medium.

So WHAT are you crazy blokes doing?
First of all, no fake accents. No, just no. Instead we are giving those unable to make the trip across the lily pond a taste of life in a British store. Expect the nice girl with the mohawk and Doc Martens to show you the Ab Fab dvd's, advise you on which confectionaries go best with the loose leaf tea you've chosen, and why The Cure is the best band, ever*. Special order items no one else has, and obscurities you thought no one else knew about. Home to expatriates and locals alike, we won't just be an import store but rather a community center in which to share your love of Britania while getting your geek on.

The risk? What risk?

Okay, sure, retail always has some inherent risk, but we have run a successful retail store for 6 years, and other endeavors before that. We are more than confident that we have secured suppliers and craftsmen to fulfill every Whovian's wish, Sherlock fans secret desire and IT Crowd afficionados itinerary.

Some of the stretch goals include:

30K overfunded, we buy a red double decker bus, straight from the UK and when not parked for all to take pictures with, will be used to host murder mystery road trips, silly tours around LA, and able to be rented for your own adventures.


2k overfunded, a big, red, phone booth (yeah, I know, we have a blue one, but how fun would a RED ONE be?????)

How will you use the $12,000?

Buying a kiln and molds so we can produce our very own, exclusive hand-painted tea pots, cups and saucers, a programmable tea machine to handle all temperatures and steep times, plus a new sign for all to see, and a new entertainment system to host geeky sing along nights, Broadchurch viewing parties and Saturday morning cartoons, a street lamp for the end of the driveway, and theme out the space to make it a fully immersive experience.
Wish to help another way?

Can't spare a dollar? Thank you so much for reading:

  • If you can share this, please do. We will need every set of eyeballs we can get.






*not all staff may agree with this statement, but you may be shown the door if you don't. -Donna (kidding)**

**not kidding+

+Donna actually believes that, but she won't kick you out for it. She may however look at you funny.

And Bob's your uncle.

story:
Hi everyone!

As most of you know, Emilie & I met in Nepal 2 years ago and did an amazing motorbike tour across the country, discovering numerous villages, visiting beautiful monuments and meeting lots of great people along the way. 

We recently found out that our friend Shanti's house was completely destroyed during the last earthquake and we want to help her rebuild a home for her family.

The cost to rebuild Shanti's home is only USD 2,500-, which means if each of our Facebook friends donated USD 2,5-, Shanti would have a new home. That's less than the price of a cup of coffee...

Please help us make a real difference in one family's life. In exchange, we will keep in close contact with Shanti to ensure the funds are being put to good use and we will post photos of her new home.

This campaign is only 10 days long so please donate what you can now.

Thanks everyone!

Namasté,

Flo & Emilie
