story:
Short Summary

Namaste,

My name is Sujan Maharjan, I am 25 years old, and I am a chef, and studying business management.

With the help of my partner, Natalie I am starting this fundraiser in hopes to raise money to rebuild a safe temporary home for my family and help rebuild safe homes in local villages after the devastating earthquake. After the earthquake, my grandparents village was completely destroyed, and my home town of Patan is in tremendous disrepair. My home is filled with cracks, and my parents are sleeping in tents outside. The government has not taken any initiative to check our home, or others in our community for the safety of our buildings. Because the government is not helping us, me and my community are responsible for our recovery.

With your donation, I will be able to support my family in rebuilding a temporary home on our farmland, rebuild my grandparents village, and also help buy supplies to build shelters for families who were left without homes.

Your money will be going directly to my family, whom are very active members of our community. My Father, Babu Kaji Maharjan is the head of the Boy Scouts of Patan, leading groups to help cleanup our community, and travel to more remote villages to rebuild, and create shelters. Me and my friends have also been building temporary shelters made of bamboo and tin roofing, which cost approximately $200 USD to make. Through our teamwork, my friends and I have successfully constructed over 20 shelters in local villages called Kavre, Khokona, and Bungamati.


Every day there are so many challenges and health risks including poor water sanitation, terrible air quality, and building safety. The monsoon season is here, which is a blessing for farming rice, our staple crop, but poses problems for many without a shelters. We have to act now!


For those that can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help. Please, spread the word about our fundraiser to all your friends and family. Through teamwork, everything is possible. Me and my family and community have so much hope and energy to rebuild, we just need your support.


With love, peace, and gratitude. 


Thank you for your time.

With the help of my partner, Natalie I am starting this fundraiser in hopes to raise money to rebuild a safe temporary home for my family and help rebuild safe homes in local villages after the devastating earthquake. After the earthquake, my grandparents village was completely destroyed, and my home town of Patan is in tremendous disrepair. My home is filled with cracks, and my parents are sleeping in tents outside. The government has not taken any initiative to check our home, or others in our community for the safety of our buildings. Because the government is not helping us, me and my community are responsible for our recovery.

With your donation, I will be able to support my family in rebuilding a temporary home on our farmland, rebuild my grandparents village, and also help buy supplies to build shelters for families who were left without homes.

Your money will be going directly to my family, whom are very active members of our community. My Father, Babu Kaji Maharjan is the head of the Boy Scouts of Patan, leading groups to help cleanup our community, and travel to more remote villages to rebuild, and create shelters. Me and my friends have also been building temporary shelters made of bamboo and tin roofing, which cost approximately $200 USD to make. Through our teamwork, my friends and I have successfully constructed over 20 shelters in local villages called Kavre, Khokona, and Bungamati.
 
Every day there are so many challenges and health risks including poor water sanitation, terrible air quality, and building safety. The monsoon season is here, which is a blessing for farming rice, our staple crop, but poses problems for many without a shelters. We have to act now!

For those that can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help. Please, spread the word about our fundraiser to all your friends and family. Through teamwork, everything is possible. Me and my family and community have so much hope and energy to rebuild, we just need your support.

With love, peace, and gratitude. 

Thank you for your time.

story:
HOW DOES IT WORK


It is as easy as pressing the "ON "switch. The generator will do the rest and in seconds it will be generating enough power to supply demand   electricity to your home or business.  Run your heater, AC, Hot Water, Appliances,  Interior & Exterior Lighting all on electricity.

The difference in our technology is that  it  will generate electricity without the need for an outside fuel source in order to run. This  patent pending technology  is an  on-site, off-grid power supply system that generates electricity and  transmits it to  a panel box which is then distributed  throughout the circuitry.


SAVE MONEY ON YOUR ELECTRIC BILL

The  annual  electricity consumption of an average US home is estimated  to be between 10,000kwh - 15,000kwh . Based on the current  national average utility rate of  $0.18/kwh , the average homeowner is paying the electric utility company about $2,100  - $2,700  per year. Not considering any future utility rate increases, in 25-30 years the average homeowner will have spent  $67,500 - $81,000 on  electricity.

The STG 15KW  will supply 15,000 KILOWATTS of ON DEMAND ELECTRICITY 24/7, 365 days/year for 25-30 years and provides long term savings of 40-60%.

Custom built  generator unit  pricing will depend on  unit name plate capacity which will be determined by the electricity consumption of your home or business. 

EASY INSTALLATION

Whether it is supplying power to your home or business, the STG generator is easy to install.  It can  be integrated  to your electric  utility service panel box to supply  emergency backup power,  or it can be wired to a separate off-grid panel box  to supply power  24/7, 365 day /year.  Your choice.  Either way, we strongly recommend  any installation  be done by a licensed electrician. 

Given that the STG is compact in size, expels no emissions and does not produce heat,  it is totally safe to operate in any  indoor environment - households, manufacturing facilities, apartment buildings, shopping centers, distribution centers.

REMOTE ACCESS

The STG smart technology feature means you always have control of  your power supply from virtually anywhere.
Turn the power off or on , select what equipment or household appliances you want to supply power to, track your power usage , track your  monthly savings,  monitor performance or  simply  program to run as standby power in case of an emergency.


A CLEANER ENVIRONMENT


The STG,  a technology that generates clean, low cost electricity 24 hours/day, 365 days/year.

Tired of paying big bucks to electric utility companies that charge high rates and do little to protect us against  the pollutants and  health risks associated with  their  methods of generating power?  We are. That is why we have spent thousands and thousands of dollars developing  a technology that generates clean, safe electricity that places individuals, business owners and communities in charge of their power.

 About US

ADVANCED ENERGY TECHNOLOGY is an Innovation, Development and Commercialization company registered in Delaware, USA. Our headquarters are located near Atlantic City, New Jersey with a satellite office located in Fort Lauderdale, Florida.  

Technology

ADVANCED ENERGY TECHNOLOGY in association with Spintronic, Inc. has been developing this patent-pending, power generating technology for residential and industrial scale applications. The Spintronics Generator (“STG”) is a revolutionary approach in energy conversion; an open system energy cycle of electric currents consisting of electron pairs. The technology of the STG operates as both a motor and generator. It uses the production of an electric current across a conductor moving through a magnetic field (induction) as it organizes and harvests random environmental electrons. It follows both the principles known as kinetic magnetism and the laws of thermodynamics. It works at ambient temperature without destructive radiation,  pollution or heat.  

Why $5,500,000

To the modern world electricity is more than a commodity. It is a necessity  we no longer can do without. It powers our homes, businesses, communication and entertainment devices. It is the fuel to our economic engine. 


Third-world countries depend on modernized nations to assist them with technologies that can provide bare basics such as uncontaminated food  and clean water for survival. Without electricity it would not be possible.

No matter what part of the world, electricity supports our way of life in some way.  

Up to now, we have had limited choices on how our electricity is generated. The choices have been conventional ways such as coal-fired power plants that blow black filthy smoke into the air we breathe day in and day out.

Or nuclear power plants that are disasters just waiting to happen at the slightest human error or act of nature,

Then  we have solar and wind power which are green ways to produce electricity but come with their own set of limitations. Solar panels, for instance, will produce energy only during the day. Wind power relies on a minimum wind speed of at least 11 miles per hour. The cost recovery period for these types of renewables is now longer than ever due to federal and state incentives coming to a halt. Other power generating plants like Hydro power plants, bio-fuel power plants, fuel cell technology all  have  exorbitant construction costs and pass on those costs to the consumer. 

Our technology lowers electricity cost by 40-60% in comparison to other renewable energy technologies and by 70-80% in comparison to to utility supplied power. It is clean, safe, compact and requires little to no maintenance.

Our Mission

We want to bring another choice to the people of the world. One that is clean, affordable and is available directly to and controlled by the consumer. One that can operate in remote parts of the world so everyone has access to electricity, One that can generate power all day long,  year round no matter what the climate,  We want to minimize reliability on depleting fossil fuels, 

reduce green-house gasses that are big contributors of respiratory illness in children and adults. We want to limit our dependency on nuclear power plants and the associated risks.

Our Vision

To be an integral part of an ever growing movement dedicated to improving our deteriorating environment so that one day future generations will look back at us with respect and admiration for the choices we have made.

Summary 

We have the technology, now we need you to help us bring it to the finish line . With your support we can move forward with simplifying our product design  so we can reduce manufacturing costs  and fabricate numerous units for residential & light commercial beta testing.  Our team is eager to finalize the development of this inspiring power generating technology that will forever change the power production industry.  Help us bring clean, affordable electricity to people across the globe in a way up until now not possible. You can make a difference in providing children and adults of all ages with a chance to a better future and the prospect of a cleaner environment.
Take a minute to review our wonderful Perks!!

Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our technology. Please share this  campaign with your family, friends and other contacts!

story:
Who are we?

Island Mountain Spice Company was created by Mike and Jed, two friends that love good food and good times.  It all started when Mike started growing hot peppers, making hot sauces, and creating custom spice blends and rubs for friends and family.

Before long, an idea was born:  Island Mountain Spice Company.

Supermarkets have only a few options, and clerks at supermarkets are not usually trained in many of the products on their shelves.  Few of them know where their spices or herbs come from, when they were bottled or what the medicinal advantages and health benefits are.  

That's when the idea came to Mike; create a store where customers become aware of the product they are purchasing; a store with educated staff that are there to help you, the customer, obtain a better perspective of the product and gain a healthier you. 

Mike contacted longtime friend and herbalist Jed, and pitched the idea of a store with the atmosphere that would match the flavor he wanted to create.   Jed jumped on board and brought his knowledge of the environment and love of nature with him.  Coming from a farm-to-table atmosphere, Jed believed that this business should offer organic herbs and spices, fresh products, and a well-trained and knowledgeable staff.

Reaching our goal will allow us to rent store front and purchase the proper equipment needed to put our products on the shelves. Also the funding will be used to purchase ingredients, containers and professionally done labels.

story:
*English text below.


Si vous aimez l'idée et aimez We-nav, alors aidez nous en:

1: Finançant une partie

2: Envoyant ce lien à vos amis. (@ minimum 3)

3: Aimant notre page Facebook et en nous suivant sur Twitter

4: Nous recherchons également des développeurs, ambassadeurs...contactez nous sur contact@we-nav.com



If you like us, and love the idea, please help us by:

1: Donating.

2: Sending this link to your friends. (@ minimum 3:)

3: Liking our page on Facebook and following us on Twitter 

4: We're looking also for developers, ambassadors... contact us on contact@we-nav.com


Summary                                  Sommaire

                                                                                                                     Envie d'en savoir plus....                                

 En Français

Un concept original et innovant

Une communauté dédié aux sports nautiques

Nos valeurs

A quoi servira la collecte ?

L’équipe

You want to know more... (english text below French one.)

In English

The concept  

The community 

Our values

Where is your money going?

Staff presentation



En Français

Notre vidéo de présentation:



Un concept original et innovant

Nous assistons à la révolution de l’économie du partage, au renouveau des valeurs d’entraide, des relations humaines entre particuliers. Ainsi il est maintenant tout naturel de partager son loft ou une place dans sa voiture

Le bateau et les sports nautiques manquaient à l’appel, nous avons donc créé 

We-nav, une plateforme d’échange unique au monde dans le secteur du nautisme

Imaginez-vous la possibilité de partager des moments d’exception sur un voilier avec les propriétaires comme hôtes, ou bien l’opportunité de partager votre planche à voile avec un touriste australien désireux de tester les vagues bretonnes. Ou tout encore d’aller vous initier au paddle à l’autre bout du monde avec vos nouvelles connaissances qui vous prêterons le matériel et vous montrerons les meilleurs spots locaux ….


Une communauté


We-nav est avant tout une communauté qui regroupe des personnes ayant une envie de partager leur intérêt commun pour les activités de loisirs se pratiquant dans ou sur l’eau: voilier, bateau moteur, catamaran, planche à voile, kite surf, paddle, aviron , canoë, pêche en mer, wakeboard….

Grâce à notre site internet nous mettons en relation des propriétaires de matériel de sport nautique et des utilisateurs voulant faire des activités nautiques afin qu’ils puissent puissent faire au choix :

  • Swap (Echange)
  • Host (Sortie nautique)
  • Rent (Location)

Retrouvez nous sur la plateforme en ligne www.we-nav.com (site en construction)

Ainsi que sur notre page Facebook et compte Twitter


Nos valeurs


L'envie de partager, l'amour du voyage et des sports nautiques,le plaisir de faire partie de cette communauté.


A quoi servira la collecte


Outre le développement de la version 1 de la plateforme internet de 20 000€, nous avons d’important besoin en trésorerie pour lancer notre campagne de promotion via les réseaux sociaux, les liens sponsorisés (Adwords), la presse et la participation aux salons nautiques , compétitions nautiques et aussi pour vous attribuer des WeMiles ou des Goodies.

En plus de nos apports personnels et des financements institutionnels , nous avons besoin au minimum de 20 000€ afin de boucler notre phase de démarrage. Ainsi soyez sûr que vos contributions seront utilisées à bon escient. 

En plus du financement nous avons besoin de faire le buzz autour de notre projet donc n’hésitez pas à en parler autour de vous….

Nous comptons sur vous !!!!


                  

                              


Comment fonctionne les WeMiles: 
Dés l'energistrement de vos équipements en ligne nous vous offrons des WeMiles.Plus vous échangerez vos équipements, plus vous nous parrainerez sur notre futur site, plus vous gagnerez des WeMiles, et plus vous pourrez profiter du site à moindre frais.

L’équipe


L'idée de base est née lorsque Claire et Aurélie ont trouvé une solution amusante pour optimiser le rapport coût bateau / utilisation d'Aurélie. C'est au Startup Weekend qu'elles rencontreront Leo (notre designer) et Sara (notre Responsable communication). Nathalie a ensuite entendu parler du projet et nous a rejoint en tant que responsable gestion administrative et financière.

En détail:

Aurélie alias Lilou  est une passionnée de voyages et de préférence dans les pays où elle peut pratiquer les sports nautiques. Depuis son premier voyage en Australie, elle ne cesse d'utiliser les sites collaboratifs tel que Woofing, AirBnb, LoveHomeSwap, Couchsurfing et bien d'autres. Ne pas partager et échanger est une aberrance pour elle. Avec son bagout dans les achats internationaux et le suivi de projets industriels, il est maintenant temps de se lancer dans une « TransCréation » d’un projet en accord avec ses idées et son mode de vie.

Claire alias Poule, découvre le goût de l’entreprenariat comme on devient accro au chocolat en respirant ses effluves. C’est sa rencontre avec Aurélie qui la plongera dans l’aventure, dans la volonté créatrice avec l’intime conviction qu’elles faisaient parties de ce groupe qui croyait au pouvoir de leur idée. Il est temps désormais de s’engager dans ce projet qui est le fruit d’une réelle motivation en s’appuyant sur ses 7 années d’expériences professionnelles (achat et qualité chez Airbus Groupe)

Sara  alias l’aventurière, après 16 mois de circumnavigation, il est temps de rentrer à terre et de mettre ses acquis de navigatrice et de communicante dans un projet professionnel. Après Paris , Bogota, l’océan Pacifique, elle pose ses valises à Marseille et c’est tout naturellement dans un projet nautique qu’elle s’engage.

Léo alias le brésilien, c'est le Designer de l'équipe, rencontré au start-up week-end de Marseille, en passage avant de remonter à Paris, ce passionné de sport nautique et de design aux nombreux talents ne pouvait passer à coté du projet We-nav.

Nathalie alias Nat a fait ses classes dans l’hôtellerie et aujourd’hui elle manie avec dextérité les chiffres dans un univers international. Elle aussi férue de voyages, elle part vivre 1 an au Canada, où elle attrape le gout de l’aventure. Elle embarque dans cette nouvelle aventure avec la responsabilité d’être garante des finances.


Si vous aimez l'idée et aimez We-nav, alors aidez nous en:


1: Finançant une partie

2: Envoyant ce lien à vos amis. (@ minimum 3)

3: Aimant notre page Facebook et en nous suivant sur Twitter

4: Nous recherchons également des développeurs, ambassadeurs...contactez nous sur contact@we-nav.com


Merci également à Pierre Broca de l’ ateliernab  pour cette magnifique video de We-nav.


Un grand merci à tous. J’espère pouvoir partager très vite avec vous des activités nautiques 

Lilou & L'équipe We-nav



In English


The concept


Somewhere between Airbnb & Courchsurfing, for all water sports activites.

In a world where sharing and trading goods is part of our everyday economy, it seems like the possibilities are endless.

People share apartments, car space, designer dresses, and even plumbing equipment.

But what about water sports? That's where We-nav comes in.

We-nav has been created to be the website where you can SWAP, HOST, or RENT water sports equipment.

Imagine the possibility of being able to travel half-way around the world and do your favorite water sport with a local, for less.

Or, you can benefit by sharing your time and experiences with someone else who wants to enjoy the same sport you love.


The community

We- nav is, above all, a community that brings together people with a desire to share their common interest in water sports activities including: sailing, motor boating , windsurfing , kite surfing , paddle boarding, rowing, canoeing , fishing, wakeboarding , and everything in between. 

Through our website, we connect people wishing to do water sports in a new location with those who have equipment so they can :

  • Swap
  • Host
  • Rent
Join us on our website www.we-nav.com ( site under construction ) or follow us on our Facebook page and Twitter account.


Our Values

We value the desire to share the love of travel and water sports. So be a part of our fun and adventurous community. 

Where is your money going?

Despite our personal funds, bank loans, and other donations, we're still looking for 20,000 € in order to kickstart We-nav.

The funds we raise will go towards launching our website, creating adds, sponsoring, networking and for your WeMiles/Goodies.

In fact, all donations we receive are not-for-profit, and will go directly towards making this dream a reality.

However, this campaign needs more than just monetary support.

We also need you to be our best ambassador, so spread the word! 

Talk to your friends, family, and colleagues, and invite them to be a part of the We-nav community

                 

                                         

                                       

How WeMiles are working:

More you will share your equipments, or you will sponsor us on the futur website, more you will earn WeMiles.  
 

The staff

The idea was born when Claire and Aurélie found a fun solution to optimize Aurélie’s boat cost/use ratio. Then on Startup Weekend they met Leo (our designer) & Sara (our communication manager) later Nathalie heard about the poject and join the team as accounting manager.

If you like us, and love the idea, please help us by:

1: Donating.

2: Sending this link to your friends. (@ minimum 3:)

3: Liking our page on Facebook and following us on Twitter 

4: We're looking also for developers, ambassadors... contact us on contact@we-nav.com

We also thank Pierre Broca to ateliernab  for the great video done for We-nav.

Thank you so much! I hope to share some water sports activities with you soon,

Lilou & the We-nav Team

personnes ayant une envie de partager leur intérêt commun pour les activités de
loisirs se pratiquant dans ou sur l’eau: voilier, bateau moteur, catamaran,
planche à voile, kite surf, paddle, aviron , canoë, pêche en mer, wakeboard….
Grâce à notre site internet nous mettons en relation des
propriétaires de matériel de sport nautique et des utilisateurs voulant faire
des activités nautiques afin qu’ils puissent 
puissent faire au choix :

Swap (Echange)
Host (Sortie nautique)
Rent (Location)

Retrouvez nous sur la plateforme en ligne www.we-nav.com (site
en construction)
Ainsi que sur notre page Facebook et
compte Twitter



Nos valeurs

L'envie de partager, l'amour du voyage et des sports
nautiques,le plaisir de faire partie de cette communauté.

A quoi servira
la collecte

Outre le développement de la version 1 de la plateforme
internet de 20 000€, nous avons d’important besoin en trésorerie pour lancer
notre campagne de promotion via les réseaux sociaux, les liens sponsorisés
(Adwords), la presse et la participation aux salons nautiques , compétitions
nautiques et aussi pour vous attribuer des WeMiles ou des Goodies.
En plus de nos apports personnels et des financements
institutionnels , nous avons besoin au minimum de 20 000€ afin de boucler notre
phase de démarrage. Ainsi soyez sûr que vos contributions seront utilisées à
bon escient. 
En plus du financement nous avons besoin de faire le buzz autour de notre projet donc n’hésitez pas à en
parler autour de vous….
Nous comptons sur vous !!!!

                  
                              


Comment fonctionne les WeMiles: 

Dés l'energistrement de vos équipements en ligne nous vous offrons des WeMiles.Plus vous échangerez vos équipements, plus vous nous parrainerez sur notre futur site, plus vous gagnerez des WeMiles, et plus vous pourrez profiter du site à moindre frais.



L’équipe


L'idée de base est née lorsque Claire et Aurélie ont
trouvé une solution amusante pour optimiser le rapport coût bateau / utilisation d'Aurélie. C'est au Startup Weekend qu'elles rencontreront Leo (notre designer) et Sara (notre Responsable communication). Nathalie a ensuite entendu parler du projet et nous a rejoint en tant que responsable gestion administrative et financière.
En détail:
Aurélie alias Lilou  est une
passionnée de voyages et de préférence dans les pays où elle peut pratiquer les
sports nautiques. Depuis son premier voyage en Australie, elle ne cesse
d'utiliser les sites collaboratifs tel que Woofing, AirBnb, LoveHomeSwap,
Couchsurfing et bien d'autres. Ne pas partager et échanger est une aberrance
pour elle. Avec son bagout dans les achats internationaux et le suivi
de projets industriels, il est maintenant temps de se lancer dans une
« TransCréation » d’un projet en accord avec ses idées et son mode de
vie.
Claire alias Poule, découvre le goût
de l’entreprenariat comme on devient accro au chocolat en respirant ses
effluves. C’est sa rencontre avec Aurélie qui la plongera dans l’aventure,
dans la volonté créatrice avec l’intime conviction qu’elles faisaient
parties de ce groupe qui croyait au pouvoir de leur idée. Il est temps
désormais de s’engager dans ce projet qui est le fruit d’une réelle motivation
en s’appuyant sur ses 7 années d’expériences professionnelles (achat et qualité
chez Airbus Groupe)
Sara  alias l’aventurière, après 16
mois de circumnavigation, il est temps de rentrer à terre et de mettre ses acquis
de navigatrice et de communicante dans un projet professionnel. Après Paris ,
Bogota, l’océan Pacifique, elle pose ses valises à Marseille et c’est tout
naturellement dans un projet nautique qu’elle s’engage.
Léo alias le brésilien, c'est le
Designer de l'équipe, rencontré au start-up week-end de Marseille, en passage
avant de remonter à Paris, ce passionné de sport nautique et
de design aux nombreux talents ne pouvait passer à coté du projet
We-nav.
Nathalie alias Nat a fait ses
classes dans l’hôtellerie et aujourd’hui elle manie avec dextérité les chiffres
dans un univers international. Elle aussi férue de voyages, elle part vivre 1
an au Canada, où elle attrape le gout de l’aventure. Elle embarque dans
cette nouvelle aventure avec la responsabilité d’être garante des finances.



Si vous aimez l'idée et aimez We-nav, alors aidez
nous en:

1: Finançant une partie
2: Envoyant ce lien à vos amis. (@ minimum 3)
3: Aimant notre page Facebook et en nous suivant sur
Twitter
4: Nous recherchons également des développeurs, ambassadeurs...contactez nous sur contact@we-nav.com

Merci
également à Pierre Broca de l’ ateliernab  pour
cette magnifique video de We-nav. 

Un grand merci à tous. J’espère pouvoir partager très vite avec vous des
activités nautiques  
Lilou & L'équipe We-nav


In English

The concept


Somewhere between Airbnb & Courchsurfing, for all water sports activites.
In a world where sharing and trading goods is part of our everyday economy, it seems like the possibilities are endless.
People share apartments, car space, designer dresses, and even plumbing equipment.
But what about water sports? That's where We-nav comes in.
We-nav has been created to be the website where you can SWAP, HOST, or RENT water sports equipment.
Imagine the possibility of being able to travel half-way around the world and do your favorite water sport with a local, for less.
Or, you can benefit by sharing your time and experiences with someone else who wants to enjoy the same sport you love.

The community
We- nav is, above all, a community that brings together people with a desire to share their common interest in water sports activities including: sailing, motor boating , windsurfing , kite surfing , paddle boarding, rowing, canoeing , fishing, wakeboarding , and everything in between. 
Through our website, we connect people wishing to do water sports in a new location with those who have equipment so they can :

Swap
Host
Rent
Join us on our website www.we-nav.com ( site under construction ) or follow us on our Facebook page and Twitter account.
Our Values
We value the desire to share the love of travel and water sports. So be a part of our fun and adventurous community. 
Where is your money going?
Despite our personal funds, bank loans, and other donations, we're still looking for 20,000 € in order to kickstart We-nav.
The funds we raise will go towards launching our website, creating adds, sponsoring, networking and for your WeMiles/Goodies.
In fact, all donations we receive are not-for-profit, and will go directly towards making this dream a reality.
However, this campaign needs more than just monetary support.
We also need you to be our best ambassador, so spread the word! 
Talk to your friends, family, and colleagues, and invite them to be a part of the We-nav community

                 
                                         

                                       
How WeMiles are working:
More you will share your equipments, or you will sponsor us on the futur website, more you will earn WeMiles.   
The staff


The idea was born when Claire and Aurélie found a fun solution to optimize Aurélie’s boat cost/use ratio. Then on Startup Weekend they met Leo (our designer) & Sara (our communication manager) later Nathalie heard about the poject and join the team as accounting manager.

If you like us, and love the idea, please help us by:
1: Donating.
2: Sending this link to your friends. (@ minimum 3:)
3: Liking our page on Facebook and following us on Twitter 
4: We're looking also for developers, ambassadors... contact us on contact@we-nav.com
We also thank Pierre Broca to ateliernab  for the great video done for We-nav.
Thank you so much! I hope to share some water sports activities with you soon,
Lilou & the We-nav Team

story:
What is Qulture Collective?

Qulture Collective is a developing community space, retail shop, cafe, and gallery located in downtown Oakland dedicated to serving the queer community, founded by three queer women. Our mission is to provide a central, devoted space for LGBTQIA folks to network, cultivate creativity, and develop and accomplish entrepreneurial goals.

Co-founders Julia Wolfson, Terry Sok, & Alyah Baker during a queer wedding pop-up shop hosted by A Monique Affair.

The Vision

A place to grab a cup of coffee. Find a spot to get some work done. Browse the shop for a special gift, knowing that you're also supporting a queer artisan. Take a moment to look at the art in the gallery. Come back later for a film screening, open mic, community meeting, or maybe attend a workshop over the weekend. Meet creative folks in the area looking for the same thing. Connect. Expand. Grow. Repeat.

Who is Qulture Collective?

Qulture Collective will bring together artists, entrepreneurs, activists, and visionaries from queer and allied communities. Our vision is to strengthen the vibrant community in Oakland by collectively creating a shared space to build enterprise. This will generate an ongoing cycle of support and jobs that will benefit the community for years to come.

Our cafe will employ queer and allied staff, our retail shop will showcase goods made by queer artisans, and our gallery will feature art by people across the LGBTQIA spectrum from Oakland, the Bay, and beyond.

After regular business hours, Qulture Collective becomes a community gathering space. We will hold in-house events including art openings, happy hours, pop-up shops, film screenings, game nights, and more. The space will furthermore be available for members of the community, from individuals to non-profits and other organizations, to rent out and host their own events in as well.

“We envision a multifaceted workplace and shopping destination that can double as a gathering space, to strengthen the already vibrant community here,” said co-founder Alyah Baker.

Qulture Collective has collaborated with the following orgnizations to date:

  • Queer Fashion Week - groundbreaking new fashion week event
  • A Monique Affair - queer wedding planning services
  • Critical Resistance - movement to end prison industrial complex
  • Culture Fuck - feminist, anti-racist queer open mic
  • Be Steadwell - DC-based signer/songwriter
  • Dyke Central - independent Oakland-based queer dramedy series
  • Get Free (Black Girl Dangerous) - queer & trans youth of color summer program
  • Ari Fitz - Tomboyish style series producer & director

Critical Resistance hosts a community meeting at Qulture Collective

Where is QC & Why?

Qulture Collective is located at 1714 Franklin Street a few steps away from the 19th Street Bart station. We want to create a permanent and visible queer space in the heart of downtown Oakland to keep our presence loud and proud in a city that has come to be known for its high concentration of queer residents and LGBTQIA focused non-profits and organizations. Oakland's vibrant arts and activism culture also makes the town the ideal location for Qulture Collective.

Designer Trunk Show held at Qulture Collective for Oakland's Queer Fashion Week

The Impact

As the social landscape in the Bay Area continues to shift, we are striving to maintain a consistent, dedicated, safe space and platform for queer activity in Oakland.

“As small business owners ourselves, we are especially interested in promoting a cycle of support for queer artists and entrepreneurs,” said co-founder and Oakland native Terry Sok. “We hope that having a space like this will work to grow multiple businesses and livelihoods.”

Access to a safe space with an atmosphere of inclusion, understanding, and belonging is integral to fostering the creative spirit in an unhindered manner. Having a shared space will allow for the diverse and talented queer and allied community to connect, share stories and promote inspiration and growth. Our hope is that Qulture Collective will be a home base for exciting new activity and innovations.

How You Can Help

We've got the lease on this amazing space and have begun building it out, but there's a lot of work left to be done, and that's where we need your help. The biggest factor that we need help with is raising funds to allow us to complete the build out for the cafe, gallery, and the upstairs work spaces. Additional funds are needed to finish furnishing and equipping the space to make it comfortable, accessible, and multifunctional, with increased electrical capacity, sound system, and projector. With your help, together we can shape our vision of what a queer collective of small businesses and dedicated community gathering space can be.

Plans for the cafe buildout at Qulture Collective

Breakdown of Major Buildout Costs: 

Electrical: $9,000

Plumbing: $11,000

Cafe Construction, Equipment, Flooring: $23,000

Furnishing (Cafe, Retail, Work Spaces): $5,000

Additional Equipment (Sound System, Projector, etc.): $2,000

TOTAL: $50,000

The cafe portion of the build out is vital to the success of the space because it will be the primary gathering spot for the community. Furthermore, the cafe will generate a steady flow of revenue to cover daily operational costs and allow us to offer in-house events and space rental to the community at affordable prices. The cafe will also act as a backdrop to the other components of the space, in this case our shared workspaces, gallery, and retail areas. 

When you donate, you'll get to choose from a variety of perks including specialty merchandise and gift cards, VIP access to our events, special deals for hosting your own events in our space, and a chance to have your name on our permanent founders wall!

If we do not reach our goal, our main priority will be to fund the major construction costs first. However, we do have big plans for the space and raising the full amount will enable us to create something truly above and beyond for the queer community in the Oakland and the surrounding Bay Area.

Alyah Baker, Julia Wolfson, & Terry Sok at Oakland Pride 2014, where the idea for Qulture Collective was born

The Founders

Terry, Alyah, and Julia are three queer women who run their own small businesses in downtown Oakland. We have shared vision of a collective small business group that would feature and highlight the Bay Area's queer makers and motivators. This will ultimately create a cycle of of support and strengthen our already vibrant and inspired community of artists and visionaries. We envision a multifaceted workplace and shopping destination that will double as a community center. Over the past year our ideas have taken shape into what has blossomed into Qulture Collective.

Alyah Baker on the runway at Oakland's Queer Fashion Week

Alyah is an entrepreneur, freelance stylist, and classically trained dancer who is used to wearing many creative hats. In 2011, after a 13 year career with GAP Inc, Alyah co-founded Show & Tell Concept Shop, a sustainably minded, community focused boutique in downtown Oakland. Through Show & Tell, Alyah has the privilege of working closely with many prominent artists, organizations, and members of the Queer community to produce events and provide a platform for LGBTQIA groups and individuals. Alyah joins the QC Team as our creative lead.  

Terry Sok, far right, works behind-the-scenes magic for some of the Bay Area's largest queer women's events

Terry is deeply rooted in Oakland, having been born and raised here. She has the pride for Oakland that only a true Oakland grown native would have. Terry has a background in business management and event planning. She has worked in the corporate world with a Fortune 500 company managing day to day operations and has also worked as a logistics director for some of the largest queer events in the Bay Area, and joins the QC team as our operations guru. She strongly believes in the importance of creating safe places for the community as familiar spaces have started to disappear.

Julia Wolfson helps design signage for a new retail shop in downtown Oakland

Julia has a background as a freelance artist, translator, marketing developer, and bookkeeper, with experience in the restaurant and food production industry. She has provided financial and marketing guidance for several budding businesses in the Bay Area, and joins the QC Team as head of the numbers. She hopes to create a balanced and mutually beneficial environment for those involved in all realms of the QC community, and especially looks forward to helping put together exhibitions and art events in the gallery.

Julia Wolfson & Terry Sok with the Sok Family in front of their restaurant, Garden House

Terry & Julia also own The Garden House, a local establishment that has been a fixture in Downtown Oakland for a quarter of a century. Together they have developed the small, unassuming space of the old lunch spot in a way that supports other small and up and coming businesses, artists, and musicians by hosting pop-ups and free community events, while doing their part to preserve Oakland's soul and neighborhood love by keeping this small family business alive, thriving, and focused on staying true to the longtime residents and workers that have supported the restaurant for many years.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to donate financially, but do feel passionate about this project, you can help us out by spreading the word! Share the campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram or send a link out to friends and family via email or let people know by word of mouth. Every little bit helps! Indiegogo has some helpful sharing tools that makes it easy for you to get the word out. We are also always looking for volunteers and welcome you to reach out to us to find other ways to help!

story:
Cliquez ici pour le français! Versión Idioma Español

                                                         

We are a communal committee born through the initiative of our local bilingual school (Intellego Learning Center) in Santiago Sacatepéquez, Guatemala. Our sole purpose is to find a permanent solution to repairing and improving an important public road in our local community. This road is essential for many people in our community since it is needed to access our local school attended by over 700 students, a vegetable exportation cooperative, which gathers vegetables from local farmers and different neighborhoods thus supporting the local economy, and the houses of local residences. We are the "Comité Pro-Camino" formed by parents, neighbors and the authorities of Intellego Learning Center Santiago Sacatepéquez. We dearly hope you can support our community cause.


The road we would like to build in Santiago Sacatepequez, Guatemala is imperative to the local community. Its current condition is no more than a dirt road full of potholes, which presents many hazards to people both walking and driving on it, including transport difficulties for both local residents, children and authorities alike. For many years residents have pleaded with municipal authorities to fix this road, but due to the towns other needs, a severe lack of money and several other reasons, the improvement of this road has been indefinitely delayed and is now long overdue. This year our community took the initiative to organize itself through this committee and has now started collecting money to fix the road. Parents from the school, neighbors and local businesses are all doing their best to help out. However we are still lacking the crucial US$20,000 needed to finish its construction.




Santiago Sacatepéquez is a small community in the highlands of Guatemala. Founded in 1540 the population of this town is around 30,000, consisting of predominantly indigenous people from the Kaqchikel ethnic group working in agriculture and commerce. Poverty is around 49% and illiteracy 25%. Some years ago this town was considered to be a rural area, but metropolitan growth has extended these areas making our town of Santiago a semi-rural one, in dire need of development and the building of further infrastructure to support our growing community. Moreover our town lacks the municipal funds needed from the local government to construct a main communal road, so we have been forced to raise money in every way we can to improve the condition of one of our communities major transport routes. Even though we are going through this tough situation, Santiago has several tourist attractions including the Giant Kite Festival, where its people unite and organize themselves to celebrate this local community event each year.

For the mainly indigenous people in our community, the Giant Kite Festival, celebrated on November 1st every year is a great way to work together celebrating an important part of our culture and strengthening communal bonds. This festival has been celebrated for some 116 years and families participating design and create giant multicolored kites (see picture above). Kites can range from 15cms to 15mts long, and some years they have created kites as big as 20mts in diameter. The colorful kites are made in communal spaces or in municipal schools and  are flown on the municipal cemetery grounds to the enjoyment of both locals and foreigners alike.


                          

                           

     

With your kind support we will be able to improve a major road in our small town, bringing renewed positive energy and opportunities to its people. The new road would improve the lives of thousands of local residents and businesses breathing economic life back into our community!

               

To fund the construction of this road we needed to raise around $90,000 and with the support of businesses and local residents we have managed to collect US$70,000. This is a great accomplishment for our small community, however we are still lacking the essential US$20,000 needed to pay the construction company which has already started the job. As you may know Guatemala is a third world country, which has been facing trying circumstances not only in the political realm but also economically. Many local issues that we believe our essential to the working of our local community have now been put on the back burner by our authorities and are on the verge of collapsing. Therefore, the construction of a new road while essential to our community, is unfortunately not viewed as a priority for the local nor national government. However people living here have been waiting for too long and finally through our hard work and efforts we are so close to making our dream a reality!

With your kind donation of US$10 or whatever you can pledge, we will finally be able to see the fruition of our efforts. Little by little we will strive to collect what we need to complete the project, and as a show of gratitude there will be rewards for all those who support our cause. We kindly invite you to see the reward section of our page for further information.

There is the haunting possibility that we are not able to raise these essential funds, and in such case the construction of our road would be indefinitely delayed. After all our efforts this would be such a shame as neighbors would have to reschedule work appointments and local residents including children would have to endure the hazards and annoyances of the current dirt road.

In our minds we can already see a clean and fixed road where children can walk to school and people can commute to work without the current dangers or hazards that the dirt road presents. We have just one more month to continue our efforts to raise the necessary funds to complete the road. We are already doing bingos, raffles, events and all that we can to see the road completed, but without your help this will be very hard to accomplish. You can help us complete what we have started as a community, you can help grant safe access to thousands of local residents and children alike. We plan to open our new road by November 1st, and with your kind help we can see this dream become a reality!

Impact

Until now, the dirt road and lack of municipal concern had left the neighborhood feeling powerless. Before we were begging municipal authorities to take charge without any success. However, as a united force, we are so close to finishing the job. Your contribution to this dream will be deeply appreciated and essential to helping us construct a hazard free road for all.

It is difficult to truly measure the impact of this project on our society and our country. However we can sincerely say that a better road will create a healthy change in people’s lives. We have seen how the current improvements we have made on the road have brought a better life for children and adults alike. This important road will have a hugely positive impact on our community and the interactions of the public and private sector, but even more than that it will serve as a symbol of development and inspiration to our community and Guatemala as a country.  Building this road with our own resources and your kind help, will also give a sense of empowerment to the citizens in our community and serve as an example of how local residents can take charge of community issues in the face of adversity and make a positive contributing force towards local communal development.


french

FRANCAIS

Chemin pour tout!

Nous sommes un comité de la communauté née à l'initiative d’Intellego Learning Center créé pour trouver une solution permanente à la situation de la route de terre. Cette route est importante pour beaucoup de gens, comme c’est utilisé  pour accéder à l'école, à la coopérative d'exportation de légumes qui réunit les agriculteurs locaux, et les différents quartiers, incluse le cimetière général. Nous sommes le "Comité Pro-Chemin" formé par des parents, les voisins et les autorités d’Intellego Learning Center, Santiago Sacatepéquez.

Santiago Sacatepéquez est une petite communauté dans les hauteurs du Guatemala. Fondée en 1540, la population de cette ville est d'environ 30. 000, principalement des autochtones de l'ethnie kaqchikel. Les habitants travaillent dans l'agriculture et le commerce. Environ 49%  des habitants souffrent de la pauvreté et 25% d'analphabétisme. Il y a quelques années, cette ville a été considérée comme une zone rurale, mais avec la croissance métropolitaine, l’endroit  est maintenant considéré comme une ville semi-rurale, qui doit encore se développer et construire des infrastructures. De plus, nos habitants manquent de fonds municipaux pour la construction de la route principale. Bien que nous traversions une situation économique  difficile, Santiago a de nombreuses attractions touristiques et ses habitants se réunissent chaque année pour célébrer une grande fête des cerfs-volants géants.

Pour les habitants, autochtones principalement,  les «confréries» sont  la façon de travailler ensemble et de célébrer les différentes traditions. L'un de ces festivals est Le Festival des cerfs-volants géants, est célébrée le 1er Novembre de chaque année. Cette fête est célébrée 116 ans et les familles participent à la conception et la création de cerfs-volants géants multicolores (voir photo ci-dessus). Les cerfs-volants peuvent être de 15 cm jusqu'à 15 mètres de long. Quelques années les cerfs-volants étaient aussi grand que 20 mètres de diamètre. Les cerfs-volants sont créés dans les lieux publics ou dans les écoles municipales. Du papier coloré chinois, colle, ruban et le bambou sont utilisés pour créer de belles œuvres d'art. Ce festival est une expérience unique pour les touristes  nationales et internationales.

Nous tenons à terminer la construction de cette route. Pendant de nombreuses années, les habitants ont demandé aux autorités municipales de résoudre ce problème, mais la ville manque d'argent pour des raisons différentes, et donc l'amélioration de ce lieu a été laissée de côté pendant une longue période. Cette année, notre communauté organisée par le Comité est maintenant en train de recueillir de l'argent pour réparer la route avec ‘’aide des entreprises de la région, les parents, l'école, les voisins et la ville. Cependant, il y a encore US$ 20 000 qui manque pour a terminer.

Avec votre soutien, nous pouvons améliorer l'environnement et le paysage de cette petite ville apportant de l'énergie renouvelée  et des opportunités nouvelles  pour habitants.

Pour  construire la route on a besoin d’unte totale de US$  90,000 et avec le soutien des entreprises et des individus dans la région nous avons réussi à recueillir US $ 70,000. Par conséquent, nous avons  besoin  encore US $ 20.000. Guatemala a vécu les  conditions politiques et économiques très difficiles. Bon nombre des problèmes n’ont pas été prise en considération  par les autorités. Dans cette situation, la construction d'une petite route est loin d'être une priorité pour le gouvernement local et national. Cependant, les habitants  ont attendu longtemps et maintenant sont  proches de la faire une réalité!

Vous pouvez nous aider en nous donnant US $10 ou plus. Peu à peu, nous recueillerons ce que nous avons besoin et, bien sûr, nous avons pensé à des récompenses pour les personnes qui soutiennent notre cause vous pourriez être intéressé de voir la section des récompenses.

Bien sûr, il y a la possibilité que nous ne recevions pas tout l'argent nécessaire.  Dans ce cas, la construction de cette route pourrait prendre plus de temps et les voisins devront  rapporter le travail et assumer les risques et les tracas d'avoir une route en mauvais état.

Dans notre esprit, nous pouvons voir un chemin propre et fini où les enfants peuvent aller à l'école et les habitants peuvent aller travailler chaque jour sans inconvénient. Nous avons un mois de plus pour aller à la recherche de différents possibilités  pour recueillir de l'argent,  - nous faisons déjà des bingos, des tombolas  et  des autres événements. D'une certaine manière nous avons mis notre objectif de collecter tout l'argent dont nous avons besoin. Nous prévoyons d'ouvrir notre nouveau chemin le 1 Novembre.

Impact

Jusqu'à présent, les voisins ont senti l’impuissance devant le manque d'intérêt municipal. Nous avons simplement prié pour que les autorités municipales prennent  le relais, sans succès. Cependant, comme une force unie, nous sommes sur le point de finir le travail. Votre contribution à ce rêve serait appréciée et utile et nous aiderons  aider avoir chemin propre et sans  danger pour tout le monde.

Il est difficile de mesurer réellement l'impact de ce projet dans notre société et notre pays. Pourtant, nous pouvons dire honnêtement que ce travail a créer un changement positif dans la vie des habitants. Nous avons vu les améliorations que nous avons faites sur la route actuelle et lesquelles ont apportées une vie meilleure pour les enfants et les adultes dans cette première phase. Cette route importante aura un impact positif sur l'environnement de la communauté et les interactions avec des secteurs publics et privés sont un symbole de développement nécessaire au Guatemala. La construction de cette route avec nos propres ressources et l'assistance, donnera également un sens de l'autonomisation des citoyens de notre communauté et nous fournir un exemple de bonne pratique de la façon dont nous pouvons prendre en charge nos affaires communautaires  et de contribuer au développement soutenable.
story_txt:
Cliquez ici pour le français!
Versión Idioma Español
                                                         
We are a communal committee born through the initiative of our local bilingual school (Intellego Learning Center) in Santiago Sacatepéquez, Guatemala. Our sole purpose is to find a permanent solution to repairing and improving an important public road in our local community. This road is essential for many people in our community since it is needed to access our local school attended by over 700 students, a vegetable exportation cooperative, which gathers vegetables from local farmers and different neighborhoods thus supporting the local economy, and the houses of local residences. We are the "Comité Pro-Camino" formed by parents, neighbors and the authorities of Intellego Learning Center Santiago Sacatepéquez. We dearly hope you can support our community cause.The road we would like to build in Santiago Sacatepequez, Guatemala is imperative to the local community. Its current condition is no more than a dirt road full of potholes, which presents many hazards to people both walking and driving on it, including transport difficulties for both local residents, children and authorities alike. For many years residents have pleaded with municipal authorities to fix this road, but due to the towns other needs, a severe lack of money and several other reasons, the improvement of this road has been indefinitely delayed and is now long overdue. This year our community took the initiative to organize itself through this committee and has now started collecting money to fix the road. Parents from the school, neighbors and local businesses are all doing their best to help out. However we are still lacking the crucial US$20,000 needed to finish its construction.












Santiago Sacatepéquez is a small community in the highlands of Guatemala. Founded in 1540 the population of this town is around 30,000, consisting of predominantly indigenous people from the Kaqchikel ethnic group working in agriculture and commerce. Poverty is around 49% and illiteracy 25%. Some years ago this town was considered to be a rural area, but metropolitan growth has extended these areas making our town of Santiago a semi-rural one, in dire need of development and the building of further infrastructure to support our growing community. Moreover our town lacks the municipal funds needed from the local government to construct a main communal road, so we have been forced to raise money in every way we can to improve the condition of one of our communities major transport routes. Even though we are going through this tough situation, Santiago has several tourist attractions including the Giant Kite Festival, where its people unite and organize themselves to celebrate this local community event each year.
For the mainly indigenous people in our community, the Giant Kite Festival, celebrated on November 1st every year is a great way to work together celebrating an important part of our culture and strengthening communal bonds. This festival has been celebrated for some 116 years and families participating design and create giant multicolored kites (see picture above). Kites can range from 15cms to 15mts long, and some years they have created kites as big as 20mts in diameter. The colorful kites are made in communal spaces or in municipal schools and  are flown on the municipal cemetery grounds to the enjoyment of both locals and foreigners alike.

                                                     

     

With your kind support we will be able to improve a major road in our small town, bringing renewed positive energy and opportunities to its people. The new road would improve the lives of thousands of local residents and businesses breathing economic life back into our community!


               

To fund the
construction of this road we needed to raise around $90,000 and with the
support of businesses and local residents we have managed to collect US$70,000.
This is a great accomplishment for our small community, however we are still
lacking the essential US$20,000 needed to pay the construction company which
has already started the job. As you may know Guatemala is a third world
country, which has been facing trying circumstances not only in the political
realm but also economically. Many local issues that we believe our essential to
the working of our local community have now been put on the back burner by our authorities
and are on the verge of collapsing. Therefore, the construction of a new road while
essential to our community, is unfortunately not viewed as a priority for the
local nor national government. However people living here have been waiting for
too long and finally through our hard work and efforts we are so close to
making our dream a reality!
With your kind
donation of US$10 or whatever you can pledge, we will finally be able to see
the fruition of our efforts. Little by little we will strive to collect what we
need to complete the project, and as a show of gratitude there will be rewards
for all those who support our cause. We kindly invite you to see the reward
section of our page for further information.
There is the haunting
possibility that we are not able to raise these essential funds, and in such
case the construction of our road would be indefinitely delayed. After all our
efforts this would be such a shame as neighbors would have to reschedule work appointments
and local residents including children would have to endure the hazards and
annoyances of the current dirt road.
In our minds we
can already see a clean and fixed road where children can walk to school and
people can commute to work without the current dangers or hazards that the dirt
road presents. We have just one more month to continue our efforts to
raise the necessary funds to complete the road. We are already doing bingos,
raffles, events and all that we can to see the road completed, but without your
help this will be very hard to accomplish. You can help us complete what we
have started as a community, you can help grant safe access to thousands of
local residents and children alike. We plan to open our new road by November 1st,
and with your kind help we can see this dream become a reality!
Impact
Until now, the dirt
road and lack of municipal concern had left the neighborhood feeling powerless.
Before we were begging municipal authorities to take charge without any
success. However, as a united force, we are so close to finishing the job. Your
contribution to this dream will be deeply appreciated and essential to helping
us construct a hazard free road for all.
It is difficult to
truly measure the impact of this project on our society and our country.
However we can sincerely say that a better road will create a healthy change in
people’s lives. We have seen how the current improvements we have made on the
road have brought a better life for children and adults alike. This important
road will have a hugely positive impact on our community and the interactions
of the public and private sector, but even more than that it will serve as a
symbol of development and inspiration to our community and Guatemala as a
country.  Building this road with our own resources and your kind help,
will also give a sense of empowerment to the citizens in our community and serve
as an example of how local residents can take charge of community issues in the
face of adversity and make a positive contributing force towards local communal
development.

story:
Help Support Theatre of Lights

Since 2009, Old Sacramento has celebrated Christmas, the holidays and the history of our region with Theatre of Lights, and made it free to the public. In fact it has become the largest free family-friendly Christmas celebration in the region. Every year, for 45 performances over 23 nights, families, couples and friends gather to see a spectacular light and sound show that recounts the early days of our region and introduces a new generation to the classic American poem "The Night Before Christmas."  Produced by Stage Nine Exhibit Design along with Sacramento Theatrical Lighting and Associated Sound.  Theatre of Lights is a truly amazing and hard to describe for those who have never experienced it.

The event is presented by more than a hundred local family-owned businesses in Old Sacramento, who offer unique and diverse dining, shopping and entertainment options. 

It's About Community

When people hear about Theatre of Lights, they often ask "How much are tickets?"  We've been proud that since 2009, we've been able to say "Free!"  And many who come say "Let us know how we can support Theatre of Lights."

While we've never charged for tickets or passed a hat, this year we'd like to give you an opportunity to help us keep producing Theatre of Lights for free and to continue to improve and innovate the production.

Every year our amazing creative team continues to improve and innovate the show, developing new characters and improving set pieces and special effects, so there are always surprises.

We've set a goal

Every year, 70,000 people see Theatre of Lights.  That's well over a quarter million people since 2009.  For our seventh season, we'd like to get at least 200 people for whom Theatre of Lights has become a family holiday tradition to make a $25 donation.  By supporting Theatre of Lights, you're helping to keep this event a Sacramento tradition for your family and for others.

Thank you.
